Ahora José trabaja en su tienda desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h00 de lunes a domingo, comprar arroz a $ 0.25 la libra y la vende a $ 0.30, colas a $ 0.28 y las vende a $ 0.35 c/u y aceites a $ 1.80 y los vende a $ 2.20 c/u una de las mayores dificultades es la delincuencia ya que no dejan que la tienda prospere, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio a veces pero para sacar mas ingresos para su familia ella se dedica a la venta de legumbres, no tienen hijos porque primero quieren asegurar su futuro.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz a $ 25.00 cada quintal, aceites a $ 22.00 cada caja y colas a $ 8.50 cada jaba, en el futuro poner otro local y seguir con su  negocio para poder asegurar el futuro de su familia y terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
José P. is 27 years old and lives in the area surrounding Guayaquil. He has water, sewage, and electricity at his home, and a paved road in front of it. His house is made of brick but he would like to continue building it. José started selling produce a long time ago after seeing all of his relatives prosper and become independent with similar businesses. José decided he wanted the same future. Today, José works at his store from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. seven days a week. He buys rice at $0.25 a Lb. and sells it at $0.30; soft drinks at $0.28 and sells them at $0.35 each; and oils at $1.80 and sells them at $2.20 each. One of the biggest problems is crime, which impedes the store from getting ahead. Sometimes, José's wife helps out with the business, but to help increase the family income, she sells vegetables. They don't have any kids because they want to have a secure future first. With the loan he is requesting, José wants to buy rice at $25.00 per "quintal" (46 Kg); oils at $22.00 per box; and soft drinks at $8.50 per crate. He would like to start another store and continue with his business to ensure a good future for his family and to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, soft drinks, and oils

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua D. is married and has one child. She has received a junior high education. Efua sells cooked rice with tomatoes sauce at Teterem near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2000. Her husband is a fisherman. Efua uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase raw rice and other ingredients for the preparation of the food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to use it to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase raw rice and other ingredients for the preparation of the food for sale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Mrs Kadiatu S. is married with three children, all boys. She is a resident of Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She travels to Guinea, a neighboring country, to purchase clothes to sell in Freetown.

With this new loan, Kadiatu hopes to expand her business so she will be able to meet her family's basic needs: pay her children’s school fees, and feed her family. She also hopes to open a savings account in the bank with the profit that will emanate from her sales.

loans.use: To purchase clothes from Guinea to sell in Freetown

loans.name: Phebean

texts.en:
Mrs Phebean K. is a 42-year-old widow with two children. She lives with them in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is left with the challenge of caring for her children.

Phebean is a member of LAPOSL group where she has been a member for more than a year. With her previous loan she expanded her business by purchasing more clothes, groundnut (peanut) oil, palm oil, rice, flour and sugar. She has concluded that this loan will be invested in the business in the same way.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, groundnut oil, palm oil, rice, flour and sugar

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 34 years old she is married and has three children. Two are in school while the last born is still breastfeeding. She is very hardworking and supportive to her husband in providing food and shelter for her household. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. in her neighborhood. She also sews clothing and gives her customers a new look. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, linen etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her husband in taking care of the home and their educational needs. She has been in this business for six years now.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuit etc.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Mrs Kadie F. is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She travels to Conarkry (the capital of Guinea, a neighbouring country) to buy jeans, bags, shoes and African wear to sell in Freetown.

Kadie is a member of LAPOSL group were she has obtained loans twice in the past. She opened a savings account with profit from her previous loan and she expanded her business by purchasing more African wear, jeans, bags, and shoes.

With this loan Kadie will enhance her business by purchasing more of the same goods.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, African wear, bags and shoes

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Mrs. Isatu K. is a 45 years old and is a married woman with two children: a male and a female. She resides in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She sells building timber and bags of coal in Freetown.

Isatu is a member of LAPOSL group based in Freetown, and she has obtained three previous loans from LAPOSL. With her previous loans, she expanded her business by purchasing more timber and bags of coal. She made an increased profit that allowed her to send her two children to school.

Isatu hopes to expand her business again with this new loan by purchasing more timber and bags of coal.

loans.use: To purchase more timber and bags of coal

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mrs. Mabinty M. is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone, with her husband and two children.

Mabinty is a member of LAPOSL group, and she has previously obtained two loans. With her previous loan she purchased more clothes for sale.

With this loan Mabinty hopes to break out of poverty by buying a plot of land from her increased business profit.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Mrs Salamatu K. is a 37-year-old woman who is married with three children: two male and one female. She resides with her family in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She sells palm oil, firewood and bags of coal in Freetown.

With her previous loan from LAPOSL, Salamatu expanded her business by purchasing more rubbers (plastic bottles) of palm oil, firewood and bags of coal.

With this loan she will purchase more of the same goods, in the hope of further expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil, firewood and bags of coal

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Mrs. Alimatu J. is a 38-year-old single lady with two children: a male and a female. She resides with her children in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone.

Alimatu is a member of LAPOSL group from which she has obtained three previous loans. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing more rubbers (plastic containers) of palm oil, used radios, shoes, bags of coal and firewood.

With this loan Alimatu will expand her business by purchasing more of the same goods. She hopes to use her profit to repay the loan and to contribute to the upkeep of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil, used radios, shoes, bags of coal, and firewood

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Ma Isabel G. es casada con el señor Ángel Guardián Sierra y son padres de familia de 2 niños, el labora en asociacion con una empresa contratista como pintor industrial, y su negocio lleva por nombre “Rótulos Mary “ya que a ese negocio se dedican como familia, además de este ingreso perciben otro que es el de pintura de automóviles, y para estos negocios están tramitando el crédito ya que desean invertir en mayor mercancía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel G. is married to Mr. Ángel Guardián Sierra; they have two children. Mr. Sierra works as an industrial painter as a subcontractor with a larger company. His company's name is “Rótulos Mary“ (Tags Mary) because this is a family business. Another source of income comes from their auto-painting business. The loan they are requesting today will be invested in improving these businesses by buying supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies for their painting businesses

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and the mother of one child who is currently in school. She is a 35 year old trader. She trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She lacks adequate working capital, so Ama can only buy a small quantity of lace materials and sells them through hawking. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi main market in bulk and sells them in pieces. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk quantity of lace materials and textile. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her child with a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase bulk quantity of lace materials and textile.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom are in school. Through her business, she has supported her elderly child to finish senior high school and he is still to continue his schooling. She lives with her husband who is also a merchant. Doris is a food vendor; she sells kenkey and fish in the community lorry station. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. Doris has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper.

Doris has been in business for the last two years so one can see that she persists to provide for her family. She said she enjoys doing this business because it brings her income and she feels she is working to support her family. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Doris takes delivery of stock, especially maize, from the nearby villagers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Luz Haydee

texts.es:
La señora LUZ HAYDEE R. D. L. tiene 60 años, vive en el distrito D. LAREDO, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LAREDO. La socia presenta estudios superiores técnicos D. corte y confección, es casada y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores e independientes. La socia se dedica a la confección D. ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar hilos, telas, cierres, etc. para confeccionar los uniformes D. las profesoras que tenía pendiente por atender.
Este crédito D. 1,500.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar telas, hilos, cierres, blondas, agujas, etc. para realizar los pedidos que tiene pendiente. Ella sueña con tener un taller D. costura amplio en donD. pueda realizar mas confecciones para trabajadores D. diferentes instituciones como: colegios, bancos, municipios, etc.
texts.en:
Luz Haydee R. D. L. is 60. She lives in the Laredo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Laredo Communal Bank. She has a post high school education in cutting out and making clothes. She is married and has five grown and independent children. She makes clothes for women, men, and children. With her first loan for 300 PEN she was able to buy thread, fabric, and zippers, etc. to make the order she had for uniforms for teachers. She will use this loan for 1,500 PEN to buy fabric, thread, zippers, lace, and pins, etc. to make the orders that she has. She dreams of having a large sewing shop where she can make more clothes for the workers in different institutions like schools, banks, and municipalities, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, zippers, and thread, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen C. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos menores hijos. Trabaja como asistente en una pequeña empresa, además su cónyuge la apoya realizando la actividad de taxista en su propio vehículo el cual adquirieron hace varios años con sus ahorros. Su casa se vió afectada por el terremoto del año 2007 por lo cual a la fecha han ido construyendo de manera progresiva, actualmente le falta techar el área construída por lo cual necesitan apoyo para culminar la construcción de dicho ambiente de su casa. Son personas muy trabajadoras que invierten en mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos. Su sueño es poder culminar la construccion de su casa totalmente. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen C. is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two young children. She works as an assistant in a small business and her husband helps out driving his very own taxi cab, which they bought many years ago with some savings. Carmen's house was affected by the 2007 earthquake and they have been re-building it little by little ever since. Right now, they have to add a roof to the already built area, and to finish this construction, they need help. Carmen and her husband are hardworking people who try to invest in the betterment of their and their kids' lives. Their dream is to completely finish building their home. They are grateful for the support we can provide.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making their home better

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora  ROSA S. A. tiene 53 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL ÉXITO II. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria.  Es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 1 depende  económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró pollos y alimento balanceado al por mayor.
Con este crédito de 1,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará pollos, patos y alimento balanceado al por mayor. Ella sueña con aumentar la crianza de sus animales para así vender con mayor frecuencia y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa S. A. is 53 years old and lives in the district of Trujillo, Trujillo province, La Libertad state, in Peru. She belongs to the Mujeres al Exito II communal bank. She completed school through the 5th year of secondary school. She lives with her partner and has 5 children, 1 of whom she supports. She raises and sells chickens. With her first loan of 300 soles she purchased chickens and animal feed wholesale. With this loan for 1,000 soles, she will purchase chickens, ducks and animal feed wholesale. She dreams of growing her livestock business so that she can sell more frequently and earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, ducks, and animal feed

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: S. Victorine est née en 1954 et vit depuis près de 35 ans à Hindé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DOSSOU-SOYON Christian, Victorine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Victorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Hindé. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Victorine n'a fait que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Victorine vend divers articles (riz, sardine, savons, liqueur, huile végétale, eau minérale, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) dans sa boutique size à Hindé. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Victorine s'approvisionne. Victorine a six ans d'expérience dans ce domaine et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Victorine a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu'elle avait obtenu auprès de ALIDé. En vue de renforcer son activité, afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Victorine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Victorine S. was born in 1954 and has lived for almost 35 years in Hindé à Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Christian Dossou-Soyon, Victorine is the mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Victorine lives together with her children and her husband in Hindé. The couple manages the family expenses together. Victorine only completed primary school. To meet her needs, Victorine sells various goods (rice, sardines, soaps, liquor, vegetable oil, mineral water, pastas, etc.) in her shop located in Hindé. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Victorine has six years of experience in this area and is on her third loan from ALIDé. Victorine has repaid the last two loans she obtained from ALIDé. Victorine is seeking a third loan through ALIDé in order to reinforce her activities and to better satisfy her customers,

Translated from French by Alex Cho, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of boxes of pasta, sacks of rice, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 35 years old. She is married with four children; two are currently in school. She has been married for some time now. Her husband works very hard to support her. Agnes enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her kids. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. However, she is constrained by low capital to make meaningful progress. She requests this loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her profit. She believes that, with her good customer relations, the loan will enable her to realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en: Iskandar S. sells home furniture in his shop in the centre of Imishli city. He started his business in 1996 and since that time has earned enough to build his own store. Iskandar's dream is to save enough money to pay for his wedding party. He has applied for a loan of 1,600 AZN to do repairs and make his shop more attractive to customers.

loans.use: To make repairs to his shop

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira M. is a hardworking woman. She is devoted to raising animals, especially cattle, which she buys and, after fattening, sells in the local market. In this manner, she obtains the income that she needs. Over many years, this has allowed her to earn enough income to help her husband with the family expenses. In order to increase her income and revitalize her business, Elmira is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to purchase calves. This will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of her four children.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans la vente de charbons de bois et de maïs dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Depuis d’elle a débuté ce commerce, elle aide financièrement son son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs 04  enfants. Elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail. En cette période de fin d’année, elle enregistre une rupture de stocks pour ses sacs de maïs ; et c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 08 sacs de maïs ; le prêt lui permettra également d’acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est très bien connue de nombreuses personnes.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is specialized in selling charcoal and corn in the Agoè district in Lomé.  Since beginning this business, she has been helping her husband financially in providing an education for their four children.  She sells as much wholesale as she does retail.   During this year-end period, she has noted a shortage in her inventory of corn.  And for this reason, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy eight sacks of corn.  The loan will also allow her to buy twenty sacks of charcoal.  She is very well-known by numerous people.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn and of charcoal

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es: Doña Daisy tiene 45 años de edad, mujer trabajadora y organizadora de su propio negocio, modista desde hace quince años, desde joven estudio costura y luego para modista con apoyo de su esposo, procreo dos hijos uno trabaja y el otro estudia, su esposo es sastre y ambos han logrado alquilar un local para hacer los vestido, faldas, camisa, cobertores y todo lo que el cliente pida, dan al crédito a personas conocidas, pero su mayor anhelo es poder tener su propio taller y no estar pagando ya abecés no se vende lo suficiente. Con este crédito lo que desea comprar es materia prima para trabajar como: telas de colores variadas, botones, Ciper,  hilos, bordados, madeja, entre otros para hacer sus bonitos variada vestidos. Lo que espera poder vender más en esta navidad. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con su financiamiento el cual es de mucho beneficio para crecer en su sastrería con la venta y la atracción de clientes nuevos que espera captar.
texts.en:
Daisy is 45 years old, a hardworking woman who has started her own business. She studied sewing as a young woman and became a seamstress 15 years ago with the help of her husband. Daisy has two children, one of whom works and one of whom is a student. Her husband is a tailor, and both have managed to rent a place where they sew dresses, skirts, shirts, quilts and whatever else customers ask for. They even offer payment plans to well known customers. Daisy and her husband's biggest dream is to have their own workshop and not have to pay rent since sometimes they can't sell enough to cover it. With this loan, they would like to buy raw materials, such as brightly colored fabrics, buttons, zippers, thread, embroidering materials, yarn, etc. to make a variety of pretty dresses, which they hope to sell more of this Christmas. They would like to thank the institution for the support it has provided with this loan, which has benefited their workshop greatly, helping it grow in sales and become a bigger attraction to new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials to make dresses

loans.name: Moussiratou

texts.fr: Cette femme appris la couture ; elle a donc ouvert depuis 1999 dans le quartier d’Agoè Logopé à Lomé son atelier de couture. Cette dame n’est pas mariée et c’est cette activité qui lui permet surtout de se prendre en charge et de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. En cette période de fin d’année, ses activités connaissent de fortes affluences ; pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 02 machines à coudre. Beaucoup de ses clientes apprécient la qualité de ses travaux. Elle n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This is a woman who has learned how to sew.  So she opened her own workshop in 1999 in the Agoè Logopé district in Lomé.  This lady is not married, and her business is what enables her in particular to be responsible for herself and to provide for most of her needs.  During this year-end period, her business is experiencing a rush.  For this reason, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy two sewing machines.  Many customers appreciate the quality of her work.  She has no children to support. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Two sewing machines

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: La señora MARIA MARGARITA P. tiene 39 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL ÉXITO II. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra en especial de fierro, el cual lleva Lima a vender. Este es su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para comprar mayor cantidad de fierro al por mayor para que pueda aumenta su ganancia. Ella sueña con poder enviar fierro a Lima una vez por semana para así generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita P. is 39 years old. She lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, state of La Libertad, in Peru. She belongs to the Mujeres al Exito II communal bank. She completed school through her 5th year of secondary school. She is a single mother with two children, one of whom she supports. Her business is buying and selling scrap metal, especially iron, which she takes to Lima to sell. This is her first loan for 300 soles which she will use to buy larger quantities of iron wholesale so that she can increase her earnings. She dreams of being able to send iron to Lima once weekly in order to be able to generate higher income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of iron scrap

loans.name: Eddys Edgardo

texts.es: El señor Eddys López es un padre de familia que ha construido su propio negocio una miscelánea para tener fijo sus ingresos, tiene 39 años de edad, casado, con tres hijos de los cuales espera hacer buenos hombres en la educación, junto a su esposa administran el negocio, anteriormente trabajaba en zapatería, luego compro una unidad de taxi el cual trabajo, pero casi siempre estaba malo el negocio y por eso decide vender el carro y invirtió en su negocio que le ha salido mas rentable y apoyado junto a su familia, por gracias a Dios ha logrado mantener el equilibrio ya que muchos meses están bajas las ventas pero siempre se vende, con la ayuda de los financiamiento ha logrado comprar muchos productos como: productos enlatados, sardina, atún, shampoo, cereales, productos plástico, cosmético y una variedad, para la atracción  y sastifacion del cliente. Con este préstamo invertirá en productos navideños como adornos, gorros, ropa, golosinas productos de condimentos, pollo, cereales y una variedad de productos que espera vender mucho en estos meses. Contento por el apoyo que gracias Afodenic esta siendo posible su incremento.
texts.en:
Mr. Eddy López is the father of three children who has started his own business, a food market, to have a fixed income. He is 39 years old, is married, and he hopes to make good men out of his children through education. Eddy and his wife manage the business together. Before, he worked in a shoe shop. After that, he bought and drove a taxi, but sold it because the business was bad. Instead, he invested the money in his business, for which he counts with the support of his family. Sometimes, sales are low, but thank God he has achieved a balance and can always sell something. With the loans he has requested, he has been able to increase the variety of products he sells, such as canned goods, sardines, tuna, shampoo, cereal, products made of plastic, make-up and cosmetics, etc. With this loan, Eddy will buy an assortment of Christmas products such as ornaments and decorations, hats, clothes, sweets and candy, condiments, chickens, cereal and a variety of other products that he hopes to sell lots of this holiday season. Eddy is happy that thanks to Kiva partner Afodenic, increasing his income is becoming a possibility.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying Christmas season products

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. Currently seven are in school in the community where they live. Akosua loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood.  She has been selling cassava and plantain for six years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of food items from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy plantain and cassava in bulk to supply her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a supply of tubers of cassava in bulk

loans.name: Rosario Melina

texts.es:
La señora ROSARIO MELINA U. A. tiene 31 años, vive en el distrito de LAREDO, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LAREDO. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, está casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró cosméticos como: colonias, perfumes, shampoo, delineadores, cremas, labiales.
Con este crédito de 3,000.00 nuevos soles lo utilizara para la compra de mas productos de cosméticos como: labiales, talco, polvos, colonias, perfumes, joyas. Ella sueña con adecuar un espacio en su domicilio en donde pueda exhibir y vender sus productos con mayor frecuencia.
texts.en:
Rosario Melina U. A. is 31 years old. She lives in the Laredo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad state, Peru. She completed school through the 5th year of secondary school. She is married and has two children whom she supports. Her business is selling cosmetics. With her first loan of 300 soles she purchased cosmetics such as colognes, perfumes, shampoo, eyeliners, creams, and lipstick. With this loan for 3,000 soles she will purchased more cosmetics such as lipstick, talcum powder, powders, colognes, perfumes, and jewelry. She dreams of fixing up a space in her home where she can display and sell her products more frequently.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcchase of lipstick, talcum powder, powder, colognes, perfumes, jewelry .

loans.name: Glenda Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Glenda tiene 33 años de edad, junto con su esposo apoyan a sus cuatros hijos para que puedan cursar sus estudios, su esposo es dueño de un taxi el cual trabaja por su propia cuenta en los horarios establecidos de la cooperativa, la señora glenda durante seis años se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos,  venta de prendas de plata y productos de la Avon, durante estos años ha logrado captar clientes con los cuales trabaja al crédito con pago de quince días, a si como sus ventas al contado, que están bajas, pero espera en estos meses poder ofertar mas sus productos y que las ventas se eleven para poder tener su equilibrio. Con este financiamiento comprara prendas de plata, ropa,  prendas zafiro, cosmético y poder tener variedad para incrementar las ventas que es su objetivo. Sus planes a futuro es poder terminar de construir su casa en mejores condiciones para dar a su familia un techo digno.
texts.en:
Glenda is 33 years old. Together with her husband, she supports their four children so that they can continue studying. Her husband owns a taxi, which he drives himself according to the schedule the union establishes. For the last six years, Glenda has sold clothes, cosmetics, silver jewelry, and Avon products, and she has many loyal clients, some of whom pay her in installments every 15 days. Her cash sales are low, but she hopes to offer more products in the coming months, thus increasing her sales. With this loan, Glenda wants to buy more silver jewelry, clothes, sapphire items, and cosmetics to increase the assortment of products and, in turn, her sales. Her future plans include finishing the construction of her home in order to give her family a dignified place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy phone and subscription cards

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is married with five children, between the ages of 4 months and 11 years. He runs a retail shop called Baba Faith, selling unga (flour), sukari (sugar), majani (tea leaves), and cooking fat. He's been in business for three years and has one employee. He also earns some income from masonry work. He requested this loan from Faulu for Kes. 30,000 to buy cereals, cooking fat, and sugar for Kes. 10,000 each. 

He describes himself as hardworking and says that since he became a member of Faulu, he has begun saving money. In the future, he hopes to expand the business into a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy cereals, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora  ANA MARIA O. R. tiene 38 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal CARIDAD II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 5to de secundaria, está separada y tiene 1 hijo de 5 años quien depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios en la bodega que tiene en su casa. Este es su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para la compra de gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor. Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio para lo cual esta ahorrando.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana Maria is 38 years old and lives in the Porvenir district in the Trujillo province in the Libertand area of Peru and is part of the Caridad II communal bank. She has a high school education, is separated and has one 5 year old son who depends on her. She sells food products out of her home-based store. This is her first loan of 300PEN ($125 US) which she will use to invest mostly in soft drinks and beer for resale. She is saving up and hopes to be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas and beer for resale

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en el cuarto ciclo del proyecto Mujeres Emprendedoras y sus integrantes se encuentran muy satisfechos por esta iniciativa que proviene D. la Fundación  ya son mujeres D. escasos recursos  y conseguir un crédito para trabajar se hace imposible para ellas. Mediante la ayuda crediticia que brindada  por la Fundación cada una pudo comenzar, seguir y mejorar la actividad que realiza. 
Se pueD.  hablar D. la Sra. Hilda B. D. 46 años D. edad , tiene 1 hijo estudiante D. nivel terciarios, Hilda trabaja fuera D. su casa  pero los fines D. semana ella prepara comestible y lo venD. en frente a su casa .Es una señora luchadora que se dedica a múltiple actividades para ayudar con los gastos D. la casa. 
Tiene una casita pequeña , que desearía ampliar para para abrir una despensa y dar vianda, agradece por la ayuda recibida.
Las actividades que cada integrante realiza.
Myriam A. R.. Venta dezapatos y carteras
Maria Del Carmen G.. Pèluquera
Sabina Lopez Notario. Venta D. merceria
Lidia M. InsaurralD. N.Venta  D. carbòn
Cinthia n. F. R.Venta D. Ropas
Maria B.R..Venta D. frutas 
Claudia R.G..Venta D. comestible
Noelia C. S..Venta D. empanadas
Marta S. M.Venta D. ropas
Nilda I. D..Venta D. plateria
Miryan E. Agüero.Venta D. ropas
Maura C. A..Venta D. Tele Bingo
Maria L. V..Modista
Justina G. M..Venta D. lenceria
Hilda J. B..Venta D. cosmestibles
Miryan T..Venta D. comidas
Karen M. Mendez.Venta D. cosmeticos
Amelia C. G..Venta D. comidas
texts.en:
This group is currently in the fourth round of loans with the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) Project and its members are very satisfied with this initiative from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya because they are low-income women for whom obtaining working capital is impossible. Thanks to the credit provided by the Fundación, each member could start, continue, and make better the activities they carry on. For example, we can talk about Mrs. Hilda B., who is 46 years old and has a son attending college. Hilda works outsiD. her home, but on weekends, she prepares food to sell in front of her house. She is a strong woman who carries on multiple activities to help with the household's expenses. Hilda has a small little house to which she would love to make additions to open a convenience store and start a catering business. She is grateful for the help she has received. Each member has the following businesses: Myriam A. R.. Selling shoes and bags Maria del Carmen G.. Hair salon Sabina Lopez Notario. Selling buttons, ribbons, and other notions Lidia M. InsaurralD. N. Selling coal Cinthia N. F. R.Selling clothes Maria B.R.. Selling fruit Claudia R.G..Selling food items Noelia C. S.. Selling "empanadas" (turnovers) Marta S. M. Selling clothes Nilda I. D.. Selling silver items Miryan E. Agüero. Selling clothes Maura C. A.. Selling lottery tickets Maria L. V.. Seamstress Justina G. M.. Selling lingerie Hilda J. B.. Selling make-up and cosmetics Miryan T.. Selling food items Karen M. M.. Selling make-up and cosmetics Amelia C. G.. Selling food items

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to increase their sales

loans.name: Sahada

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de céréales dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet non seulement de se prendre en charge, mais aussi de subvenir aux besoins de ses 02 enfants. Elle vend en effet du maïs, de l’arachide et du mil. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays à des dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. Elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail. En ce moment elle veut prévenir une éventuelle rupture de stocks ; raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 08 sacs de maïs, 13 sacs d’arachides, 09 sacs de mils. Le reste du prêt servira à couvrir ses frais de transport vers le lieu d’approvisionnement. Cette femme n’est pas mariée.
texts.en:
This woman's source of income is selling grains in the Agoè quarter of Lomé. This activity allows her to cover her own expenses as well as cater to the needs of her two children. She sells corn, peanuts and millet and gets her supply in the central part of the country, tens of kilometers away from Lomé. She sells both wholesale and retail and would like to avoid running out of stock, which is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 8 bags of corn, 13 bags of peanuts and 9 bags of millet. The remainder of the loan will help cover her transportation costs to the supplier location. This woman is not married.

Translated from French by Owen Frivold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags of corn, peanuts, millet and other products

loans.name: Maura Veronica

texts.es:
La señora MAURA VERÓNICA A. P. tiene 35  años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal CARIDAD II. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la crianza de pollos para su posterior comercialización en un mercado cercano a su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar pollos bebes.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará pollos y alimento balanceado al por mayor . Ella sueña con aumentar la crianza de sus pollos y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ms. Maura Veronica is 35 years old and lives in the Porvenir district in the Trujillo province in the Libertand area of Peru and is part of the Caridad II communal bank. She has a high school education, is in a live-in relationship and has three children, two of which depend on her. She raises chickens which are then sold in the market near her home. She used her first loan of 300 PEN (~$125 US) to buy chicks. She will use the 800 PEN ($300) from this loan to buy more chicks and nutritionally balanced feed. She would like to increase the number of chickens raised and thus increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Cette femme a à sa charge 02 enfants. Elle est veuve et assure aux besoins de ses enfants grâce à ses activités de coiffure. En effet, elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure depuis 1999  et dispose de nombreuses clientes qui apprécient la qualité de son travail. En cette période de fin d’année, elle a besoin de renouveler son stock de mèches ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 cartons de mèches. Le reste du prêt servira à couvrir d’autres frais.
texts.en:
Adjovi V. L. is responsible for two children. She is a widow and is able to provide for her children thanks to her hairdressing business. She opened her salon in 1999 and does the hair of many clients who appreciate the quality of her work. During this time, at the end of the year, she needs to refresh her supply of hair extensions. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan from WAGES, to purchase 15 boxes of hair extensions. The remaining funds from the loan will serve to cover her other expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products for a salon

loans.name: Francisca Saturnina

texts.es:
La señora FRANCISCA SATURNINA N. V.  tiene 48 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal UNIDAS POR SIEMPRE II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 6to de primaria, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ajos.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró ajos al por mayor.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles, también piensa comprar ajos de la sierra al por mayor para luego vender en el mercado y también a sus vecinos así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ms. Francisca Saturnina is 48 years old and lives in the Porvenir district in the Trujillo province in the Libertand area of Peru and is part of the "Unidas por Siempre II" communal bank. She has an elementary school education, is in a live-in relationship and has four children, three of whom depend on her. She buys and sells garlic. She used her first loan of 300 PEN (~$125 US) to buy garlic in bulk. She will use the 800 PEN ($300) from this loan to buy bulk garlic from the grower, which she will sell in the marketplace and to her neighbors in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bulk garlic for resale

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: La señora Ofelia Z. Z. es casada con el señor Juan Pablo Falcón y son propietarios de un negocio de nombre “Abarrotes Falcón “establecido desde hace 4 años, el labora para una empresa de venta de frituras desde hace 4 años, y están tramitando este crédito para una inversión en compra de mercancía por mayoreo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ofelia Z. Z. is married to Mr. Juan Pablo Falcón; they own a business named "Falcón Groceries" which they established four years ago. Juan Pablo has also worked for four years in a company that produces fried snacks, and he and Ofelia have been attempting to get this loan so that they can buy products at wholesale quantities for their business.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wholesale supplies to sell in their business

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena F. de 46 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Masahuat, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante y también vive junto a sus dos hijos los cuales son estudiantes. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, así mismo posee una pupusería la cual esta ubicada a las afueras de su casa. Cada día maría Elena abre su tienda y saca la cocina frente a su hogar para disponerse a hacer pupusas, las cuales las vende cada tarde y que vende mucho ya que ella es reconocida por ser una persona muy responsable la cual se esfuerza por hacer un excelente trabajo, ya que su mayor deseo es poder brindar ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de sus hijos. María junto a su esposo sueñan con poder brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos pagando los estudios de ellos. Es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo a través de cual pueda surtir la tienda y comprar materia prima para hacer más pupusas.
texts.en:
María Elena F. is 46 years old and lives in San Pedro Masahuat, in the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who is a businessman, and her two children, who are students. She owns a store from which she sells basic household items. She also owns a "pupuseria" (a stall from which she sells "pupusas" - tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, pork, etc.) which is located right outside her home. Every day, María Elena opens her store, takes the grill out on the street, and gets ready to make "pupusas" which she sells every afternoon. She sells lots of them because she is well recognized as being a responsible and hardworking person and for doing an excellent job. Her biggest dream is to be able to help her husband with the household expenses and their children's studies. María and her husband dream of giving their kids a bright future by paying for their education. This is why she is requesting this loan - so that she can re-stock her store and buy ingredients to make more "pupusas."

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients to make food; restocking her store

location.town: San Pedro Masahuat, Departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Brenda Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Brenda Elizabeth es casada y tiene 2 hijos una en edad escolar y otro  pequeñito de apenas 2 meses, ellos son una familia joven pero muy trabajadora, ella labora para un banco prestamista y el para una empresa como supervisor, y están tramitando este crédito para la construcción de un cuarto en el frente de su vivienda para mayor comodidad de la familia.
texts.en:
Brenda Elizabeth is married and has two children who are of school age, and a baby who is barely two months old. They are a young, but hardworking family. She works for a lending bank, and her husband works as a supervisor. They are requesting this loan to build a new room in their home so that their family would be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building an additional room in their home

loans.name: Akua

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des denrées alimentaires dans le quartier d’Agoè Cacavéli à Lomé. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2003 à Lomé et cette activité lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari dans l’éducation de leurs 02 enfants. Elle vend des tomates naturelles, des gombos, des piments, du riz, de l’arachide et divers autres produits. En ce moment elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 paniers de tomates, 01 panier de gombos, 01 panier de piment, 02 sacs de riz, 01 sac d’arachide et divers autres produits.
texts.en:
This woman generates her income through the sale of food staples in the Agoè Cacavéli quarter of Lomé. She entered this business in 2003 in Lomé, and it enables her to give her husband financial support for the education of their two children. She sells natural tomatoes, okra, chilli peppers, rice, peanuts and various other products. She is currently seeking a loan from WAGES in order to buy three baskets of tomatoes, a basket of okra, another of chilli peppers, two sacks of rice, one sack of peanuts and various other products.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of tomatoes, okra, chilli peppers, rice, peanuts and various other products

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael Antonio C. de 47 años de edad, reside en Zacatecoluca en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposa y sus dos pequeñas hijas de 6 y 5 años de edad. Él posee una venta de frutas y verduras las cuales las vende de manera ambulante por las calles de Zacatecoluca. Rafael tiene el deseo de ver crecer su negocio, ya que con el tiempo que cuenta de poseerlo es poco lo que ha logrado surtirlo. Es por esto que Rafael solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el capital necesario para comprar frutas y verduras al por mayor y de esta manera poder brindar mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes. Rafael solícita el préstamo con el fin de poder aumentar sus ventas y de esta manera poder darles una vida mejor a sus dos hija y su esposa, ya que para él ellas son la razón por la cual se esfuerza día con día.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio C. is 47 years old and resides in Zacatecoluca in the department of La Paz. He lives together with his wife and their two daughters who are 5 and 6 years old. He owns a fruit and vegetable stand where he sells traveling the streets of Zacatecoluca. Rafael has the dream to see his business grow so that with time he is counting on owning it. It is for this that Rafael is requesting a loan through which he can count on the necessary business capital to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale and in this way, can provide a greater quantity of products to his clients. Rafael is soliciting this loan so in the end he can increase his sales. In this way, he can give his two daughters and wife a better life since for him, they are the reason for which he works hard day-in day-out.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: M'bé

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans la vente de charbons de bois ; elle exerce ce commerce dans le quartier d’Adouba Agoè à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de se prendre en charge et de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. Elle dispose de nombreux clients qui apprécient la qualité de son charbon ; elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail. En ce moment son stock est en baisse ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 sacs de charbons. Le reste du crédit lui permettra de couvrir ses frais de transport vers l’intérieur du pays.
texts.en:
This woman specialises in selling charcoal; she practices her business in the Adouba Agoé area in Lomé. This activity allows her to take charge of herself and satisfies most of her needs. She has numerous customers who appreciate the quality of her charcoal; she sells it wholesale as well as retail. At present her stock is decreasing, which is why she has asked WAGES for a loan to buy 50 bags of charcoal. The remainder of the loan will cover her transportation costs inside the country.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria tiene 53 años de edad, vive en barrio de la capital de Managua 14 de Febrero, junto a su familia de cuatro hijos ya casados y su esposo que vende productos lácteos, la señora Gloria desde hace diez años administra su pulpería que pudo comenzar cuando vendió unas vacas que tenia, hasta ahora a podido mantener su equilibrio de venta y gracias a los financiamiento de Afodenic ha logrado aumentar su inventario. Con este préstamo quiere invertir en compra de productos enlatados, como sardina, atún, como salsa inglesa, piticuas, maíz, salsa de tomate en mucha cantidad, como pollo, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, entre otros para poder aumentar las ventas en este mes ya que se vende mucho para esta temporada de fin de año. Lo cual espera ya que sus ventas en estos meses no han sido buenas, lo cual espera aumentar. A futuro desea hacer mejoras a su casa en el cambio  de las divisiones de los cuarto ya que esta muy viejo. Lo cual espera lograrlo a corto plazo junto con el apoyo de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria is 53 years old. She lives in the “14 de Febrero” neighborhood, in the capital of Managua, with her 4 married children and her husband who sells dairy products. For ten years, Gloria has managed her grocery store;she started it when was able to sell a few cows that she had. Now she has been able to maintain a balance of sales and thanks to the financing from Afodenic, she has increased her inventory. With this loan, she wants to invest in the purchase of canned products, like sardines and tuna, like worcestershire sauce, peas, corn, large amounts of tomato sauce as well as chicken, rice, beans, sugar, oil among other things; so she can increase her sales this month, since she sells a lot at the end of the year. Her sales were not very good in the last months, so she hopes they will increase. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her home, changing the divisions of the rooms now that it’s old. She hopes she will be able to do so in the near future with the support of Afodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, tuna, worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce and othe products

loans.name: Benjamin Mario

texts.es: El señor Benjamin Mario anteriormente tenia un crédito con nosotros para un mejoramiento de su vivienda que fue la impermeabilización del techo de su hogar, crédito en el cual demostró ser un excelente cliente y por tal motivo se le esta apoyando para una renovación ya que en estos momentos desea realizar una ampliación en su hogar para brindarle una mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Benjamin Mario has had a previous home improvement loan with us, which was for water-proofing the roof of his home. With that loan he proved himself to be an excellent client and for that reason he is receiving backing for a renovation. At this time he wishes to carry out an addition to his home in order to provide his family with greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home addition

loans.name: Esmeralda De Jesús

texts.es: Esmeralda de Jesús G. C. de 28 años de edad, reside en Santiago Nonualco en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en un taller de automóviles, así también vive junto a sus tres hijos de 10, 8, y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual posee una tienda de producto varias en su hogar, negocio el cual lo puso con el fin de brindarle ayuda a su esposo, sobre todo en estos momentos tan difíciles económicamente. Esmeralda solícita un préstamo, ya que desea surtir su negocio comprando otros productos como zapatos, más bebidas enlatadas, entre otras cosas más la cuales son de primera necesidad para las personas. Esmeralda anhela poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que desea poder darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, lo cual es imposible brindárselo únicamente con el trabajo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Esmeralda de Jesús G. C., age 28, resides in Santiago Nonualco in the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who works in an automobile repair shop, and also with their three children, ages 10, 8, and 4. She is a very hardworking woman who has a shop in her home selling assorted goods. She began the business with the aim of offering help to her husband, especially in these times of so many economic difficulties. Esmeralda is applying for a loan because she wishes to stock her business by purchasing other products like shoes, more drinks, and canned goods, among other things that are greatly needed by her customers. Esmeralda is eager to improve her sales because she wants to be able to give her children everything they need, something which is impossible to offer them with only the earnings of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

location.town: Santiago Nonualco, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El señor Anibal es casado, con 4 hijos, uno de con mayoría de edad. La familia vive en una casa propia en la localidad Mayor Martinez, dentro del distrito de Tres Coronas. 
Dicha residencia particular cuenta con las comodidades para el hogar; en el mismo domicilio posee un local comercial, donde se comercializa, artículos de primera necesidad, ramos generales, etc.
Además de la actividad de la actividad comercial la pareja dedica a la producción de queso vacunos, que  posteriormente comercializa en la capital departamental. Esta en esta actividad llevan más de 10 años, posee todas las infraestructuras necesarias para el desarrollo de su actividad. 
Mediante la ayuda crediticia y asistencial  técnica de la Fundación Paraguaya logró mejores rendimientos en su tarea ya que siempre les brindamos nuestros buenos beneficios la cual le da un alto rendimiento en su comercio. En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para comprar insumos  para para su negocio, yaque tiene pedidos por las fiestas que se aproximan aumentaron.-
texts.en:
Anibal is married and has 4 children, of whom one is now an adult. The family lives in a house they own in the Mayor Martinez locality, within the Tres Coronas District. Said residence has all the comforts of a home; he also has his business, a general store where he sells basic daily necessities, in his home. In addition to the store, this couple dedicates itself to making cheese that they then sell in the city. They have been in business for more than 10 years, and have the necessary infrastructure in place to carry out their activities. Through the financial assistance and technical support from Fundación Paraguaya, he managed to improve his business’ performance. Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his business as he has orders for the approaching holiday season’s festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and general necessities for his business such as sugar, flour, rice, noodles, cooking oils, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Mawaydom

texts.fr: Cet homme n’est pas marié et a appris un métier d’un genre particulier : la menuiserie d’aluminium. Cette activité lui a permis d’être connu de nombreuses personnes, il fabrique des tables et des meubles avec de l'aluminium et des vitres qu'il expose devant son atelier. Il dispose des apprentis en grand nombre ; la plupart de ses clients apprécient la qualité de ses services ; en cette période de fin d’année, il reçoit beaucoup de commandes. Il a besoin de renouveler son stock de verres en aluminium ; raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter  des matériels de menuiserie en aluminium et des vitres. Il n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This man is unmarried and is trained in a specific profession: aluminium carpentry. This business has allowed him to be known by many people. He has a large number of apprentices, and the majority of his clients appreciate the quality of his services; during the current end-of-the-year period, he has received many orders. He needs to renew his stock of glass and aluminium, which is why he is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy aluminium carpentry materials. He has no children in his care.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy modern carpentry supplies

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: el joven Oscar de 28 años de edad, es un padre de familia de dos hermosos hijos, su esposa trabaja como domestica para poder apoyarlo con los gastos básicos del hogar en pago de agua, luz y poder comprar a sus hijos lo que haga falta, el trabaja de auxiliar de bodega, anteriormente trabajaba en sastrería y ahora logro este nuevo trabajo que lleva ya dos años, ha tenido dificultades ya que su hija se enfermo y ha tenido muchos gastos el cual no pudo totalmente terminar de cerrar su cuarto que era el objetivo solo pudo comprar parte de los materiales y comenzar la obra, pero es su meta poder cerrarlo el cual espera con este financiamiento comprar piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, y zinc para poder levantar las paredes y poner el techo que espera cerrar totalmente que solo gracias a estos préstamo esta logrando hacer esta mejora y necesidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 28 years old, and the father of two beautiful children. His wife works as a domestic in order to help him support the family, including to pay for water, electricity, and buy basics for their children. He works as an assistant in a general store, and previously in a tailor’s shop. He has had his current job for two years, but has had some difficulties because his daughter became ill and her care came at great expense. For this reason, he was unable to complete a bedroom as he could only buy some of the necessary materials and start the work. His goal is to finish the room, which he hopes to do with this loan, and buy stone, sand, cement, steel, and zinc. This will allow him to build the walls and add a roof, which will serve to enclose the space into a usable room. Only thanks to this loan can he hope to make this improvement to his home on behalf of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement, steel and zinc to build walls and complete a room for his house.

loans.name: Adela Edith

texts.es: Adela Edith R. O. de 36 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de Cojutepeque, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una tienda llamada “Milagro” nombre el cual le fue dado a su negocio hace diez años, ya que fue iniciado con la esperanza de poder mejorar la vida de sus hijos. Adela solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de productos perecederos, ya que cuenta con un gran número de clientes, debido a  que es una persona la cual es muy conocida en el lugar y al mismo tiempo es una persona la cual es admirada por ser muy fuerte y trabajadora la cual vela por el bienestar de su familia, ella espera aumentar aún más sus ventas, pero para esto ella debe contar con una mayor cantidad de productos es por esto que solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Adela Edith R. O. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Cojutepeque with her husband and two children. She has a store called “Miracle”, which she named 10 years ago when she was starting out with the hopes of improving her children’s lives. Adela is requesting a loan to buy more perishable products. She has a large customer base because she is well-known in her area, and also admired by many for being so strong and hardworking. She hopes to increase her sales even further by with a greater quantity of products in her store, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable products.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Cette femme vend du bois de chauffage dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Elle s’approvisionne à  Akatti, localité située à des dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. Ses clients apprécient la qualité de ses bois de chauffage. En ce moment elle voudrait lancer une nouvelle commande pour prévenir une éventuelle rupture de stocks ; raison pour la quelle elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander du bois de chauffe en quantité suffisante.
texts.en:
This woman sells firewood in the Agoè area of Lomé. This business allows her to take care of herself and provide for her children. She gets her supplies in Akatti, an area located a few tens of kilometres from Lomé. Her clients appreciate the quality of her firewood. Currently, she would like to put in a new order to prevent an eventual stock shortage; this is the reason why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to order a sufficient quantity of firewood.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en: Stepan is married. He sells food at a small kiosk and has been in this business for 6 years. His large assortment and affordable prices have attracted a lot of repeat customers. Stepan enjoys his business and has great plans for its development. He wants to borrow 17000 UAH to purchase more inventory so that he can open a second business location. He hopes to make this investment prior to the New Year's celebration which is a high season in his business. With the additional income, Stepan will help his adult children and their families.

loans.use: to open a second business location

loans.name: Ama Abidé

texts.fr:
Cette dame est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle s'est lancée en 2002 dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle veut  profiter des périodes de fêtes de fin d’année  pour augmenter ses recettes, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour accroître son stock avec  4 sacs de riz,  3 bidons d’huile, 4 cartons de boîtes de conserve et 3 cartons de pâtes alimentaires.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady is married and is the mother of 2 children; in 2002, she began a business selling general food products, and she gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She wants to take advantage of the holiday period at the end of the year to increase her sales, which is why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to augment her stock with 4 bags of rice, 3 cans of oil, 4 cartons of canned goods, and 3 boxes of pasta. She is married and has 2 children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en: Fikret A. is a 52-year-old married man with an adorable daughter. After finding it very difficult to get a job and needing to generate an income, he started his own small business selling home products eight years ago. Fikret began by selling a small selection of basic products, and added to his inventory as he gained more customers. Fikret is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to purchase additional merchandise to stock his store and meet his customers' demand. Your support will help improve his life and expand his business. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel D. G. de 49 años de edad, reside en Apastepeque en el departamento de San Vicente. Vive junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como cosmetóloga y vive junto a sus tres hijos. Víctor posee una carpintería desde ya hace varios años, negocio el cual le ha permitido llevar el sustento diario a su familia por mucho tiempo. Ahora el desea poder surtir con más madera su carpintería ya que por ser un señor muy trabajador y responsable goza de mucho trabajo, lo cual le incentiva a seguir creciendo en el negocio. Víctor solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar madera y de esta manera poder aumentar su trabajo y así mismo agilizarlo ya que al contar con más materia prima para su trabajo no corre el riesgo de no poder entregar los pedidos a tiempo. Es por esto que Víctor espera mejorar su situación económica a través de dicho préstamo.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel D. G. is 49 years old and lives in Apastepeque in the San Vicente department. He lives with his wife, a cosmetologist, and their three children. Víctor has had a carpentry workshop for several years, and this business has helped provide daily sustenance for the family for a long time. He now wants to supply his workshop with more lumber, as he is a very hard-working man who enjoys his work a great deal. This motivates him to continue growing his enterprise. Víctor is requesting a loan through which he can buy more wood to increase the amount of work he has and complete it faster, since this way he won’t run the risk of failing to meet deadlines on his orders. This is why Víctor is hoping to improve his financial situation through said loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale, cette femme fait face en ce moment à une hausse de la demande de ses clients,  elle doit par conséquent augmenter son stock, elle sollicite alors de WAGES son tout premier crédit pour acheter 6 sacs de riz, 3 bidons d’huile, 4 sachets d’eau « PURE WATER », 20  boîtes de conserve et divers. Elle a commencé à exercer ce commerce en 2000, elle compte sur son expérience pour rentabiliser ce prêt.
texts.en:
This woman sells food at a general store. Demand from her clients is growing, and as a consequence she has to increase her food supply. She is requesting her first-ever loan from WAGES to buy 6 bags of rice, 3 cans of oil, 4 packets of "PURE WATER", 20 cans of food and miscellaneous other products. She started this business in 2000 and will rely on her experience to pay back the loan.


Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
El cliente es casado, posee 48 años de edad, su señora cuenta con 42 años, viven en Guazucuá, en el centro mismo de esta ciudad, No tienen hijos.
Son dueños de una centro comercial en esta localidad, se dedican a venta de ramos generales como artículos eléctricos, artículos de ferretería, artículos de limpieza, comestibles librería y también cuenta con una carnicería dentro del negocio comercial.
 El cliente titular se dedica a la compra y venta de animales vacunos, de toda la zona de Guazucuá y Tacuaras, es una familia muy unida, que poseen infraestructuras  necesarias para el desarrollo de su actividad comercial.
Solicitan el crédito para invertir en el rubro comercial en la compra de mercaderías para su negocio, que posee mas de 10 años de actividad  en el ramo y para la compra de animales ya la venta aumenta siempre en esta epoca.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le prestan para su negocio.
texts.en:
The client is 48 years old, married, and his wife is 42. They live in Guazucuá, in the center of the city, and have no children. They run a commercial establishment in their locality, and dedicate themselves to selling general goods such as electronics, hardware and cleaning supplies, food/snacks, books and they also have a butcher shop within the store. The named person dedicates himself to buying and selling livestock throughout the Guazucuá y Tacuaras zones. It is a tight-knit family, which has the necessary infrastructures in place to continue to grow their commercial enterprise. He requests credit to invest in more merchandise for his business, which he has been in for more than 10 years. He would also like to invest in more livestock, as sales typically increase during the holiday season. He thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for the help it has provided to him and his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and livestock.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir M. is a 48-year-old entrepreneur. He is married and has two children. Zakir sells different kinds of food products such as sugar, salt, butter, and beverages in his store. His wife actively helps him with sales.
Zakir is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once and a while to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. Zakir's main goal is to educate his beloved child so that someday he, in turn, will become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: María Angélica

texts.es: María Angélica G. D. A. D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en Cojutepeque en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Ella es una persona la cual es muy dedicada y que se esfuerza día con día por contar con todo lo necesario para vivir. María tiene cinco años D. poseer una tienda D. productos perecederos. Ella solícita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su negocio y comprar más productos D. primera necesidad, ya que a pesar que ya cuenta con varios años D. tener la tienda, es poco lo que la ha logrado surtirla ya que no contaba con los recursos necesarios para hacerlo. María es una mujer la cual brinda un gran ejemplo por ser muy trabajadora y que cuenta con el deseo D. querer seguir adelante. Así también su negocio es una manera en la cual se distrae, ya que ella es una señora que vive sola, debido a que sus dos hijas ya son casadas y viven en el extranjero y su esposo murió hace algún tiempo atrás. D. esta manera María busca seguir adelante y poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Angélica G. D. A., 59 years of age, resides in Cojutepeque in the department of Cuscatlán. She is a person who is very dedicated and she makes an effort each day to esure she has everything that is necessary to live. For 5 years Maria has owned a shop selling perishable products. She is seeking a loan so that she can supply her business and buy more products of the first necessity. Even though she has owned the shop for many years, she has only been able to supply it a little and didn't have the necessary resources to do it. María is a woman who provides a great example of a hard worker, and desires to move forward. Her business is also a way to distract her, now that she lives alone, owing to the fact that her 2 daughters are now married and live far away, and her husband died a while ago. In this way María looks to move forward and expand her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery items

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Barbara Maria

texts.es:
Bárbara López de 37 años de edad, vive en una casa de cemento tienen la facilidad de contar con los servicios de agua, alcantarillado, luz y caminos pavimentados ya que por los sectores que vive es muy raro que tenga estos beneficios su casa esta ubicada en el sector de la Perimetral de Guayaquil.

Bárbara comenzó vendiendo ropa y perfumes con esto ella aportaba a los gastos familiares pero a raíz que murió su esposo  Bárbara se convirtió en el primer ingreso del hogar y decidió poner un Soda-Bar en la que vende batidos a $ 0.60 c/u y tostadas a $ 0.35 c/u esos ingresos le ayudan para poder mantener a sus 2 hijos uno de 18 años y una niña de  9 años que con esfuerzo están en una escuela particular, aunque unas de sus mayores dificultades son las lluvias sigue adelante por sus 2 hijos.

Con el préstamo quiere mejorar su vivienda comprando cemento, adoquines, piezas para el baño en el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para alquilarla y tener otro ingreso adicional, además de eso quiere que su negocio sea muy conocido por su sector.
texts.en:
Bárbara López is 37 years of age, and lives in a cement house that has water, a sewer systems, light, and paved walkways. It is very rare in the sector where she lives to have these benefits. Her house is located in the sector of la Perimetral de Guayaquil. Bárbara commenced selling clothes and perfume, and with this contributed to the household costs. However her husband then died, and Bárbara then became the primary earner of her home and decided to open a Soda Bar where she sells milkshakes for $.60 each and toast for $0.35 each. These earnings help her to maintain her 2 children, one who is 18 and a little girl who is 9, who with Bárbara's effort is in a private school. Although one of her biggest difficulties is rain, she continues forward for her children. With the loan she wants to improve her house, buying cement, paving stones, and parts for the bathroom. In the future she wants to buy a truck that she can rent out for additional income, and also wants her business to be very well known by her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, paving stones, parts for the bathroom

loans.name: Marlene Elizabeth

texts.es: Marlene Elizabeth G. de 23 años de edad, reside en Izalco en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante de productos varios, los cuales los comercializa de manera ambulante. Así también vive junto a sus dos pequeños hijos de 3 y dos años de edad. Marlene posee una venta de muchos productos como baterías, peines, ganchos para el cabello y otros más. Actualmente ella junto a su esposo están atravesando por un momento muy difícil ya que no cuenta con algunos de los servicios básicos en el hogar como el agua y la luz, debido a que no cuentan con el capital necesario para poder costearlos. Es por esto que Marlene solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar su inventario con productos como lámparas, calculadoras, radios y más. Todo esto con el fin de poder contar con ellos en esta época navideña de manera que sus ventas puedan ser muy buenas y así aumentar sus ganancias, lo cual lo desea mucho ya que espera poder mejorar su situación familiar.
texts.en:
Marlene Elizabeth G. is 23 years of age and lives in Izalco in the Sonsonate Department. She lives together with her husband, who works as a trader for various products, which he markets door to door. She also lives together with her two small children, 3 and 2 years of age. Marlene sells many products such as batteries, combs, hair clips and other things. She and her husband are actually passing through a difficult moment as they don't have some basic home services such as water and light, owing to the fact that they don't have the necessary capital to buy them. It is for this reason that Marlene is seeking a loan, with which she can expand her inventory with products such as lamps, calculators, radios and more. These will help them during the Christmas period as their sales can be very good and they can augment their earnings, which she greatly desires and hopes to be able to improve her family situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lamps, calculators and radios

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Fish products business

loans.name: Norma Yanira

texts.es: Norma Yanira R. D. P. D. 35 años D. edad, vive en Santiago Nonualco en el departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 16 y 14 años D. edad. Norma comercializa por las calles D. Santiago Nonualco semillas D. marañon, las cuales son preparadas por ella misma. Ya cuenta con 16 años D. tener dicho negocio, en el cual decidió iniciarse gracias a los consejos D. su hermana la cual se lo recomendó con el fin D. poder mejorar la economía familiar. Norma compra las semillas y las prepara D. manera artesanal y luego las coloca en una bolsa pequeña D. manera que pueda vender las medidas exactas, sus hijos colaboran con el proceso D. preparación D. semilla. Norma solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el capital necesario para poder incrementar la cantidad D. semilla cruda y así contar con más productos para su venta. Ella aprecia mucho su negocio ya que ha sido a través D. este como han podido brindarles estudios y ropa a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma Yanira R. D. P. is 35 years old, and lives in Santiago Nonualco in the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband and their two children, who are 16 and 14 years old. Norma markets cashews, which she prepares herself, on the streets of Santiago Nonualco. She has been in this business for 16 years now, which she decided to initiate thanks to the advice of her sister who recommended it to her in order to improve her family economic situation.
