Norma buys the cashews and prepares them in a handmaD. manner and then places them in a small bag so that she can sell them in exact measures. Her children contribute to the process of preparing the cashews. Norma is requesting a loan which she will use for the necessary capital in order to be able to increase the quantity of raw cashews and therefore count on more products to sell. She appreciates her business a lot since it has been through this that she has been able to give her children schooling and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw cashews

location.town: Santiago Nonualco, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Isaidel

texts.es: E señor Isaidel es un cliente que ha demostrado ser muy puntual en sus pagos anteriormente su expareja obtuvo un crédito con nosotros y se tuvo que ir de la ciudad y el asumió la responsabilidad del crédito, lo cual demuestra el gran sentido de responsabilidad que tiene, por ello se le esta tramitando este crédito para la compra de un automóvil para su negocio de taxi. Ya que además de este ingreso, percibe uno más ya que labora para una empresa desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
Sr. Isaidel is a customer who has proven to be very punctual in his previous payments. His ex-wife obtained a loan with us and she had to go to the city and he assumed the responsibility for the loan, which demonstrates the great sense of responsibility that he has. He is applying for this loan in order to buy a car for his taxi business. Now with this income, he will receive one more since he works for a company for five years.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of a car for his work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: Ramona G. G. de 56 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango. Vive junto a sus dos hijas y una nieta de 5 años de edad. Ella posee una tienda en su propia casa, ahí comercializa productos perecederos y de uso personal. Desde hace 8 años Ramona lucha por seguir adelante con su negocio, el cual es la única fuente de ingresos con la cual cuenta debido a que su  hija mayor perdió su empleo y se le ha sido difícil encontrar uno nuevo. Es por esto que la señora Ramona solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos, los cuales son más vendidos en el lugar, esperando así aumentar las ventas y así de esta manera poder contar con todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente pero sobre todo que no le haga falta nada a su pequeña nieta.
texts.en:
Ramona G. G. is 56 years old and lives in the municipality of Ilopango. She lives together with her two daughters and a granddaughter who is 5 years old. She owns a shop in her own house, where she markets perishable and personal use products. For eight years, Ramona has struggled to get ahead with her business, which is the only source of income that she can count on since her oldest daughter lost her job, and it has been difficult for her to find a new one. It is for this reason that Sra. Ramona is requesting a loan through which she will be able to buy more products, those which are sold the most in her place. She is hoping to increase her sales and in this way, be able to count on everything that is necessary to live with dignity, but above all, she doesn't want her little granddaughter to miss anything.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy necessity products

loans.name: Bertha Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Lucia N. es madre soltera de 2 niños y vive con su madre la cual la apoya moral y económicamente.
La señora es un cliente distinguida de nuestra Institución la cual anteriormente solicito un crédito para empezar la construcción de un cuarto en su hogar para mayor comodidad, y ahora es para terminar la construcción del cuarto para ampliarse y brindarle mayor espacio a su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha Lucia N. is a single mother of two children; she lives with her mother, who supports her emotionally and economically. She is a distinguished client of our Institution, who was granted a previous loan to start construction of an additional room in her house, for more comfort. Now, the requested funding is to complete the construction; to enlarge it so that the family can have more living space.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete a room addition.

loans.name: Linda Claudia Lissette

texts.es: Linda Claudia Lissette F. D. M. D. 23 años D. edad, resiD. en Cojutepeque, departamento D. Cuscatlán y Vive junto a su esposo. Ella posee una venta D. ropa para mujeres y hombres, así mismo venD. accesorios para el cabello y carteras. Linda tiene 6 años D. poseer el negocio, el cual día con día ella desea sacarlo adelante y D. esta manera poder ampliarlo. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar ropa al por mayor, así mismo comprar ropa para niños. Linda cuenta con el deseo D. se mejor cada día y superarse en su negocio, sobre todo porque piensa en un futuro tener hijos, pero antes ella quiere poder brindarles una vida estable como se la merecen y es por esto que se esfuerza a diario por mejorar las condiciones D. su venta.
texts.en:
Linda Claudia Lissette F. D. M., 23, lives with her husband in Cojutepeque, Cuscatlán department. She sells women's and men's clothing as well as hair accessories and purses. Linda has been in this line of work for 6 years and she works hard every day to see it succeed and to enlarge it. She is requesting financing to buy clothing at wholesale and to buy children's clothes. Linda hopes to improve every day and to do well in her business because she plans some day to have children. However, she wants to be able to give them the stable life they deserve so she puts in the daily effort to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es: El señor Adalberto G. F. junto con su esposa la señora Clara  iniciaron un negocio de renta de tuxedos y vestidos de gala, y a pesar de ser un matrimonio joven están muy bien establecidos ya que tiene la madurez suficiente para luchar y trabajar para salir adelante, y están 5tramitando este crédito para la compra de mas trajes de gala para caballero.
texts.en:
Adalberto G. F. and his wife Clara started a tuxedo and formal wear rental service. Despite being a young married couple they are well established because they are mature enough to work hard to get ahead. They are requesting funding to buy more formal wear for gentlemen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy formal wear for gentlemen.

loans.name: José Isidro

texts.es: José Isidro D. de 47 años de edad, reside en el Caserío Las Flores en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos de 21, 17, 16, 14 y 12 años de edad. Como todo padre responsable ha sabido trabajar muy duro por darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, José cuenta con una carpintería la cual esta ubicada en el patio de su humilde casa, el trabaja por encargo y también elabora ciertas piezas de madera para poder ofrecer a las personas, su hijo mayor le ayuda en el negocio, lo cual alegra mucho a José ya que él espera que sus hijos hereden el negocio. José solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda tener la capacidad de comprar madera al por mayor, esto con fin de poder ofrecer más producto a las personas como roperos, mesas y otros elementos más, lo cual se vea reflejado en la economía familiar y le permita poder brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Isidro D., 47, lives in the Las Flores hamlet in Usulután department with his wife and 5 children, who are 21, 17, 16, 14, and 12 years of age respectively. As all responsible parents, he has worked very hard to provide for his children's needs. He has a carpintery shop in the yard of his humble house. He works based on prior orders but he also makes certain wood pieces to have on offer. His eldest son helps out in the shop, something that gladdens José very much, since he expects his sons to inherit the business. José requests funding so that he can buy lumber at wholesale so that he can have more products, like wardrobes, tables, etc. to offer people, the sales of which he hopes will increase his family's income so that he can offer his children the best.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La señora Verónica G. es casada y madre de familia su esposo el señor Héctor Alejandro la apoya ya que son una familia muy unida y emprendedora, el labora para una empresa de seguridad medica y ella tiene establecido un negocio de nombre “Fiesta Fácil” donde realiza adornos de mesa para fiestas infantiles y además vende regalos para diferentes ocasiones;Para el cual esta tramitando este crédito ya que con las fiestas desembridas que están cercas desea comprar mercancía por mayoreo y obtener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Verónica G. is married and a mother. Her husband, Héctor Alejandro, supports her work efforts. They are a very unified, enterprising family. He works for a medical security firm and she has a business called "Fiesta Fácil” where she makes table decorations for children's parties. She also sells gift items for various occasions. This loan will be used to stock up on merchandise at wholesale because the end-of-year party season is near and higher profits are possible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gift items.

loans.name: Graciela Guadalupe

texts.es:
Graciela S. es una señora de 37 años, casada con 5 hijos de 22, 16, 12, 8 y 1 mes de edad. Sus hijos estudian en escuelas y colegios fiscales. Su actividad principal es la venta de cosméticos, tales como perfumes, cremas para manos y colonias, esta actividad la escogió porque le gustan ventas. 
Su horario de trabajo es por las tardes ( 15h30 – 18h00 ) y su mamá la ayuda a vender los productos, el negocio le da una rentabilidad del 50% por ejemplo si invierte US$ 300.0 obtiene como ganancia US$ 150.00. Con el préstamo planea comprar productos de belleza y juguetes para la época navideña.  Sus metas a futuro son terminar de construir su casa y tener más productos de belleza para vender
texts.en:
Graciela S., 37, is married and has 5 children; their ages range from 1 month to 22 years. Her children study in public elementary and secondary schools. Her main source of income is the sale of cosmetics like perfume, hand creams, colognes. She chose this line of work because she likes sales. She works afternoons from 3:30-6:00 and her mother helps her with the sales. She has a profit margin of 50%. For example: she invests US$ 300 and earns US$ 150 profit. With the financing she plans to buy beauty products and toys for the Christmas season. Her future goal is to finish her house and to have a wider selection of beauty products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys and cosmetics.

loans.name: Bayron Lenin

texts.es:
Byron V. de 29 años de edad, vive en la zona ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y tiene los servidos básicos de agua, luz y alcantarillado, Byron hace ya muchos años atrás aprendió la actividad de la venta de mariscos ya que su padre se dedicaba a venderlos cuando el era muy pequeño, fue aprendiendo poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación.

Byron trabaja con su hermano menor y su mama desde las 09h00 hasta las 13h00, comprar pescados como albacoras a $ 1.15 la libra, Caritas a $ 0.12 la libra y camarones a $ 1.40 la libra, la mayor dificultad que tiene en su negocio es la discapacidad física que Byron tiene en su pierna derecha aunque esto le es de impedimento continua adelante para asegurar el futuro de su familia en conjunto con su esposa, ya que no tienen hijos porque su prioridad es tener estabilidad económica. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar techo, cementos, arreglos para baños para construir su vivienda y así segurar el futuro de su familia, en el futuro quiere distribuir pescado a los vendedores de su sector y permanecer junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Byron V., 29, lives in an area on the outskirts of Guayaquil. His house is concrete and has basic services like water, electricity and sewerage. Byron has been a fishmonger for a long time because his father was in the same line of work and Byron learned from him from a very early age. Byron works alonside his younger brother and his mother from 9am until 1pm. He buys albacore at $1.15 a pound, carita (Pacific moonfish) at $0.12 a pound and shrimp at $1.40 a pound. His greatest obstacle at work is a physical disability in his right leg. Although a problem, it isn't an impediment, and he forges ahead to insure a good future with his wife. They have no children yet because his first priority is to have economic stability. With the financing he wants to buy roofing materials, cement and bathroom fixtures to build his house for his family's future. In the future, he would like to be a fish distributor to fishmongers in his area and to stay together with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roofing materials, cement, bathroom fixtures.

loans.name: Brenda Guadalupe

texts.es: Brenda Guadalupe A. P. de 28 años de edad, reside en Armenia en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como motorista del transporte público, así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a trabajar. Brenda posee un comedor en el cual se encarga de hacer desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo hace y vende pupusas. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar frutas y verduras, ya que las personas solicitan mucho las frutas para comerlas como postre, de esta manera Brenda lo considera clave para poder mejorar sus ventas, sobre todo lo hace pensando en el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Brenda Guadalupe A. P. is 28 years old; she lives in Armenia, Department of Sonsonate. She lives together with her husband, who works as driver in public transportation, and with her two children, 7 and 9 years old, that also work. Brenda owns an eatery where she serves breakfast and lunch, and she also makes and sells pupusas. She is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables since her customers frequently ask for fruits as dessert, and Brenda considers this key to improve her sales, always thinking in the wellbeing of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar es casado y ya anteriormente ha tenido un crédito con nosotros para la realización de un cuarto en construcción en la parte trasera de su vivienda, el obtiene sus ingresos a través de la venta de barbacoa para la cual ya tiene varios trabajadores, y al igual que su esposa han demostrado ser una familia muy trabajadora y responsable que lucha para salir adelante, y demostraron un gran sentido de responsabilidad realizando sus pagos siempre con puntualidad y por ello están tramitando este crédito para el enjarre y colocación de alambrado eléctrico de su nuevo cuarto que construyeron con el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Cesar is married and has already had a loan with us in order to construct a room at the rear of his house. He earns his income through the sale of barbecue and already has several employees. He and his wife have shown themselves to be a very hardworking and responsible family that fights to get ahead, and they have shown a great sense of responsibility in always making payments on time. That’s why they are seeking this loan for plaster and the placement of electric wire in the new room that they built with the previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of electric cable and plaster for interior walls

loans.name: Fariva Zulema

texts.es: La señorita Fariva es soltera y vive sola en su hogar y con esfuerzos esta saliendo adelante ya que es una persona muy responsable, ella labora para una empresa de casa de empeño y esta tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda para mayor protección de ella misma y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Fariva is single and lives alone in her home. With much effort she is getting ahead in life because she is a very responsible person. She is employed by a pawnshop and is requesting this financing to build an outside wall on the back side of her property for better protection both for herself and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an outside wall.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en: Yusif M. is 31 years old, married, and has two children. His wife keeps the house and takes care of their children. In order to support his family, Yusif sells household goods such as kettles, pails, pans, socks, and other items. He has been in this business for three years. Having acquired experience, Yusif is able to choose goods that meet the differing tastes of his customers. The business is quite successful and generates a stable income that allows Yusif to improve his family's living conditions and make his children happy. Today, Yusif is requesting 1,600 AZN for purchasing new household goods to enlarge his range. Be an important part of the growth of Yusif’s business!

loans.use: To enlarge his range of household goods

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Todas estas  mujeres forman parte de un programa de desarrollo social y económico denominado Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras impulsado por la Fundación Paraguaya, ofreciendo a las involucradas una gama de capacitaciones por ciclo de vida del comité, y un apoyo financiero para que las mismas cuenten con un capital operativo que netamente invierten en sus respectivos negocios.
Por este hecho el Comité Kuña aty, agradece  a la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza puesta en personas de status relativamente baja que son discriminados en el mundo de las oportunidades hasta la actualidad.
Solo dos señoras se dedican a actividades  diferentes a las demás que son chiperas, este negocio requiere de mucho esfuerzo más aún para las mujeres, ya que el proceso de producción inicia generalmente a las 03:30 entre las 04:00 horas de la madrugada, preparando el horno a leña, más conocido como tatacua en la que posteriormente se introduce la masa de la chipa moldeada, esto implica soportar un alto grado de calor manipulando el proceso de cocción  del producto mencionado  durante varias horas.
Una vez terminada el producto queda la ardua tarea de venderlas en su totalidad para que de esta única forma sea compensada el tan forzoso trabajo de ser chiperas
texts.en:
All these women are a part of a social and economic development program called Committee of Enterprising Women. This program is supported by the Paraguayan Foundation and offers their members a range of training by committee cycle. It also offers them financial support so that they are able to use the operational capital to invest in their respective businesses. Because of this the Kuna Aty Committee thanks the Paraguayan Foundation for the trust they put in people with a relatively humble status who are even now discriminated against in the world of opportunities. Only two women work in different activities. The rest are.”chiperas” breadbakers.. This business requires a lot of strength, more so for women, since the production process generally begins between 3:30 and 4:00 am, by preparing the oven with wood. It is a brick oven (tatacua) in which they later put the shaped bread dough. The bread needs to be baked for several hours at a high temperature while adjusting the heat. Once finished they have the arduous task of selling all of the bread because that is the only way they are compensated for the hard work of being “chiperas” (breadbakers).

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: All the women use their loans to support their commercial activities to that they can get small  profit margins to help pay for food, their children's education, health expenses, and to reinvest in their businesses

loans.name: Lideres Group

texts.es: Nieves P. es una de las integrantes del grupo Líderes. Ella es una mujer optimista, se considera  empresaria ya que vende productos naturales y viaja por diferentes pueblos y comunidades ofreciendo estos productos que son buenos contra la anemia, desnutrición y otros. Ella piensa invertir el préstamo solicitado para comprar mayor  mercadería y seguir expandiéndose vendiendo sus productos a diferentes lugares, Nieves ha logrado involucrar a sus dos hijas en el negocio que al igual que ella se dedican a la venta de los mismos productos. Las demás integrantes de Líderes también cuentan con sus propios negocios así se dedican a la venta de cosméticos, macramé en mantas, venta de plantillas y comida.
texts.en:
Nieves P. is one of the members of the Líderes Group. She is an optimistic woman who thinks of herself as a businesswoman since she sells natural products and travels to different towns and communities selling products were are effective against anemia, malnutrition, etc. She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise and to expand her business to sell in other locations. Nieves has involved her two daughters in the business and they also sell the same products. The other members of Lideres also have their own businesses and sell cosmetics, macramé blankets, shoe insoles, and meals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for sale (various products)

loans.name: Rosemery

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosemery tiene 41 años de edad, se encuentra casada con el Sr. Javier rogelio Coca ya por 20 años, juntos tienen 3 hijas y 1 hijo, los cuales acuden a la escuela de la zona. Cuentan con casa propia en una zona que se dedica netamente a la lecheria y a la agricultura.
 
Ellos trabajan desde hace 10 años en la produccion de leche, han estado mejorando su produccion invirtiendo en la compra de mas cabezas de ganado lechero.

Ahora solicitan este credito para comprar una cabeza mas de una vaca lechera para poder incrementar su produccion de leche y asi mejorar sus ingresos. En un futuro estan dispuestos a solicitar un credito para comprar otra cabeza de una vaca lechera y seguir mejorando su produccion.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosemery is 41 years old, she has been married to Mr. Javier Rogelio Coca for 20 years. They have 3 daughters and 1 son who attend the local school.

For the past 10 years they have been dedicated to the production of milk, they have improved the production as they have bought more milking cows.

At the moment they request this loan to buy one more milking cow to increase their production of milk and thus improve their income. For the future they plan to request a loan in order to buy another cow and continue improving their production.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Zaida Martha

texts.es:
La Sra. Zaida Martha A. C. tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Jesus Quispe Pozo por 14 años, tienen 2 hijas y un hijo, los cuales acuden a la escuela de la zona. viven en una casa propia donde realizan su actividad.

Se dedican a la lecheria desde hace mas de 15 años, toda la produccion de leche entregan una empresa que elabora toda clase de productos lacteos. 

Solicitaron el credito para comprar mas alimento (cascara de soya), asi no tendrar escases de alimento para su ganado lechero. lo que mantendra su produccion en un buen nivel.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zaida Martha A. C. is 36 years old, she has been married to Mr. Jesus Quispe Poza for 14 years. They have 2 daughters and one son who attend the local school. They live in their own house which is also their workplace.

They have been dedicated to milk production for more than 15 years and the entire production is delivered to a company that makes all kind of dairy products.

They requested the loan to buy more food (soy shell) so they will not have food shortage for the milking cows and be able to maintain a profitable production.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soy (food for milking cows)

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Carlos Ernesto es cliente distinguido de nuestra institución ya que en el crédito anterior fue un cliente que realizo con puntualidad sus pagos, y esta tramitando este crédito para terminar la construcción del cuarto que empezó a construir con el crédito anterior que le brindamos, y así su familia obtendrá mayor comodidad.El labora para una empresa de reparto y ademas se dedica a pintar automoviles para asi obtener ingresos extras para su hogar y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Ernesto is a distinguished client of our institution as he repaid a previous loan punctually and is requesting this loan to finish building the room he started to build with the previous loan, and thus have more comfort for his family. He works with a delivery company and he also paints automobiles to obtain some extra income for his home and offer his family a better living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a room at his home.

loans.name: Carmen Del Rocio

texts.en:
Carmen Del Rocio P. M. is 43 years old and runs a home restaurant in the Isla district of Guayaquil. Eight years ago, Ms. P. began making and selling encebollado (a local fish soup) out of her home on the weekends.  She loved cooking and preparing food so much that she decided to open a restaurant out of her mother´s home. 

Ms. P. is married and has 3 children ages 21, 23 and 24. With the help of her mother, sister and daughter-in-law, Ms. P. works every day from early in the morning until 2 p.m. serving lunch for $1.50 to people who work in the area.  Her husband has been in Spain for 7 years now, but he provides support when possible.

Ms. P. is requesting a loan to buy chairs, tables and a stovetop for her restaurant.  In the future, she hopes to buy a shade to protect her customers from the hot sun and cement to create proper walls within the restaurant.  She thanks you for any support you may be able to provide her business so that her family may prosper!

loans.use: chairs, tables and a stovetop

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo que acude a la universidad publica de Cochabamba. Vive con su madre que es mayor de edad.

La Sra. Irma y su familia viven en una zona enteramente lechera y agricola. la Sra. Irma se dedica a la lecheria desde hace unos 28 años, primeramente aprendio el manejo del ganado lechero gracias a su madre y despues logro independizarse para comprar su propio ganado lechero.

Solicito el credito para poder terminar de construir un galpon para su ganado lechero. Esto mejorara las condiciones en las que se encuentran sus vacas evitando que se mojen si llueve y les llegue el sol directamente y se deshidraten, lo que evitara que contraigan muchas enfermedades.

En un futuro desea poder solicitar otro credito para comprar mas cabezas de vacas lecheras para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma is 41 years old, single, with a son who attends the public university of Cochabamba. She lives with her elderly mother.

Mrs. Irma and her family live in a dairy and farming zone. Mrs. Irma has been dedicated to milk production for about 28 years. Thanks to her mother she learned to manage the dairy cows and later she became independent as she bought her own dairy cattle.

She requests the loan to finish building a shed for her cattle. This will improve the conditions of her cows as they will not get wet when it rains and they can keep out of the sun and keep hydrated, so they avoid catching many diseases.

In the future she would like to request another loan to buy more dairy cows and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a shed for dairy cows.

loans.name: Carlos Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Rafael es casado con la señora Sarai Ortiz y son una familia aunque joven pero muy bien establecida y trabajadora, ellos anteriormente ya tenían un crédito con nosotros y realizaron su proyecto que fue el inicio de la construcción de un cuarto de baño, pero están tramitando nuevamente para terminar los acabados interiores del cuarto en construcción; el labora para una empresa de asuntos viales y ella para una empresa de venta de muebles para el hogar. 
(el solicitante no se encontraba ya que andaba trabajando fuera de la ciudad y se le tomo la fotografia a su conyuge)
texts.en:
Carlos Rafael is married to Sarai Ortiz. Although they are a young family, they are well established and hard-working. They had a prior loan with us with which they began a project which consisted in building a bathroom. They are requesting new funding to finish the interior touches to the bathroom that's still under construction. He works for a firm that deals with traffic issues and she for a home furniture store. (He, the loan applicant, was unavailable since he was working out of town; the photo is of his wife..

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the bathroom.

loans.name: Shovkat

texts.en: Shovkat A. is 44 years old and married. She has nine years of experience growing and selling fruit. She uses all the money she makes to take care of her two sons and provide for their education. Shovkat always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her stock in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her customers are always very happy with the service they receive from her. As her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today, Shovkat is requesting 1,600 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer in order to increase the variety of her goods. She is grateful to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase more seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Since he was young, Yusif Q. has known how to work hard. His parents taught him how to get by as an agriculturist, and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of 7 children, he still works as an agriculturalist. Thanks to his parents, Yusif now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer, and he hopes to increase his agricultural production so that he can improve the life of his family. 
Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker, Yusif needs help to get ahead and improve his production. He is asking for a loan so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive but without which his production will not improve. You can help Yusif  keep moving forward with his development plans.

loans.use: Purchase more seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Egladis

texts.es: Egladis R. G. de 54 años de edad, reside en Armenia en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo y su único hijo de 11 años de edad. Ella posee una pupusería la cual esta ubicada frente a la Unidad de Salud del lugar. Egladis ha colocado su negocio en ese lugar ya que es un lugar muy rentable el cual le deja  muy buenas ganancias debido a todo los pacientes que llegan a la Unidad de Salud. Egladis solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar más maíz, frijoles, aceite y gas propano para la preparación y cocimiento de las pupusas. Ella es una señora muy visionaria que ha sabido aprovechar muy bien las oportunidades que la vida le ha brindado, y es por esto que desea seguir creciendo en su negocio y de esta manera ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos diarios y sobre todo para poder suplir las necesidades de su hijo.
texts.en:
Egladis R. G. is 54 years old and lives in the Sonsonate District in Armenia, El Salvador. She lives with her son who's 11. She owns a small restaurant where she sells pupusas (tortilla filled with cheese and pork rind) and it's located in front of the town's Health Clinic, a location she chose because of the high traffic of people. Egladis is asking for a $700 loan that she'll use to buy more corn, beans, oil and gas to prepare her pupusas. She is a woman of vision and has been taken advantage of the opportunities that life has brought her, and that's why her business has been expanding and she's able to help her husband with household expenses and support her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Luz Aliria

texts.es:
Luz L. de 57 años de edad, vive en una casa de cemento que esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, puede contar en su casa con todos los servicios básicos. Luz comenzó el negocio de venta de repuestos de bicicleta  haciendo un estudio en su sector con esto se dio cuenta la necesidad que había para poner un negocio de ventas de repuestos de bicicletas y arreglos, es así que ella tuvo la iniciativa de hacer este negocio y hacerlo su fuente de ingreso para su familia.

Luz comienza a trabajar vendiendo los repuestos de bicicleta en conjunto con su esposo trabaja arreglándolas desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm, compra llantas a $ 4.00 y las vende a $ 4.50 c/u, tubos a $ 2.00 y los vende a $ 2.50 c/u, una de las complicaciones que tiene es que mucho trabajo y necesita otro maestro para que repare las bicicletas, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad uno de 29 años, otro de 27 años, otro de 23 años, y el menor de 21 años quien le ayuda en el negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere compra 2 docenas de llantas, 5 docenas de tubos y 16 trinches, para poder agrandar más el negocio y tener estabilidad para su vejes, en el futuro quiere implementar mas artículos de bicicletas y que cada uno de sus hijos tengas sus negocios propios para asegurar el futuro de sus familias.
texts.en:
Luz L. is 57 years old, and lives in a cement house located in the Perimeter of Guayaquil. Her house has all the basic services she needs. Luz began a business selling recovered bicycles. In making a study of her neighborhood she realized a need for having a business that repairs and fixes bicycles. So she took the initiative to start this business and it's become the source of income for her family. Luz begins work selling repaired bicycles alongside her husband who repairs them from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.. She buys tires at $4 and sells them for $4.50 each. One of the challenges she faces is a lot of work so she needs another mechanic to repair the bicycles. She has 4 children all grown, from the ages of 29, 27, 23, and the youngest is 21 who help her with the business. With the loan she wants to buy 2 dozen tires, 5 dozen inner tubes, and 16 tools to be able to enlarge the business and have financial stability in her old age. In the future she wants to add more bicycle items so that each one of her children may have their own business and a secure future for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: tires, inner tubes, and tools

loans.name: Alma Del Carmen

texts.es: Alma del Carmen Z. de 53 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella vive únicamente junto a su esposo. Alma posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de uso personal en su casa. Dicho negocio es muy rentable ya que es el único que esta en las cercanías del lugar, de esta manera todas las personas acuden a comprar a el. Alma es una mujer la cual siempre ha luchado por seguir adelante y es por esto que solicita un préstamo por  medio del cual pueda surtir su negocio, ya que a pesar que las ganancias son muy buenas, estas no le permiten invertir más, debido a que los gastos del hogar son grandes. Ella espera mejorar sus ganancias al contar con más productos y esto lo puede alcanzar gracias al préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Alma del Carmen Z., 53 years old, resides in Ciudad Arce in the Department of La Libertad. She lives alone with her husband. Alma has a store that sells perishable goods and products for personal use in the home. Said business is very profitable, since it is the only one of its kind in the vicinity, so everyone comes to make their purchases there. Alma is a woman who has always fought to get ahead and for that reason she is requesting the loan, through which she'll be able to stock her store. Even though the profits are very good, they don't allow her to invest more in the store, due to her high household expenses. She hopes to improve her profits once she has more products, and she can achieve that thanks to the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable goods and products most needed

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Las Gardenias De Tapotzingo Group

texts.es:
NOMBRE DEL GRUPO: LAS GARDENIAS D. TAPOTZINGO
UBICACIÓN: POBLADO TAPOTZINGO, NACAJUCA, TABASCO
NUMERO D. INTEGRANTES: 8
MONTO D. CREDITO GRUPAL: $34,000.00

MARIA L. C.

L. señora María se dedica a realizar productos artesanales (bolsas, abanicos, cubre asientos D. carros, escobas, sombreros, tapetes y jícaras labradas) productos que aprendió a elaborar desD. su niñez, así como a L. crianza D. animales D. corral (cerdos, pollos, pavos) estos en su mayoría los utiliza para su consumo y en ocasiones para venta. María tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente D. elL., es madre soltera, decidió emprender su actividad para sacar adelante a sus hijos, su hija mayor le ayuda con el gasto D. L. escueL.. Su negocio lo tiene en su domicilio, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en L. compra D. cerdos pequeños y alimentación para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos en pie o por kilogramo. 

ElL. sueña con tener una granja D. cerdos para generar ingresos y así poder construir su casa D. material, ya que L. que tiene actualmente es una casa D. lámina.

ELIZABETH L. D. L. C.

ElL. se dedica a vender productos por catalogo (ropa interior para dama) desD. hace aproximadamente 8 meses, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, actualmente maneja sus ventas sobre pedidos mismos que realiza en Villahermosa, sus proveedores son Vicky Form e Ilusión, su negocio le sirve para ayudarse económicamente y apoyar a su mamá. Solicita el financiamiento para invertir en ropa interior, pantalones y blusas para dama.
ElL. sueña con tener un local D. tienda D. ropa en su domicilio, siendo sus principales clientes los habitantes D. L. comunidad donD. vive.

MARIA NINFA D. L. C. R.

Su familia consta D. 6 integrantes, dos D. sus hijos ya trabajan, su esposo es albañil y elL. artesana. Se dedica a L. elaboración D. petates desD. que tenía 9 años, sus principales clientes son las personas D. Villahermosa, elL. trabaja sobre pedido pero através D. un intermediario por lo que tiene que dar barato su producto.

ElL. sueña con tener su negocio establecido y que sus clientes L. contacten directamente así como tener a alguien que le ayuD. para poder realizar los pedidos oportunamente ya que para fabricar este producto artesanal se requiere D. un día por petate.
texts.en:
GROUP NAME: LAS GARDENIAS D. TAPOTZINGO LOCATION: POBLADO TAPOTZINGO, NACAJUCA, TABASCO NUMBER OF MEMBERS: 8 TOTAL GROUP LOAN: $34,000.00 MARIA L. C. María makes her living creating handicrafts (bags, fans, car seat covers, brooms, hats, rugs and worked pots). They are products that she learned to make as a child along with raising barnyard animals (pigs, chickens, turkeys). They use the majority of these animals for their own consumption and sometimes they are sold. María has 2 dependent children; she is a single mother. She decided to take on her activities to give her children a chance to get ahead. Her oldest daughter helps her with school expenses. Her business is in her home; she is requesting the loan to be able to invest in the purchase of small pigs and the food needed to raise them so she can later sell them live or by kilogram. She hopes to one day have a pig farm to generate income and then be able to construct a well-built house, since the one she has now is maD. of tin. ELIZABETH L. D. L. C. For approximately 8 months, she has maD. her living from catalog sales (ladies' undergarments). Her main customers are her neighbors. For now she drives to Villahermosa to pick up her pre-sold merchandise. Her suppliers are Vicky Form and Ilusión. Her business allows her to financially support herself and to help her mother. She is requesting the financing in order to invest in ladies' undergarments, pants and blouses. She dreams of having a home-based clothing store, being that her main customers are the residents in the community where she lives. MARIA NINFA D. L. C. R. Her family consists of 6 members. Two of her children already work, her husband is a mason, and she is a craftswoman. She has maD. her living making bedrolls since she was 9 years old. Her main customers are the people of Villahermosa. She works on pre-sales, but through a middleman, to whom she has to sell her products at a reduced rate. She hopes to have her business established one day and for her customers to contact her directly. She also hopes to have someone to help her process her orders in a timely fashion, since making this handicraft requires one day per bedroll.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic materials for handicrafts and catalog sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marithza Elvira

texts.es: Marithza Elvira M. M. de 41 años de edad, reside en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee un basar en el cual comercializa ropa, carteras, zapatos, accesorios, y otras cosas más. Marithza solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir aún más su negocio, sobre todo para esta temporada de fin de año en que las personas buscan comprar ropa a muy buenos precios, beneficios los cuales Marithza le brinda a sus clientes ya que se destaca por vender productos a buenos precios y de excelente calidad. Ella espera poder mejorar sus ganancias, ya que es el sueño de toda madre el poder brindarle todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marithza Elvira M. M. is 41 years old and a resident of Colón, which is in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and two children. Marithza manages a bazaar where she sells clothing, handbags, shoes, accessories, and other items. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase the inventory of her business because of the year-end season. During this time, people are looking to buy clothes at good prices. Marithza benefits from these conditions, so she aims to provide her customers excellent quality merchandise at great prices. She hopes to improve her earnings since her dream, like any mother, is to provide her children with all the necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise

loans.name: Flor De Amapola Group

texts.es:
Cristina Ilaya de 39 años teje y vende ropa para bebes ya que tiene un pequeño taller de tejido en su domicilio, Norma C. de 29 años costura faldas para mujeres, también en su domicilio, Mónica T. de 20 años costura bermudas en su domicilio, éstos son algunos ejemplos de los negocios que tienen las integrantes del grupo Flor de Amapola que a su vez pertenecen al Centro Focal Villa Adela. Ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la tela y lana para  elaborar mayor cantidad de productos que ofertar a sus clientes.
Además a ellas les agrada el servicio de salud que se encuentra en este Centro Focal ya que pueden hacer uso de este servicio no solamente en el día de reunión, sino otros días también llevar a sus hijos e hijas para que les realicen un control de peso y talla.
texts.en:
Cristina is 39 years old. She makes and sells baby clothes and has a small workshop in her home. Norma is 29 years old and makes women's skirts, also in her home. Monica is 20 years old and makes shorts in her home. These are some examples of the activities conducted by the members of the group "Flor de Ampola," which is part of the "Centro Focal Villa Adela." They need a loan to buy supplies such as cloth and yarn to make more products for their customers. They also appreciate the health services they receive from the "Centro Focal" and that they can use these services anytime and take their sons and daughters to help in controlling their weights.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth and yarn

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol B. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en el Congo en el departamento D. Santa Ana, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Marisol se dedica a la venta ropa, la cual la comercializa D. manera ambulante por las calles D. Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad, ella va D. casa en casa ofreciendo su producto, siempre con la ilusión D. tener una venta muy buena en el día, ya que su mayor deseo es poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos y ayudarle a su esposo. Marisol solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa y así mismo poder aumentar la variedad D. estilos y colores, ya que ella confía en aumentar sus ventas si posee mayor cantidad D. prendas. Ella es una persona muy dedicada a su familia la cual desea con todo su corazón brindarles todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Marisol B. D. M. is 34 years old and a resident of Congo in the department of Santa Ana. She lives with her husband and two dependent children who are in school. Marisol sells clothing as a traveling vendor through the streets of Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. She goes from house to house offering her products always with the hope of having a good sales day. Her greatest desire is to proviD. for all the needs of her children and to help her husband.

Marisol is requesting a loan to purchase a large quantity of clothing so that she can offer a variety of styles and colors, thereby increasing her sales. She is a person who is very dedicated to her family and desires with all her heart to give them the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

location.town: Congo en el departamento de Santa Ana

loans.name: María Verónica

texts.es: María Verónica C. D. L. D. 30 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, vive junto a su único hijo D. cinco años D. edad. Ella es una mujer la cual trabaja arduamente día con día para brindarle todo a su hijo, ya que es ella la única que vela por el bienestar D. su hijo. María cuenta con una venta D. frutas y verduras en el mercado Municipal D. Usulután, lugar en el cual ya cuenta con bastantes años D. tenerlo. Las personas hablan muy bien D. ella ya que es amable y una persona muy consiente con los precios D. su producto es por esta razón por la cual ella cuenta con muchos clientes. María solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras, sobre todo frutas D. esta temporada como uvas y manzanas las cuales son muy vendidas en esta época del año. D. esta manera ella podrá aumentar sus ventas y poder brindarle una feliz navidad a su hijo.
texts.en:
María Verónica C. D. L. is 30 years old and a resident of the department of Usulután. She lives with her only son, who is five years old. María works hard day after day to proviD. for her son since she is the only one looking out for his welfare. She sells fruits and vegetables at the municipal market in Usulután, a place where she has conducted business for many years. People speak very highly of her and know her for being friendly. María has many customers because she is always aware about the prices she charges for her products.

She is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. Seasonal fruits, such as grapes and apples, sell very well during this time of the year. María hopes to increase her sales and proviD. a good Christmas for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 42 years old; she lives with her husband and 3 children in Guarari, Heredia, a poor region located in the Central Valley of Costa Rica. She is applying for a loan of 300,000 colons, and this will be her first loan with Fundacion Mujer.

At first glance, one would not be able to tell, but Jacqueline has a chronic illness called fibromyalgia, a virus affecting her muscular abilities. She has been sick for roughly 10 years. In order to fight the pain brought on by her illness, she takes up to 15 pills every day. The pills help; but the best therapy, she says, is her work. By staying busy with her candle-making, among other things, she can avoid taking so many pills, which leave her very tired and feeling weak. Jacqueline, or Jacky as it reads on her business cards, finds candle-making to be therapeutic as well as a means to generate income which helps pay household expenses and put her children through school. Her faith and her business are what get her out of bed every day and keep her motivated to take on life’s challenges with an optimistic outlook.

Jacky has eleven years' experience in the sales business; candle-making she has started relatively recently and has found it to be both profitable and rewarding. Jacky could not afford to take any formal candle-making classes, so she taught herself through trial and error. She can sell her candles for up to 8500 colons each. Her candles sell fast and she earns much more than she did working at the local mall. In a 12 hour day, she used to earn 7,000 colons working in a shop. Selling her candles, she can earn up to 350,000 colones per month. It takes her 2 days to make 8 candles.

This loan would be used to purchase raw materials and molds necessary for the creation of her beautiful candles. Recently, Jacky has received an abundance of orders for a specific type of candle she makes, with butterfly decorations. In order to respond to this surge in demand, she would like to purchase 2 more molds necessary to the creation of these candles. The molds cost 11,000 colons each. At the moment she has many different molds which she uses to create a variety of colorful, scented candles. This loan will help Jacqueline to take advantage of opportunities for increase sales associated with the Christmas season.

Under the business name ¨Creaciones Jacky,¨ Jacky and her son, Alonso, have put together a homemade catalog with pictures of the candles Jacky has created. When he isn’t studying chemistry at the National University, Alonso helps his mother sell her products to shops in the nearby mall.

Jacky is a true entrepreneur. Whether she is making candles, painting ceramics, promoting her products or taking care of the family, she is always doing something--and that´s the way she likes it.

loans.use: purchase of materials necessary for candle-making

loans.name: Talita Kurmi Group

texts.es: “Talita Kurmi” es un grupo de 11 señoras que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Alto Lima”,  se agruparon por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo dedicándose a la venta de verduras, masitas, hilado de lana, atención de tienda de barrio y artesanía en joyas. Ellas están concientes de que tienen varias competidores y tienen que ser mejores que ellos, atendiendo a las clientas de la mejor manera y ofreciendo productos de calidad. Un claro ejemplo es Maria P. de 48 años, casada y madre de 4 hijos, tiene su tienda de barrio y lo que más le ha llamado la atención de Pro Mujer es la atención en el consultorio y el ahorro, además con el crédito comprará aceite y fideo al por mayor.
texts.en:
“Talita Kurmi” is a group of 11 women who attend meetings in the “Alto Lima” Center. They meet to secure access to the loan that they all need to increase their working capital for various enterprises including the sale of vegetables, cookies, spun wool, operating neighborhood stores and creating jewelry crafts. They are aware that they have many competitors and need to be better than them by having excellent customer service and offering high quality products. A clear example is Maria P., 48 years old, a married mother of 4 children who owns a neighborhood store. The thing that most caught the attention of “Pro Mujer” is the attentiveness in the store and the ability to save. With the loan, she will buy mostly oil and noodles.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Product purchase

loans.name: Gioconda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gioconda M. de 40 años de edad, vive en la zona de Perimetral de Guayaquil tiene una casa de cemento solo cuenta en su vivienda con agua y luz no tiene alcantarillado, Gioconda emprendió este negocio de cerrajería gracias a su esposo que hace 10 años atrás trabajo en una Empresa de soldaduras, pero al no cancelarle a tiempo y no tener beneficios de esa empresa decidió ser independiente con los conocimientos aprendidos comenzó a enseñarle su esposa Gioconda.

Ahora Gioconda con su esposo trabajan de 08h00 hasta las 17h00, compran soldadura, pinturas anticorrosivas y planchas negras algunos de sus clientes mas conocidos traen la materia prima para que le salga mas económico, una de las mayores complicaciones es la electricidad en tiempos de racionamiento del Gobierno y también el trabajo que hacen a sus 3 hijos les ocasionan alergias, sus 3 hijos estudian en la escuela fiscal cercana a su sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas y equipos para poder tener más movimiento en su clientela y darle una mejor vida a su familia, en el futuro quiere ampliar el negocio y así sus hijos tengas la oportunidad de estudiar en mejores colegios.
texts.en:
Gioconda M., 40, lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. Her house is concrete but it only has running water and electricity; no sewerage. Gioconda opened a locksmith shop thanks to her husband who worked for a welder 10 years ago. However, because they did not pay him on time nor offer any benefits, he decided to use what he had learned and open his own shop. He also began to teach his skills to Gioconda. Now, Gioconda and her husband work from 8am to 5pm. They buy solder, anti-rust paint, and black metal sheets. Some of their better known customers bring their own raw materials in order to save a bit on costs. One of the greatest complications they face is when the government rations electricity use and some of the projects they work on irritate allergies in their three children, who are students at the local elementary school. With the funding she wants to buy tools and equipment so that she can have a larger customer turnover in order to provide a better life for her family. In the future, she would like to enlarge her business so that her children will have the opportunity to go to better schools.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For tools and equipment.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a 40-year-old woman from Santa Barbara, Heredia, a poor region in the Central Valley of Costa Rica. She is a single mother of two children who completed 9th grade. In the past, Blanca has received two previous loans of 500,000 colones,each that were repaid on time and in full. This will be her third loan from Fundacion Mujer and she is happy to be applying for a larger amount than she has in the past (650,000 colones).

The name of Blanca´s business is "Confecciones M." (M. Apparel). Blanca makes and alters clothing. Her specialty is creating children's pajamas. She makes more profit from selling pajamas than from other types of clothing. She also makes women’s clothes (blouses, skirts) and offers various customized products.

Blanca sells her clothes to a distributor who comes to her home in Santa Barabara every 15 days. The distributor purchases children’s pajamas (for ages 12 and under) and women’s clothing to sell throughout Costa Rica. Blanca has been in this business for 20 years. She opened her business with an initial investment of 125,000 colones from loans from a friend and her sister. In a good month, she can earn 500,000 colones; in a bad month, only 300,000. Blanca plans to use this loan to purchase raw materials and invest in a new sewing machine.

Blanca has been sewing all her life. She has been making clothes for as long as she can remember. She is a hard-working woman who dedicates 12 hours each day to her business. The income she earns from sewing is the only source of income for her family. Her goal is to open a boutique where she can sell children's clothes. 

Due to the high costs of raw materials, Blanca has not been able to re-invest in her business. Her lack of necessities, such as elastic, fabrics, sewing thread, and other raw materials, have hampered her businesses growth. This loan will enable Blanca to purchase larger quantities of raw materials from her suppliers in San Jose. By purchasing in volume, she is confident that she will be able to secure better prices. With this loan, Blanca hopes to generate more income and provide a higher standard of living for her children.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jorge Trinidad

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge L. tiene 35 años, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y menor hija en edad escolar.Cuenta con un negocio de venta de abarrotes el cual es conducido por su esposa, él labora como obrero de campo en fundos de la zona actualmente en Agrícola La Venta SAC.Dicho negocio funciona en su domicilio desde hace seis años contando con experiencia en el rubro. Posee experiencia en otras entidades financieras demostrando puntualidad. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y diversificarlo para laborar de forma independiente.Solicitan crédito para inversión en su bodega ya que desean realizar compra de una congeladora por incremento en venta de bebidas en verano. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que se les brinda a su negocio para poder surgir y alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Jorge L. is 35. He lives in his own house with his wife and school aged daughter. He has a business selling groceries, which his wife runs. He works as a field laborer on farms in the area. Currently he works for Agrícola La Venta SAC. His business is in his home. He has six years of experience in this field. He has experience with other financial entities, and he has demonstrated punctuality. His dream is to make his business grow and to diversify it in order to work in an independent way. They are asking for a loan to invest in their convenience store. They want to buy a freezer to increase the sale of drinks in the summer. They are both grateful for the support offered to their business in order to be able to rise and meet their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Rildo

texts.en:
Rildo learned the craft of masonry in 2002 as an employee of a friend. A fast learner, he quickly began to notice all the possibilities for this type of service in Massachusetts and in 2005 started working for himself. His most difficult challenge was the language.

"I was not fluent in English, and I still am not yet, but it was much worse in the beginning. I had to pay someone to translate everything for me. I overcame this language barrier because my clients saw the perfection of my work and they were very happy with it."

"This is my 4th loan with AUSA. I used my 2 first loans to start building my credit in the US and the 2 most recent loans I used to purchase new equipment for my business. I used credit cards to purchase supplies, but I try to pay the full balance every month to avoid paying the high interest they charge. I read about ACCION USA in a local Brazilian paper. For now I am just focused on expanding my business, but I wish to save and buy a house for my retirement."

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA

Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions like ACCION USA support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and proviD. employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: Equipment for masonry

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es: Reinaldo D. C. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de  Chalatenango, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 6 y 5 años de edad. Él posee una venta de verduras, negocio en el cual su esposa le ayuda a vender su producto. Reinaldo solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder contar con una mayor variedad de verduras, y de esta manera aumentar las ventas, debido a que dicho negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que le permite tener estable a su familia con todo lo básico y necesario para ellos. Reinaldo es un señor el cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias ya que se destaca por ser un padre muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia, el cual cuenta con el deseo de brindarles todo lo que ellos necesiten.
texts.en:
Reinaldo D. C. is 30 years old, and lives in the department (administrative region) of Chalatenango. He lives with his wife and their two daughters who are 6 and 5 years old. He has a business selling vegetables; his wife assists him with selling his products. Reinaldo requests a loan since he wishes to be able to have a greater variety of vegetables so as to increase his sales. This business is the only source of income that allows him to have a stable situation for his family and provide for all of their basic and necessary expenses. Reinaldo is a man who has very good references and who stands out as a hardworking father who is dedicated to his family and wishes to provide them with everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: María Amanda

texts.es: María Amanda A. D. O. 54 años D. edad resiD. en Santiago Nonualco en el departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos todos menores D. edad. Ella posee un taller en el cual elaboran ladrillos que son hechos a base D. barro los cuales se introducen en un horno artesanal para cocerlos. Este negocio es administrado junto a su esposo y sus hijos, que ha pesar D. su corta edad han sido enseñados a realizar el trabajo familiar. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración D. ladrillos. María junto a su familia son un ejemplo claro D. superación, ya que ella junto a su esposo trabajan arduamente para que sus hijos cuenten con lo necesario para poder estudiar y así mismo les han mostrado el valor del trabajo, lo cual es una gran lección para el futuro D. ellos.
texts.en:
María Amanda A. D. O., 54, lives in Santiago Nonualco in the La Paz department. She lives with her husband and their four minor children. She has a brick making shop. The bricks are maD. from a base of clay and then put in a wood-fired oven to cook them. This business is run together with her husband and children. In spite of their young age, the children have been taught to do the family work. María is asking for a loan to be able to buy raw material to make bricks. María, together with her family, is a clear example of improvement. She and her husband work arduously together so that their children can have the necessities to be able to study. Also, they have shown them the value of work, which is a great lesson for their future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make bricks

location.town: Santiago Nonualco, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia M. de 42 años, reside en  Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual se dedica a trabajar como comerciante. Ella posee una tienda de producto perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en una zona muy comercial, ya que esta cerda de una escuela en la cual hay una gran cantidad de estudiantes. Dora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar productos como golosinas, bebidas enlatadas, frijoles, azúcar y otros productos más. Esto debido a que en muchas ocasiones por no contar con ellos no logra aumenta sus ventas, y es así como a través de dicho préstamo ella espera contar con el capital necesario para obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Dora Alicia M. is 42 years old and lives in Ciudad Arce, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who is dedicated to working as a salesman. She has a perishable and first needs products store that is located in a very commercial area, since it is close to a school with many students. Dora is requesting a loan to be able to purchase products such as snacks, canned drinks, beans, sugar, and many other products. This is because on most occasions, when she doesn't have these things, she can't increase her sales. This is why through this loan she expects to have the necessary capital to obtain larger revenues.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains and snacks.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Hilbea Orbelinda

texts.es: Hilbea Orbelinda Q. D. C. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijos D. 10 y 9 años D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. frutas y verduras, la cual la comercializa en un local cerca del Mercado Municipal D. Usulután, Hilbea trabaja junto a su madre atendiendo a los clientes y así mismo su madre le ayuda a cuidar a los niños. Hilbea solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, comprando pollo, frutas, verduras, golosinas y especias, D. manera que pueda surtirlo lo más posible su negocio y así aumentar sus ventas, ya que Hilbea es la única que aporta a su familia debido a que la única fuente D. ingresos con la que cuentan es dicho negocio, por medio del cual ella pueD. brindarle todo lo necesario a su madre y sus hijos.
texts.en:
32-year-old Hilbea Orbelinda Q. D. C. lives in the Usulután region. She lives with her mother and her two children who are 10 and 9 years old. She sells fruit and vegetables at a site near the Municipal Market in Usulután. Hilbea works with her mother in tending to the customers and her mother also helps take care of the children. Hilbea is requesting a loan that she'll be able to use to stock her business by buying chicken, fruit, vegetables, sweets and spices. Hilbea hopes to be able proviD. as much variety as possible and thus increase her sales, since she is the sole wage earner in the family and the only source of income that they count on is her business, which helps her proviD. for her mother and children.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Damaris Del Carmen

texts.es: Damaris del Carmen E. M. de 33 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Delgado, vive junto a  sus tres hijos menores de edad. Damaris posee una venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, así también vende vaselinas, la cuales son un tipo de crema para la piel. Cada día Damaris sale a las calles de Ciudad delgado ofreciendo su producto de manera ambulante, lo cual le deja ganancias diarias, la cuales no le son suficiente para solventar todos sus gastos familiares, ya que ella debe esforzarse el doble por su familia debido a que es madre soltera. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, los cuales muchas personas se los solicitan y que por falta de capital no ha podido comprar, ella espera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y poder aumentar sus ventas diarias.
texts.en:
33-year-old Damaris del Carmen E. M. lives in Ciudad Delgado with her three children who are minors. Damaris sells clothing for men, women and children and also sells petroleum jelly, which is a type of skin cream. Every day, Darmaris takes to the streets of Ciudad Delgado to sell her product on foot. Her daily income is not enough to cover all of her living expenses because she has to work doubly hard for her family since she's a single mother. She is requesting a loan that she'll use to buy a greater amount of products, which many people are asking for and which she has not been able to buy due to a lack of capital. She hopes to improve her business conditions and to be able to increase her daily sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy skin products.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Ana Yanci

texts.es: Ana Yanci C. R.  de 27 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango. Vive junto a su esposo, su hijo de 7 años de edad y su cuñada. Ana posee un bazar en su propia casa de habitación el cual comercializa diferentes productos como ropa, zapatos, productos para el cabello y muchos más. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda aumentar su inventario, sobre todo porque en esta temporada de fin de año es cuando ella percibe más ventas y ella espera poder contar con el capital necesario para esta temporada para poder comprar mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Ana Yanci C. Rodriguez is 27 years old and lives in the town of Llopango. She lives with her husband, her 7 year old son, and her sister in law. Ana has a store in her own home which sells different products such as clothes, shoes, hair products and many more. She is asking for a loan with which she can increase her inventory, especially since this end of the year season is when she has the most sales. She hopes to be able to have the necessary capital for this season to be able to purchase a wider variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes, shoes and acccesories.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es: Milagro de la Paz T. G. de 43 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Apopa en San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijos, el mayor de 14 años y el menor de 13 años de edad, los cuales son el motor que le permite seguir adelante y esforzarse día con día por luchar y brindarles todo lo necesario. Milagro posee una venta de cereales en la placita central de Apopa, dicho lugar es muy transitado sobre todo por las mañanas y mediodías, es de esta manera por la cual ella trabaja y lleva el sustento diario a su familia.  Es por esta razón que Milagro solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando más productos como arroz frijoles y azúcar, ya que estos son los productos más básicos dentro de la dieta salvadoreña y por ende son los más vendidos.
texts.en:
Milagro de la Paz T. Gonzalez is 43 years old, she lives in the Apopa municipality in El Salvador. She lives together with her two children, the eldest is 14 and the youngest is 13. They are her source of motivation and the reason why she works so hard day after day, to provide them with everything they need. Milagro sells cereal grains in the central plaza of Apopa, a very well-travelled place, especially in the mornings and during the lunch hours. This is where she works every day to support her family. Milagro is requesting a loan so that she might invest into her business in purchasing products such as rice, beans, sugar. These are the basic food staples of Salvadoran foods and they are products that sell best.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, and sugar.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Candelaria De La Cruz Ramírez

texts.es: Candelaria de la Cruz R. de 35 años de edad, reside en la colonia Modelo ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador. La señora Candelaria esta acompañada y también vive junto a sus tres hijos todos menores de 18 años de edad. Su compañero de vida se dedica a la venta de productos varios como ropa, productos perecederos entre otros más. Candelaria posee una venta de zapatos la cual esta ubicada en el mercado Sagrado Corazón, uno de los mercados que cuenta con más afluencia de personas y  uno de los más antiguos de la ciudad de San Salvador. Candelaria es una persona muy trabajadora la cual dedica su tiempo a trabajar para darle todo lo que sus hijos necesitan y así mismo contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más zapatos de manera que tenga más variedad que ofrecer.
texts.en:
Candelaria de la Cruz Ramirez is 35 years old and she lives in the Modelo colony in El Salvador. Candelaria is married ans she lives together with her three young children. Her life partner sells various products such as clothing, perishable foods and others. Candelaria sells shoes in the Sagrado Corazon market, one of the best visited and one of the oldest markets in El Salvador. Candelaria is a very hard working woman and she spends her time working to provide her kids with all that they need, as well as to contribute towards the household expenses. She is requesting a loan so that she might purchase more shoes to add variety to her store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes.

loans.name: Roger Alejandro

texts.es:
A sus 45 años de edad el Sr. Roger Alejandro D.  es una persona responsable que junto con su esposa han sacado adelante a sus dos hijos en edad escolar. Se dedica al negocio de venta de leche agria con tortilla desde hace 8 años  en el barrio Tierra prometida ubicado en la ciudad de Managua.
Desde que inicio el negocio se a caracterizado por ser una persona responsable y muy esforzada ya que inicio vendiendo ambulante en la terminal de buses del mercado Israel lewite, una de las necesidades que atraviesa el Sr. Roger es la urgencia de obtener dinero para la compra de leche de vaca y termos para el negocio y es por eso que acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita comprar productos para el negocio todo esto para comercializarlo  con el fin de obtener utilidades para mantener su hogar .
Es necesario mencionar que desde que ceprodel me ha brindado créditos ha venido mejorando su situación económica ya que al incrementar el producto han incrementado sus ventas por lo que ahora cuenta con 20 vendedores  que sacan a vender el producto.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Alejandro D. is a very responsible person. He, together with his wife, has provided for their two school-aged children. He has been selling milk and tortillas for the past 8 years in the Tierre Prometida district in the city of Managua.

Since he started his business he has been known for his very responsible ways and for his hard work. He started out selling in the bus terminal of the Israle Iewite market. One of the needs that Mr. D. current sees is a supply of funds to purchase milk and thermos containers for his business. For this reason he has approached Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan. It will permit him to purchase products for his business and to sell in order to support his household.

It is important to mention that since Ceprodel has been granting him loans, he indicates, his sales have improved his financial siutation and he has been able to increase the volume of his sales. Currently he employs 20 individuals that help him sell the product.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk and thermos containers.

loans.name: Álvaro  José

texts.es:
El Sr. Álvaro Antonio S.  casado y padre de familia de dos hijos los que se encuentran en edad escolar. Don Álvaro S.  acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita comprar materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que necesita comprar perlines, zinc, pintura y clavos para el techo de su casa el cual esta deteriorado y en invierno el agua penetra en su hogar.
Cabe mencionar que desde que ceprodel me ha estado financiando créditos e podido mejorar mis condiciones de vida para mi familia.
texts.en:
Álvaro Antonio S. is married and the father of two school-aged children. Álvaro S. turns to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan that will allow him to buy construction materials to make improvements to his home. He needs to buy beams, sheets of zinc, paint and nails for the roof of his house, which is deteriorated and leaks in wintertime. It’s worth mentioning that, since obtaining financing through Ceprodel, I have been able to improve the standard of living for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza S. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Flordeliza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flordeliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Flordeliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: You

texts.en: Mrs. You S., 50, is a farmer who has been growing rice and raising pigs since 2000. She is married to Sokhom, 48, who is a veterinarian in the ministry and private practice.
