This couple has been married for many years and is blessed with four children, one of whom is married and three of whom are single and going to school. You S.’s husband always takes a taxi to his job location because he has no vehicle for commuting. They have decided to ask for a loan to buy a used motorcycle for their traveling needs.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S. is 29 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. Since 2000, she has been working as a silk weaver to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 3 in profit every day, while her husband sells grocery items. On average, he is able to make US$ 3 per day as well. This couple has one young child. Neange S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1200 which her husband needs to increase his grocery inventory. This will be a good chance for this family to better their standard of living.

loans.use: buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Joy Marion

texts.en:
Joy Marion A. is from the village of South Western Poblacion, Calamba, Mis. Occ. She is 20 years old. Joy Marion is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Joy Marion owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling products such as shampoo, canned goods, sugar and other daily use products in the local community. Joy Marion has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joy Marion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy Marion is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Joy Marion from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: South Western Poblacion Calamba Mis. Occ

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun S., 42, is married with four children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is involved in a business of selling various kinds of groceries at her home in the village, earning a gross income of US $20 per day. The family is also mainly assisted by her husband who is a painter, earning an income of US $7 per day. These sources of income help cover family expenses.

S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase more groceries to expand her current business. This is her sixth loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Unn

texts.en:
Unn K. is 50 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. Since 2000, she has been working as a silk weaver to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 3 in profit every day. Her husband makes and sells rice wine. On average, he is able to make about US$ 2 a day. Her husband also does farming in the rainy season. This couple has two children, one of whom is a farmer.

Unn K. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1100 to purchase a tractor to assist in their farm work.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Theoun

texts.en:
Theoun T., 47, is married with four children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she is involved in a business of manufacturing traditional Cambodian violins as souvenirs for tourists who visit Angkor Wat Temple, earning an income of US$ 5 per day. Her husband helps his wife and earns the same amount of income. These sources of income help cover family expenses.

T. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate better income. Therefore, T. is asking for a loan of US$ 400 to purchase a motorbike for family transportation. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim P., 36, is a mother of two children and has been married five years. Her children are in school and dependent on her care. Currently, she sells vegetables and meat to earn a living. Another source of family income comes from her husband’s business: he drives pupils to a private school in Phnom Penh. Sim P. needs a loan to buy fresh fish, which she will smoke and sell to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Mrs. Dina S. is a villager in Phoum Thom village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Sot Sam, is a motorbike repairer and he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy motorbike parts for his business, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy these accessories for his business.  Mrs. Dina S. is a mother of four children who are all are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts for her husband's business

loans.name: Thoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoem H. is a villager in Run Village in Takeo province and she is a farmer who owns 0.3-hectares (0.75-acres) on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is the mother of three children who are all employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Chor Lot, is shown on the left in the photo.

Mrs. Thoem H.’s husband is a construction worker and he also is a zinc maker. In the business of zinc making, he now faces a problem because he does not have enough money to buy raw materials to make more zinc so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more raw material for her husband’s business. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her husband to make more zincs and to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo C. T., 45, has her own small business selling fruit drinks and cakes to people along the street. Her husband works in construction. Keo C. T. has three children: one is married and two are students. Both of her school-aged children face difficulty going to school, because their school is far from their house and they have no vehicle for traveling. Thus, Keo C. T. requests a loan to buy a bicycle for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey T., 28, owns a large farm that she inherited from her grandparents. She and her husband have a young child who goes to school. On her farm, Srey T. and her husband plant rice and vegetable crops, which they sell. In the past, the family has rented a cow to help plow their land. To save the rental fee, Srey T. requested a loan to be used to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en: S. is 36 years old and currently lives with her family in a rural area of Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She is a married woman and makes a living by growing crops to sell. S. has a lovely young child who attends school, while her husband assists her on the farm. S. also hires a laborer to help plow her farmland. She wants to save the hiring fee by using a Kiva loan to buy a cow, which she will use to plow her land.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn S., 29, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children.

Chorn S. is involved in the business of selling various kinds of soft drinks and clothes, earning a gross income of US$20 per day. The family is also assisted mainly by her husband who is employed as an APSARA authority, the person who looks after the security of the temples and the environment. These sources of incomes help cover the family expenses. He also produces palm sugar for sale. He is able to earn an income of US$5 per day.

S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase souvenirs for selling to the tourists who visit Angkor Wat Temple. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy souvenirs for selling to the tourists

loans.name: Milwida

texts.en:
Milwida C. is from the village of Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba Mis. Occ. She is 43 years old. Milwida is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Milwida owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as sugar, milk, canned goods, shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other daily used products in the local community. Milwida has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Milwida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milwida is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Milwida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store

location.town: South Western Poblacion Calamba Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem P., 30, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is employed at a Korean food restaurant in the town, earning an income of US $2 per day. The family is also assisted mainly by her husband, who is employed as a police officer and who looks after the safety of the people who visit Angkor Wat Temple. He is able to earn an income of US $7 per day to help cover the family expenses. P. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This loan will help her family to cut back on public transportation services. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. P. is pictured with her husband and one of her children.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou S. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba Mis. Occ. She is 43 years old. Marilou is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase things for her manicure/pedicure salon

loans.name: Thlang

texts.en: Thlang B. is 45 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang, a province of Cambodia. She is married and has been blessed with four children. Two of her children have finished school and are married, while the other two attend school. To earn a living, Thlang B. orders rice in bulk to sell at retail to people who come to shop in the market. Her husband helps support the family by driving a motorbike taxi. Thlang B. needs a loan to use as additional capital for her trade.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her trade

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Tem Y., 45, is married with six children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries at her home in the village, earning an income of US $1.50 per day. Her husband is a deputy village chief with a monthly US $20 wage. The family is also assisted mainly by two of her children who are employed as construction builders. They are able to contribute to the family US $7 per day to help cover the family expenses. Y. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, Y. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase pineapple seedlings for growing. With the remainder, she plans to expand her grocery business. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. Y. is pictured while she is sitting in the hummock.

loans.use: buy pineapple seedlings and groceries to expand the business

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth G. is the one wearing the white T-shirt and in front is her husband. Lilibeth is from the village of South Western Poblacion Calamba Mis. Occ. She is 28 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the market. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilibeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lilibeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additonal fish to sell

location.town: Souht Westen Poblacion Calamba Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem P., 40, is married with four children (she is in the photo background). She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a craft business of producing Cambodian traditional violins as souvenirs for the tourists who visit Angkor Wat Temple, earning an income of US $7 per day. Her husband helps her in the business (he is in the foreground), and he is also a security guard for a private company, earning an income of US $3 per day. Both sources of income from P. and her husband help cover the family expenses. P. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, Yav is asking for a loan of US $300 to purchase more raw materials to produce the violins. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. P. is pictured with her husband and one of her children.

loans.use: buy more raw materials to produce Cambodian violins for tourists

loans.name: Arcily

texts.en: Arcily P. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old and is married. Arcily owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Arcily joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Verjie

texts.en:
Verjie D. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Verjie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Verjie owns & operates in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting coconuts in the local community. Verjie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Verjie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Verjie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Verjie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Verjie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers for coconut groves

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann S. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban Camoguin Province. She is 40 years old. Ann is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ann owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ann has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ann is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina T. is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Gina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace C. is from the village of South Western Poblacion Calamba Mis. Occ. She is 54 years old. Grace is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: South Western Poblacion Calamba Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda, de 42 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, abre las puertas de su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus clientes, ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse algo a sus casas. Su tienda es muy concurrida, ya que es la mejor equipada de su barrio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así se puede enterar de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. 
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera hacer arreglar la infraestructura de su local.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Amanda con MFP, está muy feliz de la oportunidad y promete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socias muy respetada por el orden que pone en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Amanda, 42 years of age, is a simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own house. What she most desires is to succeed in life. Each day, very early in the morning, she opens the doors to her grocery store to tend to her customers. She is a persuasive saleswoman, and always manages to convince patrons to take something home with them. Her store is very busy, as it’s the best stocked in the neighborhood. What she enjoys most about her work is chatting with customers, which is how she finds out what’s going on in the area. She has been running her store for 10 years, and finds staying in the store all day without being able to go out to be the most challenging part about her business. In the future, she hopes to make improvements to the space in which her store is located. This is Amanda’s fifth loan with MFP, and she is very grateful for the opportunity and promises to make all her payments on time, as she would like to continue having access to credit in the future. She is one of the most respected members of her cooperative bank since she helps keep the group organized. She plans to use the 1,500.00 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more products to better supply her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en: Adelfa D. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Adelfa owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Adelfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Larn

texts.en: Larn L., 32, is married with four children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling groceries at home in her village to her new and existing customers, earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband produces traditional drums as souvenirs for tourists, earning a gross income of US $14 per day. Both sources of income from L. and her husband help cover the family expenses. L. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, L. is asking for a loan of US $600 to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. L. is pictured with her husband while he is producing drums.

loans.use: to repair the house

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia, de 40 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha luchado mucho por salir adelante, vive en al casa de uno de sus familiares y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
El tejido artesanal es la actividad que ella realiza para ganarse la vida, en su vivienda tiene su taller de tejidos, cuenta con 2 máquinas de tejer, las cuales utiliza para realizar distintos tipos de acabados a sus prendas. Eusebia vende de forma ambulatoria en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Juliaca, ya que siente que así abarca una mayor cantidad de clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. 
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera tener un puesto estable donde vender sus prendas con más tranquilidad.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Eusebia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y espera poder hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas artesanales que produce.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 40 years of age, is a woman who throughout her life has fought to get ahead. She lives in a relative’s house, and what she wishes for most is to live out her old age in peace. Knitting handicrafts is the activity by which she earns a living, and she has a workshop in the residence where she lives. She has 2 knitting machines that she uses to make different finishes for her clothes. Eusebia sells as a street vendor in the various markets of the city of Juliaca because she feels this method allows her to approach a greater number of customers. What she enjoys most about her work is chatting with patrons, which helps pass the time during her long workdays. She has been carrying out this activity for 10 years, and finds the most difficult aspect of her work to be walking all day long in search of potential buyers. In the future, she hopes to establish a stationary site where she could sell her wares more comfortably. This is Eusebia’s fifth loan with MFP, and she knows that she must pay her installments on time. She hopes to do this, as she doesn’t want to cause any problems for the other members of her cooperative bank, where she is very well liked. She will use the 1,000.00 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more yarn so she can increase the production of her handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama L. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Mama owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mama joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda, de 35 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos: Yeny de 14 y David de 9 años, a quienes desea dar una buena educación superior.
Desde muy joven incursionó en el negocio de los tejidos artesanales y trabajando para otras personas logró mantener a su familia. Ahora Leonarda ha comprado sus propias máquinas de tejer y trabaja a pedido para empresas textiles. Su trabajo es de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual cada vez tiene mas pedidos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite estar junto a sus hijos mientras cumple con sus pedidos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todos los días sin descanso para alcanzar su meta. 
Con tiempo, espera comprar más máquinas para poder incrementar su producción.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo; en su banco comunal es una socias muy alegre, por lo cual es muy querida dentro del grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de tejidos que elabora.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 35 years of age, is a loving and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 2 children: Yeny, 14 years old, and David, who is 9. She would like to provide them with excellent, complete educations. She started in the business of making knit handicrafts at a young age and, working for others, managed to support her family. Now, Leonarda has purchased her own knitting machines and works filling orders for a textile enterprise. Her work is very high quality, which has led to an increase in orders. What she enjoys most about her trade is being able to be with her children while she works to fulfill orders. She has been carrying out this activity for 4 years, and finds the most difficult part of her job is having to work every day to meet her goals. In time, she hopes to buy more machines to increase her production. This is her second loan with MFP, and she feels capable of making her payments on time. She is one of the most cheerful members of her cooperative bank, which is why she is very well liked within the group. She will use the 1,500.00 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more yarn so she can increase the amount of knitwear she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn.

loans.name: Capistrana

texts.en: Capistrana S. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 63 years old, is widowed, and has four adult children. Capistrana owns and operates a variety store, selling food and other daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Capistrana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, de 43 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Teofilo), de 47 años, y con sus dos hijos; Humberto de 10 y Reñidla de 5,quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
Su negocio está ubicado en uno de los parques más céntricos de la ciudad de Juliaca, su puesto de golosinas es uno de los más concurridos, ya que está bien surtido y la gente sabe que ahí encontrará la golosina que está buscando, esto ha hecho que su negocio sea muy rentable y que se dedique de lleno a él.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin descuidarlo. 
Con el tiempo, anhela alquilar un local en la misma zona, donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el quinto préstamo al que accede Lucia en MFP, sabe que ese dinero le ayudará a mejorar su futuro, pero también tiene presente que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, para no meter en problemas a su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Lucia, 43 years of age, is a cheerful and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house along with her husband (Teofilo), 47 years of age, and their two children: Humberto, who is 10 years old, and Reñidla, who is 5. They are the reason she puts forth so much effort to succeed. Her business is located in one of the most central parks in the city of Juliaca. Her snack stand is one of the busiest, given that it is well stocked and people know that they will find what they are looking for there. This has made her business very profitable, and motivates her to dedicate herself fully to it. What she enjoys most about her work is chatting with her customers, as this helps ease the burden of all the long workdays. She has been carrying out this activity for 2 years, and she considers the most challenging aspect of her business to be at her stall all day long without pause. Over time, she hopes to rent a site in the same area where she could provide a higher level of service to her patrons. This is the fifth loan that Lucia has accessed with MFP, and she knows that the funds will help her improve her future prospects. However, she also knows she must make her payments on time in order to not create any problems for her cooperative bank. She will use the 1,000.00 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more mechandise, in order to better supply her snack stand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana es una mujer de 44 años que durante toda su vida ha trabajado muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Vive en la casa de unos familiares y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
En la feria Dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca, Sebastiana aprovecha para vender los juguetes de segunda mano que compra en el país de Bolivia. Los juguetes que trae están muy bien cuidados, además que ella les da una lavada para desinfectarlos antes de venderlos, motivos por los cuales se venden rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la cara de alegría, que los niños ponen cuando tiene uno de sus juguetes en sus manos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus muñecos de peluche, ya que los fardos son muy pesados y se cansa mucho. 
Para más adelante espera tener un puesto estable para vender sus juguetes, ya que actualmente lo hace de forma ambulatoria.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Sebastiana con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable, siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más fardos de juguetes para tener más mercadería que vender.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a 44-year old woman who, throughout her whole life, has worked very hard to succeed in life. She lives in the house of a relative, and what she wishes for most is to live out her old age in peace. Sebastiana sells used toys she buys in Bolivia at the Sunday market in the city of Juliaca. The toys she brings are in excellent shape, and she also washes them so they are disinfected before she offers them for sale. For this reason, they sell quickly. What she enjoys most about her work is seeing the smiles on the children’s faces when they hold one of her toys in their hands. She has been carrying out this activity for 10 years, and finds the most difficult aspect of her work to be transporting her stuffed animals as the bundles are very heavy and she gets tired. In the future, she would like to have a stationary location where she could sell her products since she currently works as a street vendor. This is Sebastiana’s sixth loan with MFP, and she knows she must make her payments on time and is committed to do so. She is known as a responsible member of her cooperative bank, and is aware that she must comply with the agreements made among members. She will use the 1,500.00 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy additional bundles of toys, so she will have additional more merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Sarn

texts.en: Sarn M. is 28 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. They have one child. Sarn M. weaves silk scarves to earn a living and is able to make about $3 USD of profit a day, while her husband (pictured here) is a farmer who is able to make $2 USD per day. Sarn M. is asking for a loan of $800 USD to purchase silk to weave silk scarves to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase silk for weaving

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 34 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pequeña hija y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de darle una buena vida.
En la comodidad de su hogar Victoria teje a mano sus coloridas prendas artesanales; todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, ya que tiene que cumplir con los pedidos que le hace un comerciante de los Estados Unidos, quien se lleva las prendas para venderlas en su país. 
Pero Victoria no sólo se dedica a vender lo que teje, sino que también reúne mayor cantidad de prendas de otras tejedoras, quienes igualmente reciben una buena paga por su trabajo.
Lo que más le gusta de su actividad, es que de cierta forma también ayuda a sus compañeras a progresar, lleva 10 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es tener que dejar de dormir para cumplir con los pedidos. 
Para más adelante, espera formar una empresa con sus compañeras tejedoras, con la cual todas puedan desarrollarse.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Victoria con MFP, en sus anteriores pagos siempre fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también. Las socias de su banco comunal le tiene mucho cariño, ya que es muy responsable. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Victoria, who is 34 years old, is a happy and sincere woman. She lives in a rented house with her little daughter and is willing to work hard to give her a good life. In the comfort of her home Victoria weaves her colorful handmade clothing. She works every day beginning very early because she needs to fill orders for a trader from the United States, who takes her clothing to sell in his country. But Victoria does not only sell what she weaves. She also collects a larger amount of clothing from other weavers, who in turn receive a fair payment for their work. What she likes the most about her work is that in some way she also helps her fellow women to move forward. She has been doing this work for 10 years and thinks that the most difficult part is having to stay up without sleep to fulfill the orders. Looking ahead, she hopes to form a business with her fellow weavers, so that they can all make progress. This is Victoria’s sixth loan with MFP. She was always on time with previous repayments and hopes to be this time as well. The members of her communal bank like her very much, because she is very responsible. With the 1500 Peruvian soles that she is asking for she will buy more wool to make new hand-woven clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool

loans.name: Marjie

texts.en: Marjie P. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Marjie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marjie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marjie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo O. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Consuelo owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products, such as banana cue, camote cue, and special beverages, in the local community. Consuelo has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Consuelo joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros S., 54, is a widow with six children, and they live together in a wooden house located across the river. Three of her daughters are sewing workers for industry. Ros S. has been a silk weaver for 19 years, a skill she learned from her grandmother. She sells her finished product to a middleman, who then takes it to re-sell at the market in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Ros S. is applying for a loan to purchase a plot of farmland in a good location for farming, on which she will plant different kinds of crops.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en: Anatalia A. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Anatalia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Anatalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Anatalia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

Edwina owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Edwina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Edwina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina A. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Melina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Melina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Melina joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Melina plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn M. is  a 39-year-old widow who lives in the village of Prk 9 Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store and selling food. Roselyn has 2 school-age children. The children go to school and also help in the business as part of their daily chores. She wants her children to finish their studies and to improve their living conditions.

Roselyn joined NWTF-Project  Dungganon in 1996 in the hope that she would be able to  improve her family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase her family's income. Now she earns an average monthly income of  Php 4,000 from her business activities.

Roselyn is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,500 was used to fund operations of her general store, and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, she is requesting her 15th loan, in the amount of Php 19,500, which she intends to use for her general store and food vending. Roselyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for general store

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia C. is a 37-year old married woman who lives in  Brgy Cabacungan, La Castillana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling used clothes, running a general store, and networking products of Avon.

Nelia’s husband helps her with the business. They have two children who are between 8 and 12 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Nelia joined NWTF-Project  Dungganon in 2001 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase her family's income. Now, she earns an average monthly income of  Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Nelia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 25,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and direct-selling of Avon beauty products, which had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting her 16th loan, in the amount of Php 29,500, which she intends to invest in her general store, clothes-selling, and networking businesses. Nelia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia B. is  a 58-year old widow who lives in Batang, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fish and other foods to people in her community. She has seven children, five of whom work and help her meet household expenses, while the other two are in school.

Letecia joined NWTF-Project  Dungganon in 1994 in the hope that she could help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of loans  from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase her family's income by selling fish and other foods. She now earns an average monthly income of  PHP 10,000 from her business.

Letecia is a member of good standing in our organization. She has taken out and repaid loans for PHP 22,000 which helped her improve her business and her family's life. She is now applying for a new loan, her 21st, for PHP 24,000, which she will use to continue expanding her business and provide her family with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Elizabeth Taabu

texts.en: Elizabeth Taabu O. makes a living by owning and running a hair salon, where she provides many different kinds of treatments to repeat and referred customers who live nearby.  She has run this salon for 25 years, and has staff working for her on a commission basis.  The main challenges she faces are lack of sufficient capital and strong competition.  She has applied for a loan for KES 20,000 to buy dryers, hair products and hair pieces.  She is married and has seven children who range in age from 10 to 26 years of age, and her main hope is that they become educated and live a better life than hers.  Elizabeth is widely thought of as humble, visionary and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy hair dryers, hair products and hair pieces.

Macarina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 in the hope that she would be able to help her  husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income. She now earns an average monthly income of  PHP 2,500 from her work.

Macarina is a member of good  standing of our organization, and has made good use of previous loans for PHP 15,000 to expand her business and improve her family's life. She is now applying for her 13th loan, for PHP 15,000, and hopes to use it to continue provide her family with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dresses, skirts and baby clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 34 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo y sus dos hijos.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras de ropa, actividad que hasta el momento le viene dando buenas ganancias, gracias a la gran demanda que existe de estas máquinas.
Su trabajo consiste en llevar las lavadoras hasta la vivienda de las personas que lo solicitan y cobra por cada hora de su uso.
Actualmente ya tiene 3 lavadoras y espera poder comprar una cuarta para abastecerse en el alquiler. Paralelo a ello, también vende productos de belleza y en esta navidad quiere mejorar sus ventas.

Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual y responsable con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mercadería en productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock y así lograr mejores ventas en esta época navideña.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 34 years old. She lives in her own house along with her husband and their two children. For the past 3 years, she has been in the business of renting washing machines (for clothes), an activity which has been providing her with a good income, thanks to the great demand for these machines. Her work consists of taking the washing machines to people's homes on request and charging by the hour for their use. At present, she has 3 washing machines, and she hopes to be able to purchase a fourth to add to her rental stock. Parallel to this business, she also sells beauty products, and she would like to increase her sales this Christmas. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she has always been very punctual and responsible with all of her payments. With the funds she is currently requesting, she will purchase merchandise for her beauty products business, to maintain them in stock and thus achieve higher sales during this Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Joseph Kimathi

texts.en: Joseph Kimathi K. has sold home products such as cooking fat, soap, rice, flour and others to residents in the Maweni area in Mombasa for the last three years. This is the coastal side of Kenya  His business challenge is the lack of funds to restock the goods.  He plans to use the proceeds of a KES20,000 loan to purchase flour, cooking fat, rice and other items.  Joseph is looking forward to becoming a wholesaler in the future.  He is married and has three children ranging from 2 to 6 years old.  He describes himself as friendly.

loans.use: To add more home products.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer trabajadora de 48 años, comparte su vida con Zenón, su esposo, y con sus 4 hijos: Bryan de 24, Antoni de 19, Aron de 15 y Alexander de 9 años. Todos ellos viven muy contentos en su casa propia.
Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa, actividad en la que incursión gracias a que aprendió desde pequeña de su madre. Carmen se ha desempeñado en variedad de oficios para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Trabajó durante un tiempo en el país de Argentina, pero al tener a su familia lejos y no mejorar en su situación económica regresó a su querido país para poner un pequeño negocio. Es por ello que ahora está pensando en implementar una bodega, además de seguir dedicándose a la costura.     

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, siempre ha sido muy responsable con los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de tela para elaborar más prendas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a hardworking 48-year-old woman. She shares her life with her husband Zenón and their four children, Bryan, 24, Antoni, 19, Aron, 15, and Alexander, 9. They all live happily in their own house.

Carmen’s business is making clothing, an activity she learned at a young age from her mother. Carmen has had a number of different jobs to support her family. She worked for a while in Argentina, but because her family was so far away and she was not getting ahead financially, she returned to her beloved country to start a small business. She is thinking of starting up a store in addition to the clothing business.

This is Carmen’s fourth loan with MFP. She has always been very responsible with her payments. With this loan, she will buy a larger quantity of cloth to make more clothing items.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloth

loans.name: Romulo, Jr

texts.en:
Romulo P. Jr. is a 62-year-old married man who lives in the village of Sitio Buhi-an, Brgy To-oy, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. He earns his living by selling fish, and owning and operating three motorcycle tricycles, a rice farm and a fish pond.

Romulo’s wife, Erlinda, helps him run the business.  They have eight adult children who also help in increasing the family income by engaging in driving of the motorcycles. 

Romulo joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 in the hope that he would be able to improve the quality of life of his family. With the help of his loans  from NWTF-PD, he has been able to increase his family's income by engaging in fish vending, driving three tricycles, and running the rice farm and a fish pond.  Now, he earns an average monthly income of Php 90,000 from his business activities.

Romulo is a member of good standing. His previous loan of Php 29,000 was used to fund operations of his fish pond, rice farm and fish vending, and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, he is borrowing his seventh loan in the amount of Php 29,000, which he  intends to use on the fish vending business and motorcycle operations. Romulo is working hard to achieve his dreams and aspirations for his family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program,  NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda tiene 59 años, vive en su casa propia con su hijo Jhon, con quien también trabaja.
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de figuras de yeso; tales como alcancías, adornos, utensilio para la cocina, etc. Esta labor es la principal fuente de sustento para su hogar, ya que se dedica exclusivamente a ello. Florinda compra al por mayor todos estos adornos para posteriormente venderlos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, pero no de forma ambulatoria o individualmente, sino que ella recibe pedidos de los comerciantes y los abastecen
Para el futuro, Florinda espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender estos adornos al por mayor.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, siendo una persona muy puntual y responsable en todos sus pagos.  Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para aumentar sus ventas en la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Florinda is 59 years old, and lives in her own house with her son Jhon, who also works. For ten years she has worked selling plaster items, such as piggy-banks, decorations, kitchenware, etc. This activity is her principle source of household income, and the only job she works at. Florinda buys all of her items wholesale to then sell them at various markets around the city. She doesn't do this travelling around on foot, selling individual pieces, but instead takes orders from businesspeople and then fills those orders. For the future, Florinda hopes to have a store where she can sell her items wholesale. This is her fifth loan with MFP, as she is a very punctual person and responsible with her payments. With the money she is asking for, she will buy more merchandise to increase her Christmas sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise for sale for the Christmas season

loans.name: Rheynolds

texts.en: Rheynolds G. is from the city of Dipolog. He is 31 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Rheynolds owns and operates a business providing photography services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rheynolds joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve his business. This loan will be his first from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Wilberforce Osonyo

texts.en: Wilberforce Osonyo M. is a 37-year-old man, married and blessed with 3 children. He runs his own farm from which he supplies crops to the local market at Malanga, Busia district. Wilberforce started farming at around 15 years of age. He admits he was never good at books but in farming he is an A student. He would like a loan of Kshs. 30,000 to buy seedliings, fertilizer and hire labour for the new farm extension he made in preparation for the next rains.

loans.use: Buy seedlings, fertilizer, and hire labour

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda E. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Erlinda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 1,400 PHP a month. In 2007, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo (Raúl), y con sus 5 hijos: Juspy de 17 años, Carlos de 13, Luis de 9, Jorge de 7 y Lucas de 2 añitos. 
Ella se dedica a la atención de la carpintería que con mucho esfuerzo logró instalar junto a su esposo. Ahora, gracias a este trabajo, obtiene los ingresos necesarios para todos los gastos de su familia. 
A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le gusta fabricar muebles, pero a la vez es un trabajo muy riesgoso, más de una vez ha sufrido cortaduras y algunos accidentes con las máquinas, pero esto no la detiene, ya que sabe que todo trabajo tiene su riesgo y debe ponerle muchas ganas para salir adelante.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sus compañeros de su grupo confían en ella por ser muy responsable. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de madera y algunas herramientas para mejorar el trabajo en su taller.
texts.en:
Lucia is 43 years old. She lives with her husband Raúl and their five children: Juspy, 17, Carlos, 13, Luis, 9, Jorge, 7, and Lucas, only 2. With much effort, she has entered into the carpentry business, working with her husband. Now, thanks to this work, she has the necessary income for all the family expenses.

Lucia enjoys her work very much. She likes making furniture, but it is also dangerous. More than once, she has cut herself or had an accident with one of the machines. But this did not stop her, because she knows that any work has its risks, and one must make a great effort to get ahead.

This is her 1st loan with MFP. Her associates in the group trust that she is very responsible. With the money from this loan, she will buy more wood and some tools to improve the workshop.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood and tools

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza R. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Cansig-id Banga, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by raising hogs.
 
Flordeliza’s husband helps her in raising hogs, cows and other animals to sell, and they have five children, some of whom are still in school while the others are adults. They also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Flordeliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in hog raising and other animals to sell. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Flordeliza is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund operations of her hog raising and other animals, and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 14th loan in the amount of Php 15,000, which she  intends to use on her hog raising business. Flordeliza is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz A. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Luz owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal things, such as t-shirts, blouses, and so on, in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Luz joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Luz plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Jennyvie

texts.en:
Jennyvie R. is from the village of Tablon, Digkila-an, Iligan City. She is 25 years old. Jennyvie is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jennyvie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jennyvie has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jennyvie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennyvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jennyvie is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Jennyvie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 53 años, es soltera, vive en su casa propia con sus 2 hijos, los cuales son su apoyo incondicional.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en la bodega que gracias a mucho esfuerzo logro instalar en su vivienda. De esto ya son 8 años y desde entonces ha venido poniendo todo de su parte para salir adelante. 
A María le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que tiene la comodidad de realizarlo en su propia casa y así velar por sus hijos y las labores de su hogar. 
En un futuro quiere agrandar su negocio para que le arroje mayores ingresos y así poder cubrir los estudios de sus hijos.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, por lo que se compromete a seguir haciéndolo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más mercadería para mejorar sus ingresos y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 53 and single. She lives in her own house with her two children. They give her unconditional support. She sells food products in the convenience store, which, thanks to her great effort, she was able to install in her house. She started the store eight years ago, and she has been doing her part in order to get ahead. María really likes her work because she has the comfort of doing it in her own house. That way she can watch over her children and take care of the household chores. In the future she would like to expand her business to get greater income. That way she will be able to cover the educational costs for her children. This is her third loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual with all of her payments. She promises to continue doing so. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more merchandise to improve her income. This will give her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Douglas Shukuru

texts.en: Douglas Shukuru K. runs Deltech Electronics where he repairs and installs electronics and has charged batteries for churches and walk-in customers for the last 10 years.  He has one employee and does face business challenges from lack of funds and new spare parts.  He will be using the proceeds of a KES60,000 loan to add more stock of new electronics.  Douglas' goal is to open other outlets.  He is married and has six children ranging from 9 months to 19 years. Douglas describes himself as dedicated to his work.

loans.use: To add electronics stock

loans.name: Chrispinus

texts.en:
Chrispinus M. is 30 years old, a very jovial man who likes to joke. He has a third eye for life, he says, and he calls it, to my surprise, determination. He says you need to have this in the back of your head in order to make it in life.

Chrispinus is married and together with his wife, he runs a farm dealing mainly with vegetables like cabbage, kale, and traditional greens. He would like to venture into tomatoes as soon as he can.
