He has a number of cattle, too, for milk. He would like a loan of Kshs.20,000 which will go toward increasing his farming area in Malanga, Busia district. His main vision is to educate his children.

loans.use: Increase farming area

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria E. is from the village of Tablon, Digkila-an, Iligan City. She is 54 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2006, Gloria joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her tenth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Basoga Tweyambe Group, Jinja

texts.en: W. Rajab is the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a married man and his children go to school.  He has a retail shop that he has been running for a long time and a motorcycle business where he hires out men to help with bringing in an income. In his shop, he sells sugar, salt, cooking oil, bread, maize flour and muffins to his customers and the profit he gets helps him pay school fees for his children. He has also been able to buy a plot of land for his family and now they are in better shape. Rajab needs a loan to be able to buy more goods for his shop.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria A. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Candelaria owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas. She and her husband also have a small farm from which they take some vegetables to sell. Candelaria has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Candelaria joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mamatmurod

texts.ru: Маматмурод Джумаев проживает в районе Кабадияна. Возраст 30 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Мамтмурод более 5 лет работает трактористом. Помимо этого он более 4 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот на рынке. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Mamatmurod J. lives in the Qubadiyon region. He is 30 years old. He is married and has four children. Mamatmurod has been working as a tractor driver for more than five years. Besides that he has been doing animal husbandry for more than four years. He feeds and sells cattle on the market. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila tiene 53 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia.
Su negocio es la venta de diferentes artículos de uso persona; tales como ganchitos y adornos para el cabello, anillos, hilos, pinzas, etc. Para ellos tiene un puesto en uno de los mercados más concurridos de su distrito. Petronila sale de su casa desde tempranas horas llevando sus productos hasta su puesto y ahí permanece durante casi todo el día. 
Ella se siente contenta y tranquila con su trabajo, ya que le permite obtener buenos ingresos y así puede cubrir los gastos de su hogar.

Este es su doceavo préstamo con MFP, ella siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual a la hora de pagar sus cuotas y lo seguirá haciendo así. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para estas fiestas navideñas, cuando la demanda aumenta.
texts.en:
Petronila is 53. She lives with her daughter in her own house. Her business is selling different items for personal use. She sells things like hairpins, hair decorations, rings, thread, and hair clips. She has a stand in one of the most popular markets in her district. Petronila leaves her house in the early hours, takes her products to her stand, and stays there almost all day. She feels happy and at peace with her work. It allows her to get good earnings, and that way she is able to cover the household expenses. This is her twelfth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual when it is time to make her payments, and she will continue to do so. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for the Christmas festivities; this is when demand increases.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en: Paulo M. runs two kinds of businesses: selling farm produce and fish-selling. At the age of 29 years, he is married and blessed with 3 children. Both businesses are doing well, he says, and his main plan is to expand both by half again next year. Paulo needs a loan of Kshs.30,000 to restock his fish and channel some to his farm and cattle feed.

loans.use: Restock fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ceiroding

texts.en:
Ceiroding R. is from the village of Barina-ot, Iligan City. He is 18 years old and single. To make a living, Ceiroding owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Ceiroding is just starting this business.
In 2009, Ceiroding joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Ceiroding plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos, a los cuales ama mucho.
Ella posee una tienda snack donde ofrece diversos productos comestibles como golosinas, galletas, helados, entre otros. A Rebeca le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que tiene la comodidad de atender a sus clientes y hacer los quehaceres del hogar. Además se siente muy contenta porque su negocio va muy bien y cada vez va teniendo más clientela, pues está muy bien ubicada, cerca de la municipalidad de su localidad, lo cual hace que tenga buena cantidad de clientes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y al igual que en su negocio, promete ser muy responsable y que no faltar al pago de las cuotas. Con el dinero solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir mejor su tienda en esta época de verano.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 31. She lives with her life partner and their children; she loves them a lot. She has a snack store where she sells diverse food products like sweets, cookies, ice cream, and other things. Rebeca really likes her work because she has the convenience of waiting on her customers and doing the household chores. She also feels happy because her business is going very well. She keeps getting more customers. She is well located near the municipality in her area. That gives her a good amount of customers. This is her first loan with MFP. Just as she is in her business, she promises to be very responsible and not miss making a payment. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to better stock her store in this summer season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Carmen Liseth

texts.es: Carmen Liseth M. S. de 34 años, Reside en Ciudad Delgado. Vive junto a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales estudian. Carmen posee una venta de ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres en el Mercado Municipal de Ciudad Delgado. Sus dos hijas mayores le ayudan con el negocio atendiendo a los clientes. Carmen solícita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más variedad de ropa, ya que tiene muy buena clientela y ella desea poder brindarles más opciones de tallas y colores, de manera que pueda obtener mayores ganancias. Carmen es madre soltera pero esto no le ha impedido trabajar para poder brindarles todo lo que sus hijas necesitan, al contrario esto la incentiva a seguir adelante y seguir luchando por ellas.
texts.en:
Carmen Liseth is 34 years old and resides in Delgado City. She lives with her 4 children who are all students. Carmen has a clothing store for children, women and men in the Delgado City Municipal Market. Her two eldest daughters help her with the business, attending to customers.

Carmen requests a loan to buy a greater variety of clothing, since she has a very good clientèle and wants to be able to offer them more options in sizes and colors, in order to obtain greater earnings.

Carmen is a single mother but this hasn't stopped her from working in order to offer everything that her daughters need. On the contrary, this motivates her to forge ahead and continue struggling for them.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A VARIETY OF CLOTHING TO SELL

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Kuvvat

texts.ru: Аланазаров Кувват проживает в районе Кубаданиян. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам клиент работает строителем. Помимо этого он занимается сельским хозяйством. В основном он выращивает овощи, которые продает потом на рынке. Кредит просит для закупа семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Kuvvat A. lives in the Qubadiyon region. He is 31 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a housewife. He is a construction worker. Besides that Kuvvat is in agriculture. He mainly grows vegetables which he later sells on the market. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow a new harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for sowing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es: María D. los Ángeles C. D. V. D. 31 años D. edad, ResiD. en Ciudad Delgado y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas. Ella posee una venta D. ropa, la cual esta ubicada en las calles del centro D. San Salvador, en la capital del país. María solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar más ropa, sobre todo pantalones ya que son estos lo que más se venden en esta temporada D. fin D. años, y es por esto que ella desea poder obtener el capital necesario para poder invertir en estos días. María compra y venD. su mercadería al contado y tiene la característica D. ser muy responsable y puntual con los negocios.
texts.en:
María D. los Ángeles C. D. V. is 31 years old and resides in Ciudad Delgado. She lives together with her husband and three daughters. She owns a clothing store which is situated in the streets of San Salvador city centre, the capital of the country. María is requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothes, above all pants as these sell most in this holiday season. For this, she wishes to obtain the necessary capital so she can invest these days. María buys and sells her merchandise in cash and is characterized as very responsible and punctual with her business.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita Y. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Carlita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Carlita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2008, Carlita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Carlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Josphat Libwege

texts.en: Josphat Libwege S. runs a sawmill and has supplied timber and logs in Kisumu town for the last seven years. His business challenges are insecurity and the high cost of transportation. He plans to use the proceeds of a KES20,000 loan to buy more timber.  His goal in life is to own a timber yard.  Josphat is married and has four children.  He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Sonia Esmeralda

texts.es: Sonia Esmeralda G. de 23 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque en el departamento de San Salvador. Su familia esta conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijas de 9 años las cuales son gemelas y se dedican a estudiar. Sonia posee una venta de ropa para adultos y niños, así mismo vende calzados para niños y  para adultos. Durante seis años Sonia ha trabajado muy arduamente por mejorar las condiciones de su negocio pero hasta ahora los gastos del hogar no le han permitido poder comprar más mercadería. Es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar nuevos estilos de ropa y zapatos, de manera que sus ventas se incrementen, ya que en esta temporada las personas buscan la ropa que esta más de moda, y ella desea poder brindarles todo lo que sus clientes necesiten. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de poder brindarles una vida mejor a sus pequeñas hijas, no llenas de lujos pero si de lo más básico y necesario para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Sonia Esmeralda G. is 23. She lives in Tonacatepeque in the San Salvador department. Her family is comprised of her husband and their nine year old twin daughters. The daughters go to school. Sonia has a business selling clothing for adults and children. She also sells footwear for children and adults. Sonia has worked arduously for six year to improve the conditions of her business. Up until now the household expenses have not allowed her to be able to buy more merchandise. That is why she is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy new styles of clothes and shoes. Her sales will increase because this is the season when people look for more stylish clothes. She wishes to be able to offer her customers everything that they need. She does all of this to give her small daughters a better life. She does not mean a life full of luxuries. She means to give them the more basic and necessary things to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new styles of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance O. is 28 years old and a widowed of mother of 3 children and a guardian of 4 orphans. She runs a dairy farm business in Malanga, Busia district. Her main plan is to buy another dairy cow and keep expanding her farm to cater for the whole village in milk and dairy product supply. Her future dream is to ensure all the children under her care get the highest quality of education within the country. She would like a loan of Kshs.30,000 to enable her to get the new dairy cow she is after.

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kambar

texts.ru: Камбар Ниезов проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 55 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Ниезов более 4 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает лук, пшеницу для продажи. Ему в этом помагает его семья. Помимо этого он "художник", рисует картины. Кредит просит для закупа семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Kambar N. lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 55 years old. He is married and has three children. Kambar does agriculture for more than four years. He mainly grows onions and wheat for sale. His family helps him in this. Besides that he is an artist, he makes paintings. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow a new harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for sowing

loans.name: Douglas Edgardo

texts.es: Douglas Edgardo G. L. de 21 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas menores de 9 años, las cuales son estudiantes. Douglas posee una venta de productos de uso doméstico como tazas, platos, así mismo comercializa productos de uso personal como cinchos. Él trabaja de manera ambulante con su carreta cargada de productos los cuales los vende en el centro de San Salvador, lugar el cual siempre esta muy lleno de personas. Así también Douglas les paga a otras dos personas para que realicen el mismo trabajo en otras partes del centro. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual desea poder aumentar sus productos y poder comprar estilos nuevos de cinchos, ya que desea poder estar a la vanguardia con sus ventas y de esta manera poder vender más. Todo esto lo hace pensando en sus hijas y su esposa la cual se dedica a cuidar a las niñas y ayudarles con los estudios. Douglas necesita aumentar sus ventas debido a que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que posee.
texts.en:
Douglas Edgardo is 21 years old and resides in Tonacatepeque in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and their 2 minor girls, aged 9, who are students.

Douglas has a business selling domestic products, such as cups and plates, and products for personal use like belts. He sells his goods from a cart that he pushes around in the center of the capital, San Salvador, which is always very crowded with people. Also, Douglas pays two other people to do the same work in other parts of the city center.

He requests a loan to be able to expand his products and buy new styles of belts, since he wants to be in the vanguard with his sales and in this manner, to sell more. All this he does thinking of his children and his wife who is dedicated to caring for the girls and helping them with their studies. Douglas needs to increase his sales since this is the only source of income he possesses.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS, DOMESTIC AND PERSONAL, TO SELL FROM HIS CARTS

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina B. is from the village of Yumbing, in Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old. Rina is single and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rina owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling AVON products in the local community. Rina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rina is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed M. runs the Arusha Dishes restaurant where he has sold cooked food like french fries, rice and chapatis, among others, to frequent customers and walk-ins during the last 10 years.  His business challenge is fluctuating and unpredictable demand.  He plans to use the proceeds of a KES20,000 loan to add more chairs and renovate the restaurant.  His life goal is to run a hotel.  Mohamed is married and has two children.  He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy chairs and renovate the restaurant.

loans.name: Betty Lorena

texts.es: Betty Lorena O. L. de 43 años de edad, reside en Ayutuxtepeque en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su única hija de 22 años de edad con la cual trabajan arduamente en el negocio el cual ella lo consideran una bendición ya que es el que les ha permito tener todo lo que necesitan para seguir adelante. Betty posee una venta de ropa, zapatos, pañales y otros accesorios para bebés. Ella compra y vende al contado, y es por esto que solícita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir más comprando nuevos productos los cuales hasta este momento no ha podido ser posible debido a que no ha contado con el capital necesario para hacerlo. Es así como Betty espera poder mejorar sus ganancias y poder ampliar su negocio junto a su hija.
texts.en:
Betty Lorena O. L. is 43. She lives in Aytuxtepeque in the San Salvador department. She lives with her only daughter; her daughter is 22. They work arduously in the business, which they consider to be a blessing. It is the business that has allowed them to have everything they need to get ahead. Betty sells clothes, shoes, diapers, and other accessories for babies. She buys and sells for cash. That is why she is asking for a loan to be able to buy the new products. Up until now she has not been able to do this because she has not had the money. That is how Betty hopes to be able to improve her income and expand the business she has with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and accessories for babies

location.town: Ayutuxtepeque en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to buy seeds and expand his business.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana Gladis P. L. de 45 años de edad, reside en Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su compañero de vida y tres hijas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia, es por esto que se esfuerza mucho por mantener su negocio a flote, negocio el cual esta ubicado en el centro de San Salvador, en el cual comercializa productos varios como shampoo, pasta dental, salsa de tomate, especias y otros productos más. Ana Gladis solícita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar más productos, sobre todo aquellos los cuales cuentan con más demanda como granos básicos. Ella espera poder aumentar sus ventas ya que su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle una mayor ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Ana Gladis P. L., age 45, resides in Apopa in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her partner and her 3 children. She is a hardworking woman who is worried about the well being of her family, which is why she works so hard to maintain her business. The business is located in the center of San Salvador and offers various products like shampoo, toothpaste, tomato sauce, spices, and other items. Ana Gladis is requesting a loan because she wishes to buy more products, especially those in high demand like staple grains. She hopes to be able to increase her sales because her greatest wish is to be able to help her husband with the costs of maintaining their home and the children.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple grains.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Joseph Liembuli

texts.en: Joseph Liembuli S. runs a retail shop where he has sold goods like sugar, tea leaves, cooking oil, rice, soft drinks and salt to walk-in customers during the last 12 years.  His business challenges are low sales and strong competition from similar retail kiosks.  He plans to use the proceeds of a KES30,000 loan to add to his stock of sugar, flour, rice and salt.  Joseph's goal in the future is to become a wholesaler.  He is married and has four daughters ranging from 2 to 10 years.  He describes himself as hardworking and polite.

loans.use: To buy five bags of sugar, bales of flour, rice and salt.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana C. R. de 29 años de edad, vive en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su pequeña hija de 5 años de edad, su prima, una tía y su abuelo. Roxana posee una venta de camisas y pantalones para hombre, los cuales los comercializa desde hace 6 años. Cada día Roxana se dispone a vender lo más posible, todo por el bienestar de su pequeña hija, debido a que es madre soltera ella deber trabajar muy duro y poder brindarle una vida estable a su pequeña, así mismo debe aportar para los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de ropa, sobre todo para esta época navideña en el cual las personas cuentan con mayor disponibilidad para comprar, Roxana desea poder aumentar sus ventas y contar la capacidad de poder brindarle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Roxana C. R., age 29, lives in Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad together with her l5 year old daughter, her cousin, an aunt, and her grandfather. For six years, Roxana has had a shop selling men’s shirts and pants. Each day, Roxana gets ready to sell as much as possible, all for the benefit of her little girl. Because she is a single mother she has to work very hard to be able to offer a stable life to her daughter. At the same time, she has to contribute to the household expenses. This is why she is applying for a loan which will allows her to purchase a greater quantity and variety of clothes, especially for this Christmas season in which people want a greater variety of items for purchase. Roxana wants to be able to increase her sales and her ability to offer a better life to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing of different colors and sizes

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas O. runs the Asap Stationers and Printers, supplying stationery to non-governmental organizations. His business challenge is lack of funds to add more stationery. He is using the proceeds of a 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stationery.  

Thomas' lifetime goal is to expand his business and build a house for his family. He has been in this business for the last three years. Thomas is married and has a 3-month-old son.  He describes himself as aggressive, hardworking and dedicated to his work.

loans.use: To buy more stationery

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth S. is from the village of Agoho, in Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Ruth is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: José Osmín

texts.es: José Osmín M. de 40 años de edad, reside en San Marcos, en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Él posee una venta de papas en el mercado de San Marcos, lugar donde obtiene muy buenas ventas diarias. José desea poder comprar más verduras y así mismo poder surtir su negocio comprando frutas, es por esto que el solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda cumplir su sueño de poder vender más productos. José es un señor muy amable el cual agradece a Dios por contar con su propio negocio el cual le ha permitido hasta ahora suplir todas las necesidades de su familia y de esta forma poder pagarle los estudios a sus cuatro hijos, dos de los cuales ya  colaboran en el negocio, ya que son consiente de la importancia de que contribuyan con el negocio de la familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old and resides in San Marcos, Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and their 4 children. He has a business selling potatoes in the San Marcos Market, a location where he obtains very good sales.

Jose wants to be able to buy more vegetables and also, supply his business with fruits. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that will enable him to fulfill his dream of being able to sell more products. Jose is a very pleasant man who thanks God for being able to count on his own business, which has permitted him, up to the present, to supply all the necessities of his family, and in this form to pay for his 4 children's studies. Two of them already help with the work, conscious as they are of the importance of contributing to the family business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY FRUITS AND VEGETABLES TO EXPAND HIS BUSINESS

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario Gabriel, Jr. is from Iligan City. He is 29 years old. Mario is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Mario owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Mario has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mario is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Mario from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia P. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Cecelia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-three years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month. In 2005, Cecelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Erick Omwenga

texts.en:
Erick Omwenga M. is a water vendor who has sold water to residents and walk-in customers for the last two years in the slum area of Nairobi. Erick has  one employee. His business challenge is the rationing of water from the source, which is the Nairobi Water Company.  

He will be using the proceeds of a 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add another water tank. In addition, he has rental houses, a green grocer and also works as a casual laborer. Erick wants, in the future, to do commercial farming. 

He is married and has a 9-month-old daughter. He describes himself as jovial, friendly and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy another tank

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mr. K. is 34 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. (K. was busy at his business activities when the photo taken, so his wife is in the picture instead.)  He is a father of three children, all of whom are going to school and dependent on him. He is married to Sokny, 31, who produces rattan cupboards for sale. 

K. owns a vehicle which he uses to pick up ice cream to sell along the streets around his community. He usually earns approximately $3.60 each day. Currently, their income is not adequate to support the needs of the entire family. K. hopes to earn more revenue by operating a new business line, but he does not have enough capital to start it. He is requesting a loan of $500 to be used as capital to invest in selling sugar-cane juice.

loans.use: To invest in the selling of sugar-cane juice

loans.name: Mirna Guadalupe

texts.es: Mirna Guadalupe A. D. M. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en Mejicanos, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su hijo D. 13 años D. edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar y su madre la cual se dedica al trabajo del hogar. Mirna posee una venta D. verduras en una D. los mercados más grandes D.  San Salvador el cual es llamado Mercado Central, ahí las personas van a comprar los producto al por mayor. Es por esto que Mirna solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el capital necesario para comprar más productos, como granos básicos, más verduras y comprar fruta D. manera que tenga más que ofrecer a los clientes del lugar. Mirna se esfuerza día con día por su hijo y su madre, los cuales depenD. absolutamente D. ella, es por esto que Mirna desea poder aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mirna Guadalupe Arnero D. Martinez is 45 years old. She lives in Mejicanos, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her 13 year old son. He is a student and his mother does the housework. Mirna has a vegetable stall in one of the biggest markets in San Salvador named the Mercado Central. People go there to buy products wholesale. It's because of this that Mirna is asking for a loan with which she can have the necessary capital to purchase more products, such as basic grains and more vegetables. Also, to buy fruit so that she can have more to offer her customers. Mirna works hard day after day for her son and her mother who depend totally on her. This is why Mirna wishes to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es: Etelvina L. C. de 32 años de edad, reside en el municipio de El Rosario ubicado en el departamento de La paz. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad. Ella posee una venta de productos perecederos, el cual lo ha ido surtiendo durante cuatro años, a pesar de esto ella desea poder contar con más productos, sobre todo de productos como detergente, embutidos y productos enlatados. Etelvina desea poder mejorar las ventas de su negocio ya que anhela poder darle una mejor vida a sus dos hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y en algunos momentos del día a atender a los clientes. Etelvina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el capital necesario para comprar más productos para la tienda.
texts.en:
Etelvina L. C. is 32 years old and lives in the municipality of El Rosario, located in the department of La Paz. She lives with her 2 children, ages 13 and 11. She has a business selling perishable products, which she has had for four years. She wants to be able to have more products, especially products like detergent, cold cuts and canned foods. Etelvina wants to improve her business’s sales because she longs to be able to give a better life to her two children. They are attending school and sometimes, during the day they help with the customers. Etelvina is requesting a loan so she can have the necessary capital to buy more products for the store.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Ana Raymunda

texts.es: Ana Raymunda S. de 37 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad. Ella cuenta con un negocio en el cual vende fruta pelada, la cual la prepara con chile, limón y sal. Ana desea poder mejorar su negocio y vender otros productos como ropa, es por ello que solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el capital necesario para invertir en la compra y venta de ropa. Ana vela por el bienestar de sus hijos es por esto que desea poder hacer cosas nuevas las cuales le brinden un beneficio extra a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Raymunda S. is 37 years old, and lives in the Tonacatepeque department of San Salvador. She lives with her three young children. She owns a business where she sells peeled fruit, which she prepares with chili powder, lemon and salt. Ana wishes to be able to improve her business and sell other products like clothing, and this is why she is requesting a loan with which she can have the necessary capital to invest in the purchase and sale of clothing. Ana looks over the welfare of her children and this is why she wishes to do new things which can bring an extra benefit for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing

loans.name: Beveline

texts.en:
Beveline R. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Beveline is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Beveline owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Beveline is just starting this business.

In 2009, Beveline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beveline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Beveline's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Herna

texts.en: Herna S. is from the village of Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Herna owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month. In 2007, Herna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Herna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Guadalupe Alejandra

texts.es: Guadalupe Alejandra B. H. de 21 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella posee una venta de pericos australianos, conejos y así mismo vende productos como alimento y accesorios para mascotas. A pesar que el negocio es pequeño, Guadalupe agradece mucho poder contar con el debido que es a través de este como puede ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de su  bebé. Guadalupe solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos como alimento, platos y productos para el cuidado de los animales. Esto lo hace con la ilusión de poder aumentar sus ventas y así su economía familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Alejandra B. H. is 21 years old, and lives in Soyapango with her husband and her two-year-old son. She sells Australian parakeets, rabbits, and other products such as food and accessories. Even though her business is small, she is grateful for the income, for it allows her to help her husband and child with household expenses. Guadalupe is asking for a loan to buy items such as food, dishes, and accessories to care for animals. Her vision is to increase sales and thus income for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for animal care

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly D. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Beverly owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-one years and earns approximately 6,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Beverly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nelieza

texts.en:
Nelieza R. is from the village of Kiwalan in Iligan City. She is 34 years old. Nelieza is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nelieza owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Nelieza has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelieza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelieza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Nelieza's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda B. D. A. D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en San marcos. Vive junto a su esposo. Ella posee un comedor en el cual venD. desayunos y almuerzos, dicho negocio esta ubicado en el centro D. San Salvador, lugar el cual es muy transitado y hay muchos negocios, razón por la cual cuenta con muchos clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar granos básicos, frutas, verduras y bebidas heladas, D. manera que pueda brindarles una mayor variedad D. comida a sus clientes. Yolanda es una señora muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza por hacer la mejor comida es por esto que cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales disfrutan D. sus alimentos. Ella desea aumentar sus ventas y poder contar con mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Yolanda B. D. A. is 59 years old and lives with her husband in San Marcos. She has a small restaurant where she sells breakfast and lunch. Her business gets a lot of clients because it is located in the center of San Salvador, a busy area with lots of other businesses. She would like a loan to be able to buy basic grains, fruits, vegetables and cold drinks. This way she can proviD. a greater variety of food to her clients. Yolanda is a hardworking women and tries to make the best food. This is why she always has lots of clients that enjoy their meals. She would like to improve her sales and see a rise in her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buys basic grains, fruit and vegetables

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um L. is a good mother who has given birth to six kids. To make a living, Um L. sells small cooking ingredients in front of her home to her neighbors. She also sells items to her fellow villagers on credit; a few days later they will return with their money. In addition, her husband has the skill of turning wood into furniture to sell.

Recently, one of Um L.’s daughters has been married and she needs to build a new home to live independently, but she doesn’t have enough money yet to build one. So, Um L. requested a loan of $800 which will be used to start building a new wooden house.

loans.use: To build a new wooden house

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married, with one son. She sells women's clothing at Crystal market in Kherson town. Natalya has been in this business for three years. Her hard work and entrepreneurial skills have helped Natalya make this business a stable source of income for her small family.

Natalya would like to borrow 14,600 UAH to purchase additional items of clothing to increase her assortment of stock. She hopes to make additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe P. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month. In 2007, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Rosario Marlene

texts.es: Rosario Marlene M. A. de 33 años de edad, reside en San Martín, vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos menores de edad. La señora Rosario posee un comedor en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa frutas y verduras. Ya cuenta con ocho años de poseer el negocio el cual le ha permitido ayudarle a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Debido a que Rosario cuenta con una familia muy extensa, ella solícita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras, y de esta manera poder aumentar las ventas, ya que desean poder brindarles una vida digna a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosario Marlene M. A. is 33 years old, and she lives in San Martin with her husband and four young children. She has a food stall where she prepares breakfasts and lunches, and also sells fruits and vegetables. With eight years of running her business, she has been able to help her husband with all the household expenses. Because she has a large family, she asks for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. She plans to thereby increase her sales, for she wishes to offer a proper upbringing to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa R. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 50 years old. Narcisa is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Narcisa farms and sells local oysters known as "talaba" in the community. Narcisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP monthly average from these activities.

In 2006, Narcisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narcisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Narcisa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase supplies for her oyster culture. This will be Narcisa's 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her oyster culture

loans.name: Camelo

texts.en:
Camelo B. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao Camiguin Province. He is 33 years old. Camelo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, as a fisherman, he assisted her wife in selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp caught, and offer it in the local market. Camelo has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Camelo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Camelo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. Camelo is requesting another loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools for fishing like additional fishing nets and others. This will be his 4th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to expand his  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools for fishing like additional fishing nets and others

loans.name: Etbel Jeannette

texts.es: Etbel Jeannette B. D. U. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en San Martín y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores D. edad. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y comercializa ropa en su casa D. habitación, la cual ya tiene 15 años D. poseerla. Etbel ha trabajado en la tienda durante mucho tiempo siempre pensando en el bienestar D. sus hijos. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos D. primera necesidad y así mismo pueda comprar mayor variedad D. ropa para niños y adultos.
texts.en:
Etbel Jeannette B. D. U., 40, lives in San Martín with her husband and two minor children. She has had a grocery store in her home for the last 15 years. Etbel has worked in her store for a long time with her children's welfare always topmost in her mind. This is why she is asking for financing in order to buy more basic need items as well as a larger variety of clothing for children and adults.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables and clothing.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina V. is from the village of Silongon in Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Esterlina is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Esterlina raises and sells pigs. Esterlina has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 3,400 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Esterlina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to buy piglets to raise and sell. Esterlina is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Esterlina's 12th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her immediate family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic S. is from the village of Tambo, Iligan City. She is 25 years old. Marivic owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marivic from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina Q.  is a 56-year old married woman who lives in Barangay 1 in Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by selling fish. Josefina’s husband helps to run the business and they have six adult children who are all employed, but sometimes help in their parents' business.

Josefina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (PD) in 2002 to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family's income by selling fish. Now she earns an average monthly income of  Php 45,000 from her business.

Josefina is a member of good standing. She used her previous loan of Php 19,500 to fund her fish business. The loan has improved her business and her family’s living conditions. Now, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing Php 19,500 for her fish-selling business. Josefina works hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. She hopes that, when she has reached retirement age, the business and their savings can provide them with a better life.

 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. ("Dungganon" is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable.") Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "dungganon," a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Maybelly Grisel

texts.es: Maybelly Grisel H. D. H. D. 30 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Cuscatlán, vive junto a su esposo y cinco hijos todos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a trabajar. La señora Maybelly, posee una tienda en la cual venD. productos perecederos, dicho negocio lo posee desD. que se casó hace 16 años atrás, y es por medio D. esta por la cual ha logrado seguir adelante con su esposo, ya que es D. mucha ayuda para su compañero D. vida los ingresos que recibe gracias al negocio D. su esposa. Maybelly solicita un préstamo para contar con el capital necesario para surtir la tienda, ya que ella desea poder aprovechar la temporada naviD.ña y la temporada en que inician las clases, debido a que planea poder surtir la tienda con papelería.
texts.en:
Maybelly Grisel H. D. H. is 30 years old. She lives in the district of Cuscatlán, with her husband and their five children, all under age, but working. Mrs. Maybelly, owns a store where she sells basic products, that she opened 16 ago when she got married. Through this business she and her husband have been able to support their family as her earnings are of great help. Maybelly is requesting for this loan to have the money needed to restock her store. She would like to take advantage of the Christmas season and the beginning of the school year by buying stationary items.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic products

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Mrs. Ra B. is a villager in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Svay Duong, is a construction worker. He is also a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile and he does not have rice seed for growing. Thus, Mrs. Ra B. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers and to pay for plowing the field. She is 33 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to study. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizers and to pay for plowing the field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Said Khan Agha

texts.en:
This is S. Khan Agha, son of Sayed Osman Badshah. At this time, his fields are not fertile and he wants to improve his field's crops. He lives in Kama district. He is 47 years old and married with six children: four sons and two daughters. One is a bachelor hardworking man with much experience. His youngest son has graduated from an agricultural university. The others are students at school.

When he was informed that a loan process is supporting the people, he came to AFS and requested an individual loan of 50,000 afghani to buy high quality seeds and to obtain good products to help solve his problems. He would like to thank both AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) and Kiva lenders who support people around the world through this effective process.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María G. A. de 55 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una venta de productos perecederos como espaguetis, especias, salsas entre otros más. Así mismo comercializa productos de primera necesidad como papel higiénico, pasta dental entre otros productos. La Señora Ana solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos para surtir su negocio, sobre todo productos como azúcar, frijoles y arroz. Ella deposita sus esperanzas en que al contar con el capital necesario para surtir su negocio pueda aumentar sus ventas, ya que es así como ella logra solventar los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana María G. A., 55, lives in Soyapango with her husband and two children. She sells food items like pasta, spices, sauces, among others. At the same time, she also stocks basic needs items like toilet paper and toothpaste, among others. Ana is requesting financing to buy more stock items for her store, especially items like sugar, beans and rice. She hopes that by having sufficient capital to stock her store she will be able to increase her sales since this is her only way to help her husband meet household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia L. is from the village of Tambo, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Alicia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es: María Francisca L. de 66 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, vive junto a una hija. La señora María posee una pupusería en la cual elabora pupusas (comida típica salvadoreña, hecha a base de masa de maíz, rellena de frijoles, queso y chicharrón), en la mañana y en la noche. Ella solícita un préstamo, ya que desea poder empezar una venta de productos perecederos, así mismo tener la capacidad económica para comprar, maíz, frijoles y arroz para la elaboración de las pupusas. La señora María cuenta con la esperanza de poder aumentar sus ventas y esto verlo reflejado en su estabilidad económica, ya que a su edad ella espera tener una vida en la cual cuente con lo más básico y necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
María Francisca L., 66, lives in Ilopango with a daughter. María has a pupusería, an eatery where she makes pupusas, mornings and nights. [A pupusa is a thick, hand-made corn biscuit-like flat bread (made using masa de maíz, a maize flour dough used in Latin American cuisine) that is stuffed with one or more of the following: cheese (queso) (usually a soft cheese called Quesillo found in all Central America), fried pork meat ground to a paste consistency (called chicharrón, not to be confused with fried pork rind which is also known as chicharrón in some other countries), squash (ayote), or (pataste), refried beans (frijoles refritos), or queso con loroco (loroco is a vine flower bud from Central America). There is also the pupusa revuelta with mixed ingredients, such as queso (cheese), frijoles (beans), and chicharrón or bacon. Pupusas are similar to tortillas and especially to arepas. In fact, in El Salvador, normal tortillas are about the same diameter and thickness as pupusas, without the filling.)] She needs financing because she would also like to start to sell basic food items as well as to be able to buy ingredients, like corn, beans and rice, that she needs for her pupusas. María hopes to increase her sales to have a positive effect on her economic situation since, at her age, her wish is to be able to count on having the basic things necessary to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Chrouy Ampil Village Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Bunthoen S. is a group leader of five members who all live in Chrouy Ampil village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Dy Sideth, are duck eggs sellers. Since their businesses are going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Bunthoen S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more duck eggs for selling. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. This couple has a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more duck eggs for selling.

loans.name: Marta Edit

texts.es: Marta Edit C. L. D. G. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo y su hijo D. 9 años D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. frijoles, arroz, azúcar y otros tipos D. productos comestibles. Su negocio es D. mucha ayuda ya que les permite solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que Marta solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos como granos básicos, aceite y más. Marta es una personal muy responsable la cual desea mejorar las ventas D. su negocio, ya que ella como la mayoría D. personas vela por el bienestar D. hogar.
texts.en:
Marta Edit C. L. D. G. is 42 years old and lives in the Department of Usulután with her husband and her 9 year old son. She sells beans, rice, sugar, and other types of food products. Her business helps a lot since it permits them to meet all the household expenses. It is for this reason that Marta requests a loan through which she will be able to buy more products such as basic grains, oil, and more. Marta is a very responsible person who wants to improve the sales of her business since she, like most people, looks out for the well being of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains

loans.name: Lucrecio

texts.en:
Lucrecio A. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. He is 62 years old. Lucrecio is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucrecio owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lucrecio has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lucrecio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and give him the ability to engage in business activities. Lucrecio is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lucrecio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
