Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana Mirian B. L. de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San miguel, junto a su esposo y su nieto de 5 años de edad. Ella tiene una venta de antojitos típicos, los cuales son comidas típicas salvadoreñas, como yuca frita, tamales, ayote en miel, entre otros más. Cada día Ana Mirian coloca su venta frente a su casa con el deseo de poder obtener una buena ganancia, la cual le permita llevar el alimento a su hogar. Ella solícita un préstamo ya que desea vender otro tipo de productos como verduras y frutas, lo cual le permite percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Mirian B. L., 43, lives in San Miguel department with her husband and 5-year-old grandson. She sells typical Salvadoran snacks like fried yucca (manioc, cassava), tamales, candied ayote (squash), among others. Ana Mirian sets up her stall in front of her house every day hoping to earn good profits that will allow her to provide food for her household. She is asking for financing because she wants to start to sell other kinds of products, like fruits and vegetables, which will increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn P. lives in Ampil village in Kandal province. She is farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. She does not have enough money to buy rice seed and fertilizers to support the rice field, so she decided to request a loan for this purpose. She would use some of the money to hire laborers to dig a well. Her husband, Mr. Thorn Phal, is a fisherman and he also works on the rice field. Mrs. Sorn Ponv is 51 years old and the mother four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed & fertilizers, and to hire laborers to dig a well.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción S. M. de 28 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, vive junto a sus padres y su pequeña hija de dos años de edad. María posee un comedor en una de las zonas más concurridas del lugar en el que vive, en el comedor realiza desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales los comercializa a muy buenos precios. Debido a que no cuenta con una competencia directa, María tiene muchos clientes, los cuales la prefieren por ser una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo la cual prepara alimentos deliciosos. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos, ya que desea aumentar sus ventas de manera que todo esto pueda beneficiar a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
María Concepción S. M., 28, lives in the department of Usulután with her parents and two-year-old daughter. María has an eatery in one of the busiest areas of her neighborhood in which she serves breakfasts and lunches at affordable prices. Since she has no direct competition, María has many customers who prefer to patronize her establishment because she is very dedicated to her work and prepares delicious meals. She is asking for financing to buy ingredients needed in her meal preparations. She hopes to increase her sales to benefit her child.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Mae Antoneit

texts.en:
Mae Antoneit B. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 19 years old and married with one infant child. To make a living, Mae Antoneit sells processed food like longganiza (native sausages), hot dogs and dressed chicken in the local community. Mae Antoneit is just starting this business.

In 2009, Mae Antoneit joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yesenia Elizabeth C. D. O. D. 29 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Santa María en el departamento D. Usulután, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 7 y 4 años D. edad. Yesenia posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y primera necesidad, la cual desea poder surtirla, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos como leche, embutidos, pan y otros más. Yesenia es una mujer muy responsable la cual atienD. su negocio al mismo tiempo que realiza el trabajo del hogar y atienD. a sus hijos. Ella como muchas otras mujeres es un gran ejemplo D. dedicación y esfuerzo por brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yesenia Elizabeth C. D. O., 29, lives in the town of Santa María, which is in Usulután department, with her husband and two children, who are 7 and 4 years old, respectively. Yesenia has a small grocery store stocked with first necessity items and perishable goods. She needs financing to stock her store and to be able to buy more items like milk, cured meats, bread, etc. Yesenia is a very responsible woman who tends to her store while taking care of her children and her household chores. She, like so many other women, is a great example of dedication and effort to proviD. a better life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mrs. Pon H. is a villager in An Doung village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 0.8 hectare field of land on which she cultivates rice. She faces some problems because the soil on her field is infertile, and it is far from an irrigation system. So, she decided to request a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers, a water pump, and gasoline. Her husband, Mr. Phan Puoch, is a fisherman. Mrs. Pon H. is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizers, a water pump, and gasoline.

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en: Silvard M. lives in Sevan with her husband and two daughters. She and her family run their own business in a private shop. They sell food, and every month they make approximately $970 in income from their business. With the profit from this business Silvard’s family fills all of their needs. Silvard needs a loan of 600.000 AMD to buy a New Year’s assortment of candy and beverages. With her future income she intends to add household goods to her store.

loans.use: To buy candy and beverages for New Years

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A. is from the village of Iligan city. She is 32 years old and married with four grown children. To make a living, Arlene prepares and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Arlene is just starting this business.

In 2009, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao H. owns and operates a small handicraft business, turning rattan into sets of furniture. She is 40 years old and married to Kean Pleu, 40, a local rattan maker. The couple has been married for many years and is blessed with six children, all of whom are no longer in school. She makes at least 10 or 20 sets of rattan furniture before selling out and almost all of her clients come directly to her house to order. Sao H. would like a loan to buy more raw materials to make rattan furniture to sell.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make rattan furniture

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian M. is from the village of Punta in Dipolog City. She is 44 years old. Vivian is married and has 3 children. Her eldest child is an adult and the others two are students..  To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a general store where she sells food products in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Vivian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to buy more products to sell. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which to use as working capital for a fish-selling business. This will be Vivian's 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and educate her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To start a fish-selling business

loans.name: Aurelia D.

texts.en:
Aurelia D. P. is from the village of Silongon in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Aurelia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Aurelia owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Aurelia has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 2,600 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Aurelia D joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia D has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 14500 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Aurelia's 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Ol Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eleven people who are all living in Prek Reang village in Kandal province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Srey O. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan in different purposes. She is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. PH. KH., is a piglet middleman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Srey O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for selling to earn more income. She is 41 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are fishermen while the others two are attending the local schoO. and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for selling to earn more income.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 53 years old. She is married with 5 children. Her youngest child is 20 years old. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells blocks to make a living. She is requesting for a loan amount of 50,000 Nigeria Naira to purchase more blocks to sell. She is a LAPO client. The Lift above poverty organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more blocks to sell

loans.name: Ma. Mediatric

texts.en:
Ma. Mediatric is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao Camiguin Province. Ma. Mediatric is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. O. has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Mediatric joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. Ma. Mediatric is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by her from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Ly Vet Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of ten people and they all live in Prek Reang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Seng Ly V. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Suth Soeun, is a farmer who owns 1-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. He is also a fisherman. Now he needs a boat for his fishing. Thus, Mrs. Seng Ly V. decided to ask for a loan for her husband’s purpose. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. She is 30 years old and the mother of a child who is just 2 years old. Mrs. Seng Ly V.'s husband is presented in the picture.

loans.use: Needs a boat for his fishing.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of Silongon in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Evangeline is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Evangeline raises and sells pigs. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to buy piglets to raise & sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Evangeline's 12th loan from PMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from her business for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza N. is from the village of Bucana in Sicayab. She is 62 years old. Lorenza is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Lorenza sells "bibingka," a sweet pudding made from rice and fresh coconut milk, in the local community.  Lorenza has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 2,700 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Lorenza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorenza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Lorenza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase ingredients to make her treats. This loan will be Lorenza's 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Mrs. Khorn P. is a villager in Toek Nim village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Veth Voeun, is a motorbike taxi driver. Now Mrs. Khorn P. is requesting a loan to hire laborers to harvest rice and she would use the rest of money to add to her saving to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice. This couple has a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: Is requesting a loan to hire laborers to harvest rice and she would use the rest of money to add her saving to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miyormiyeh Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Miyormiyeh group. They are petty enterpreneurs in the small town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses.

Mabinty K. on the left in the photo is the leader of this group of four. Mabinty sells dried fish and has been in this business for five years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy two baskets full of dried fish. A dozen fish usually cost her SLL 2,500.

Mabinty K. was born in Magburaka, forty-eight years ago. She is married with four children. Her husband is a businessman and three of her children are attending primary and secondary schools.

loans.use: To buy two baskets full of dried fish

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine L. is 38 years old and lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area. She is married and has a school-aged daughter. Karine and her husband have their own business, which they run in their own carriage-shop, where they sell a variety of products: food, household goods and clothes. Karine also helps her husband with farm work. Thus, thanks to their shop and farm, they support their family. Karine asks 1,000,000 AMD to buy confectionery, cleaners and children's clothes for her shop.

loans.use: To buy confectionery, cleaners and children's clothes for her shop

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena P. is from the village of D'ban. She is 45 years old. Elena is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elena makes and sells snacks and other food items in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP to purchase materials to repair her house. This will be Elena's first loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy housing materials for house renovation

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta B. is from the village of Nangcaan in Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a 58-year-old widow with three adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a general store and she grows rice. The main source of her income comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. However, she also earns revenue from rice production, too. Julieta has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to finance her rice production. This will be Julieta's 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English

loans.use: For farm supplies, such as fertilizers

loans.name: Isadora

texts.en:
Isadora is from the village of Mabini in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old and single. To make a living, Isadora is a Natasha dealer. She sells Natasha-brand clothing,  shoes, perfumes and kiddie items, and other Natasha products in the local community. She also raises livestock. Isadora has been engaged in her businesses for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Isadora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Isadora is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase another cow for one of her projects. This will be Isadora's 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her clothing business and to buy another cow to raise

loans.name: Sdaeng's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sdaeng S. is the leader of a group of four people who all live in Roka village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 0.5 hectare field of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Thol Savy, is a fisherman. He wants to expand his fishing, so Mrs. Sdaeng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets. She is 34 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia T. is from the village of Casul in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  She is 46 years old and married, and she has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cornelia owns and operates a general store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Cornelia has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Cornelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Cornelia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Cornelia's 11th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn T. is from the village of Sapang Ama in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old and married, and has one child. To make a living, Jenalyn owns and operates a video entertainment business with four videoke units. She also owns a sari-sari (variety) store in the local community. Jenalyn has been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Jenalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. loans.name: Talumps Group

texts.en:
This group of business people are residents of Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group 'Talumps' and made Fatmata K., on the right in the photo, their leader. They have been in business for many years but their businesses have not been doing fine. They thus formed themselves into a group of four and applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva Lenders.

Fatmata was born in Magburaka town. She is thirty years old, married with three children. Fatmata’s husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools respectively.

Fatmata has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She sells ready-to-wear-clothes, shoes (sandals), towels, and napkins. Fatmata will use this loan to add stock to her business – she will buy clothes for children, shoes, and towels.

loans.use: To add stock to her business: clothes for children, shoes, and towels

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Mrs. Lina L. is 40 years of age and a resident of Pangi, Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a farmer and they have 4 children, all of whom are in school. This is her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and agricultural supplies. At first, she was only putting organic fertililzer on her vegetables. Now, she is hoping to use a fertilizer that is better than her organic one in order to produce a good harvest. Her future plan is to expand her vegetable farm with God's help and blessings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her vegetable farm

location.town: Pangi, Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Shahar

texts.ru: Шахар Джураева проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Сама Шахар более 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Она выращивает овощи, пшеницу, лук и т.д. Одну часть урожая она продает постоянным клиентам, а другую оставляет для  употребления семьи.
texts.en:
Shahar J. lives in the Shahrituz region. She's forty-nine years old, married and has five children. Her husband is away in Russia on employment. Shahar has been a farmer for more than ten years. She grows vegetables, wheat, onions, etc. One part of the the crop she sells to regular customers, and leaves the other part for her family.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl L. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 36 years old. Cheryl is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cheryl raises and sells pigs. Cheryl has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Cheryl joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cheryl has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Cheryl is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to build a shelter for her pigs. This will be Cheryl's 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and pay for her children's education. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build a shelter for her pigs

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Our featured entrepreneur is Marianita S., a barangay (village) health worker from Sumirap, Tangub City. She is 28 years old and is married to Mr. Jovie S.. The couple are blessed with 3 school-aged children.
 
Marianita has supplemented her family's income selling snacks and clothing to add to the family income since Jovie's income is not enough to support them. In addition to this, Marianita is now expanding to a motorcycle-taxi service business, to be manned by her husband. She is taking out a second loan of P7,050 to use as a down-payment for the motorcycle. Marianita plans to use the profits from the business to repay her loan and to further her business. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Down-payment on a motorcycle for commercial hire

loans.name: Mrs. Pengphalla Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank of fifteen people is located in Kouk Trab village in the Kandal province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Pengphalla S. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. HI. Sinan, are Chinese noodle sellers who own a small restaurant. They want to expand their business, and so Mrs. Pengphalla S. decided to ask for a loan. She is 36 years old and the mother of one child. Mrs. I. Thorn, who is a group guarantor for this village bank, is also represented in the picture.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Adentist Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Adventist group from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. This group of individuals are small-scale businesswomen who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to boost their businesses. They have been in business for many years now but business has been growing at a very slow pace.

The leader of this group of borrowers is Mariatu C. on the left in the photo. Mariatu C. was born in a village called Gbonko Lenken, in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-four years of age, married to a businessman, and they have two children – one in class I and the other in class VI.

Mariatu sells clothes – skirts, lace fabrics, and shoes. She also sells market food like rice and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil in the country). Mariatu has been a businesswoman for five years now. With her share of this loan, Mariatu will buy one bale of lace cloth.

loans.use: Buy one bale of lace cloth

loans.name: Anushavan

texts.en: Anushavan D. was born in 1956. He lives in Yerevan with his elderly mother. He graduated from Medical Technicians’ College in St. Petersburg, and then returned to his native land and started to work at the Armenian Medical Technicians’ central administrative board. Since 1998 Anushavan has run his own business.  He has a shop where he sells eyeglasses, frames, and lenses, and also checks his clients’ vision and helps them to choose appropriate eyeglasses or lenses. Anushavan needs a loan of 950,000 AMD to rent a second shop and thus to increase his business.

loans.use: to rent a second shop

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia B., 44, is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sonia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Sonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI, and is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Sonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mr. In S., 51, has his own small handicraft business which he learned from a grandparent. He is a local carpenter and his main activity is decorating wood furniture to sell. He also produces beds, windows, tables and chairs. Most of his clients order in advance and wait a few days or a week. In S. is married with eight children: four are married and live separately and the other four are single and go to school or work. 
Another source of income is from his wife’s trade. She sells fried bananas and potatoes. In S.'s wife is in the photo.
Recently, In S. has orders from his regular customers but, unfortunately, raw materials have been exhausted from his stock. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy more wood to build furniture to serve his customer’s needs.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Dorothy Wanjiru

texts.en:
For the last six years, Dorothy has run the Dot Waru Enterprise butcher shop and sells meat to residents at Mukuru Wa Njenga. She has three employees. Her business challenges are lack of water and funds to stock the business. Dorothy will be using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy an entire cow which is more economical than buying piece meat weighed in kilogrammes. In the future, she wants to runs another butchery and buy a car for the business.

Dorothy, age 49, is single and has four children ranging in age from 20 to 34 years old. She describes herself as hardworking, patient and humble.

loans.use: To buy an entire cow for slaughtering

loans.name: Kosim

texts.ru: Косим Данияров проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Косим более 28 лет работает по своей профессии "учителем". Помимо он более 4 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Клиент в основном выращивает фрукты, сухофрукты и т.д. Кредит просит для того чтобы посеить новый урожай, т.е. закупить семена и мин. удобрения.
texts.en:
Kosim D. lives in the Shahrituz region. He's forty years old, married and has five children. For more than twenty-eight years he has worked as a teacher. Additionally, he has occupied himself as a farmer for the last four years. In general, he grows fruits, dried fruits, etc. He is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer with which he could plant a new crop.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Remember Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Remember' group in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesswomen who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from Kiva lenders through SMT. With such a loan, they can improve their businesses by adding more goods. Consequently, they can earn enough profit to repay the loan and better support themselves and their families.

Fatmata S. who is on the left in the photo is the leader of this group of enterpreneurs. Fatmata who was born in Songo, near Freetown is twenty-six years of age, married to a driver and they have two children – one in class II. and the other is not yet of school-going age.

For six years now, Fatmata has been selling palm-oil, the country’s main cooking oil. With her share of the loan, she will buy gallons of palm-oil from makeshift-business-center and sell it in Makeni or Freetown. Five gallons of palm-oil at the Luma center costs her something between SLL 45,000 and SLL 60,000.

loans.use: buying gallons of palm-oil

loans.name: Afi

texts.en: Madame K. is married, but has no children. In order to help her husband with their daily expenses, she began selling fabric in 2007. This year, she requested her first loan from WAGES in the hopes of benefiting from the holiday season and maximizing her returns. With this money she hopes to increase her profits by buying 20 PHOENIX brand and 35 HI-TARGET brand lengths of cloth.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric to sell

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita P. is from the village of Tuburan. She is 52 years old. Violita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Violita grows and sells a variety of vegetables and spices. Violita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP average per month from these activities.

In 2006, Violita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to repair her house. Violita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and as additional capital for a snack business that she runs in addition to her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and improve her snack business

loans.name: Mrs. Mach Roen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of seventeen people who live in Kouk Trab Village in Kandal Province. 

Mrs. Mach R. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she grows rice. In addition to her farm, she also sells things. Although she tries to work hard, she still earns less income to than she needs to support her family. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Mach R. decided to ask for a loan to buy a sewing machine to earn more money. She is 37 years old and single with a child who attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Loem Hong

texts.en:
Mrs. Loem Hong N. lives in Prey Prum village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder and a farmer who owns 4-hectare (~10-acre) field of land on which she grows rice. Her husband, Mr. Pov Yorn, owns a rice milling machine. This couple has two children who are grocers and help the parents work to earn income. 

Mrs. Loem Hong N. has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer, pig food, and to repair the rice milling machine. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living with this loan. Her husband appears with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pig food, and to repair her rice milling machine

loans.name: In

texts.en:
In V., 38, a longtime businesswoman, lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She has been a rattan maker for years – a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband assists her in making rattan and also has time to buy rattan from other makers to resell. The couple has four kids: one is no longer in school and currently works in a garment factory, while the other three are students.

Currently, In V. is very busy with her business operations as there are many clients who need her products. To satisfy her customer’s need, In V. requests a loan to purchase more rattans.

loans.use: To purchase more rattans

loans.name: Machid

texts.ru: Очилдиев Мачид проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 52 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Мачид более 9 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает овощи. У него имеются постоянные клиенты, оптовики, которые покупают у него часть урожая. Остальную часть он оставляет для употребления семьи. Ему в этом помогает его семья. Кредит просит для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Machid O. lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 52 years old. He is married and has five children. Machid has been doing agriculture for more than nine years. He mainly grows vegetables. He has regular customers, wholesellers, who buy part of his crops. He keeps the remaining part for use for his family. In this business his family is helping him. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for sowing of new crops.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tukwatirewamu Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Zaituni N. is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is an older woman with a restaurant business that she has owned for over 15 years. She is happy that she has reaped big rewards from her transactions. Her restaurant is located in Jinja Town and, because she has experience in preparing local food, she has attracted many customers who spread the word about her cooking. She has been able to pay school fees for her children and, during the holiday seasons, she works closely with her children and her staff at the restaurant. She also sells soft drinks as an accompaniment. 

Zaituni needs a loan to help buy more food for her restaurant. She buys in bulk whenever she needs food.

loans.use: To buy more food for her restauarnt

loans.name: Srean

texts.en: Mr. Srean S. lives in Prey Prum Village in Takeo Province. He sells pig food. Because his business is going well, he wants to expand it so he can better serve his customers. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more pig food to sell. His wife, Mrs. Yoen Kunthea, sells groceries, such as vegetables and pork. Mr. Srean S. is 29 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife appears on his right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pig food to sell

loans.name: Masiade Group

texts.en:
These are a group of small-scale entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They formed themselves into a group they named 'Masiade' in order to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders through SMT. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, sales and level of income will improve so that they can better support themselves and their children.

On the left in the photo is Sally M., the leader of this group of five. Sally was born in Freetown forty years ago. She is married to a policeman and they now live in Magburaka town together with their four children. Their children are attending secondary and primary schools respectively.

Sally sells cooked rice as her main business and cigarettes, kerosene, mints, chewing gum, biscuits, matches and so on in a little kiosk, called here "Cigarette Box". Sally has been a businesswoman for four years now. With her share of this loan, she will invest in her cooked rice business by buying cooking materials like rice, palm-oil, onions, and fish in large quantity to reserve for daily use. And she will also use part of the loan to invest in her small 'Cigarette Box' business.

loans.use: Buy cooking materials like rice, palm-oil, onions, fish in large quantity and invest in her small "Cigarette Box" business

loans.name: Sreu

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreu M. is a villager in Ank Sangke village in Takeo province. She is 52 years old and a mother of three children: one is a goldsmith; two stay at home to help their parents with work. Mrs. M. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She also owns a small restaurant where she sells soup, coffee, and others drinks. 

Her husband, Mr. Chan Ngorn, is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice, but he faces an obstacle because his field has infertile soil. Mrs. Sreu M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, piglets, pig food. She would like to use the rest of loan to hire laborers to work on the field.  Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, piglets, pig food, and hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Seang Ly's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Seang Ly C. is the loan group leader with four members who live in Thnal Bat village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice. At her plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil and is far from an irrigation system. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, gasoline, and hire laborers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Keo Khlei, owns a horse cart to help him transport goods and passengers. This couple has three children: one works; another attends the local school; and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, gasoline, and hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 25-year-old married man who has one child currently in school. He trades cassava dough for a living. Cassava dough is milled cassava mixed with water and is used to prepare local meals like banku. 

Solomon is requesting a loan to buy more bags of cassava to increase his production of cassava dough. He is expecting higher profits during this season as he looks forward to selling more to people who want to enjoy local meals like banku and kenkey. He believes your support will enable him to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase cassava in bulk

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
Safie C. on the right in the photo is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan in order to boost their businesses.

Thirty-nine years old, Safie sells peppers, palm-oil, and used shoes. She has been in this business since 1990. Business has not being developing in the way she wants it to due to the small capital at hand. She and her colleagues have thus formed themselves into a group of five to seek a loan. With this loan, she will invest in her business by buying two bags of peppers and ten gallons of palm-oil.

loans.use: Buy two bags of peppers and ten gallons of palm-oil

loans.name: Khumor

texts.ru: Хумор Джаборова проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает на стройке. Сын на данный момент находится в России на заработках. Сама клиентка занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном торгует детской одеждой. Эти видом бизнесом занимается более 2 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Khumor Djabarova lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 47 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in construction. Her son is working in Russia at this time. She sells on the market. She mainly sells children's clothing. Khumor has been doing this business for more than two years. She is asking for a loan to increase circulation of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase circulation

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a focused hardworking woman. She puts in long hours trying to sustain her business. She is 52 years old and married with six children. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. Roseline sells kitchen utensils at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are mostly neighbors, residents and friends. She has been in her business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell.

Roseline is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Roseline says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha T. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow vegetables. She is also a chicken breeder. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens. Her husband, Mr. Loem Bun Nak, is a teacher in the local school. Mrs. Chantha T. is 39 years old and the mother of four children: one is employed in a garment factory, while another is a driver and the others are attending the local school. 
Mrs. Chantha T. is the leader of a group with five members who all live in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. 0004

loans.use: To purchase more chickens

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is a 30-year-old lady. She is married with two kids in school. She trades in grocery products like rice, fresh tomatoes, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products, skim milk, body pomade, etc. in her community. Her experience has made her one of the most successful traders in her neighborhood. She considers this loan a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable and palm oil to increase her stock of goods available for sale. She believes your support will enable her to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Pikédinabè

texts.en:
Madame T. opened her own boutique called “Ets Rose de Matin” in 2004. She sells food products and her client base continues to grow every day. In order to keep her customers satisfied, she has applied for a loan with WAGES, a Kiva partner, to purchase 14 boxes of soap, eight cases of wine, 10 bags of rice and three boxes of couscous. 

She is married, but has no children. With the profits made from her general store, she will continue to contribute to her family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: Various food supplies

loans.name: Orowole

texts.en:
Orowole is 38 years old and married with five children. She is a focused, hardworking woman. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization, a Kiva partner, is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. 

Orowole sells mattresses in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more mattresses to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more mattresses to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Sayyi Group

texts.en:
William B. on the right in the photo is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They call their group Sayyi group. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs can expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, sales and profit-to-sales margin will also improve and thus they will be in a better position to look after themselves and their children.

Fifty-year-old William was born in Mabontho village in northern Sierra Leone. He is married with eleven children, ten of whom are still attending school. His wife is also a businesswoman.

William has been selling palm-oil (the favorite cooking oil in the country) for over seven years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy fifty gallons of palm-oil and would also like to try a new business, i.e. selling firewood. He would therefore use SLL 200,000 of the loan to buy firewood to sell.

loans.use: Buy fifty gallons of palm oil and SLL 200,000 worth of firewood

loans.name: Amine

texts.en:
Amine is a 31-year-old engaged man living in Hasbayya, Southern Lebanon. Amine is a school bus driver. He owns the bus and uses it in summer for touristic trips. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to continue building his house and for his wedding costs. 

Amine’s clients are his neighbors and friends’ children in addition to the tourists. His good public relations make him famous in the area. Amine experienced two years of micro-credit and he believes it’s worth it. He hopes to be the owner of a group of school buses, in addition to specialized touristic ones.

loans.use: To continue building his house and for his wedding costs

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati, a 30-year-old businesswoman, is married with a child who is currently in school. Fati trades in clothes and scarves. She has been in business for the past 10 years. She buys her stock at wholesale prices and sells to her customers on a retail basis.

Fati wants to use the loan to include the sale of shoes to make extra income. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothes and scarves

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is a 51-year-old married man living in Bourj A. Moulouk, Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and four children. Elie owns a shop where he has sold agriculturA. fertilizers and medicine since 2004. 

Elie requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy speciA. agriculturA. equipment important in his business. Elie has two years of micro-credit experience and he believes it was a successful experience. Elie had some financiA. problems at the beginning of his project, but he overcame them through micro-credits. 

Elie’s customers are farmers and neighbors from all over the area. He hopes to expand in the future through selling large agriculturA. equipment.

loans.use: To buy agricultural equipment

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells sarongs and lace in the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is a focused, hardworking woman. She has been in this business for a long time. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits. 

Esther is 48 years old and married with five children. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. 

Esther is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more sarongs and lace to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and lace to sell

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 58-year-old married man living in Jdeidet Marj Oyoun, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and three kids. Youssef has owned a flower seeding farm and an egg-hatching machine since 2004. Youssef requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to start a new chicken business and support his farm. His customers are his friends, neighbors, relatives, tourists and neighboring dealers. Youssef hopes to expand more in the future by supporting his flower farm.

loans.use: To start a new chicken business and support his farm

loans.name: Seriousness Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Seriousness' group from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty traders who have formed themselves into a group in order to apply for a group loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of a loan, their businesses will grow at a much faster rate.

Mabinty O. S. on the left in the photo is this group’s leader. Mabinty was born in Magburaka town thirty-one years ago. She is married to a teacher and they have two children – one in form I and the other in class V.

Mabinty sells oranges, cassava, rice, palm-oil, peppers and so on. She has been doing business since 1991. Mabinty will use this loan to buy oranges and cassava wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy oranges and cassava wholesale

loans.name: Chamel

texts.en: ChamE. is a 28-year-old single man living in Al Mary, Southern Lebanon. ChamE. works with things necessary for interior design decorations such as fake ceilings and wooden floors. He has been doing this since 2004. ChamE. requested a loan from Al Majmoua to buy necessary equipment for his business and to invest in some agricultural land. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and relatives. He believes his special way of working is his strong point. In the future, ChamE. plans to own a decorating company that can compete with the available ones.

loans.use: To purchase necessary equipment for his business

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en: Fidelia B. is 37 years old, and married with 3 children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Fidelia  is a focused, hard working woman. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Fidelia is not a hair stylist but she sells hair extensions in the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan amount to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Assana

texts.en: Madame A. lives in the Agoé region with her husband and her 2 children. In 2001, she began selling charcoal. To maximize the profit from her sales, she purchases her supply from the city of Paguala in the center of Togo. This strategy gives her a competitive edge in her market. Currently facing a lack of stock, she has applied for a loan with WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase 30 large bags and 20 medium-sized bags of charcoal and will cover the cost of her travels.

loans.use: buying charcoal and paying for transport

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 35-year-old married man living in Majdel Silim, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and two children. Abbass works at raising bees and he has been a builder since 1994, with eighteen years of experience. Abbass requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy extra bee hives to support and increase his income from this business. His region members are his customers, and he believes that his long experience in this kind of work makes his quality very special. He is planning on expanding his work in the future the way he is doing now.

loans.use: To buy extra bee hives

loans.name: Mr. Sareth Meng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-two people who all live in Kampong Svay village in Kandal province make up the village bank loan group. They will all use the loan for different purposes. Mr. S. M. was selected by the members of the group to be the village bank president. He is a farmer who cultivates rice. Aside from his plantation, he is also a fisherman. He is requesting this loan to buy more fish nets for fishing. His wife, Mrs. Chheng Seap Ly, is a housewife. Mr. S. M. is 44 years old and the father of five children. Two of his children are laborers, two of T. are attending the local school, and the youngest child is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fish nets for fishing.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old married man, living with his wife in Chakra, Southern Lebanon. Ali has been working in furniture and house decorations since 1994, with seventeen years of experience. Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy iron pillars, which are necessary to his work. Ali’s customers are the people who live in his region; he hopes to expand to the neighboring villages in the future.

loans.use: To buy iron pillars

loans.name: Ochuko

texts.en: Ochuko E. is 31 years old, married with 2 children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Ochuko works long hours selling soft drinks at retail prices to her customers to make a living  She has been in this business for a long time.She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Ochuko hopes for loan to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Fandi

texts.en: Fandi is a 54-year-old married man living in Hasbayya, Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and two children. Fandi has owned a rest house which is in one of the multiple touristic places in the region for five years. Fandi requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to build extra rooms with aluminum windows for the winter season which will attract tourists and Unifil members to his place rather than others. Fandi hopes to have a famous restaurant in the future, depending on the winter customers if he makes his planned changes.

loans.use: To build extra rooms with aluminum windows for the winter season

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en: Walaa is a 24 year-old married woman living in the region of Bint Jbeil with her husband.  Since 2007, Walaa has had a women's dress and coat shop.  Walaa is requesting a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua in order to buy merchandise for the Holy season. This is her first micro credit experience and she is hopeful. Walaa is still continuing her university studies and she’s proud that from her business she was able to buy a computer that helps her study. Her customers are her relatives, university friends and associates, and tourists. In the future, Walaa is planning to expand her business by adding men's and children's clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Owolabi

texts.en: Owolabi O. is 53 years old, married and has four children who are in a higher institution of learning. Owolabi goes to company once a week to buy drinks in bulk as they are cheaper there. She comes back and sells the drinks  retail and wholesale. Owolabi has been in this trade for a long time as she never had a formal education. Due to family demands she find it difficult to put reinvest her profit into the business in order to expand it. She is requesting for a loan of NGs 50,000 to enable her to expand her business to meet the needs of her customers. With an increase in profits, Olowabi  will be able to provide better for her children's education. Thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks for sell

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is a 19-year-old single man living in Ain Knayya, Southern Lebanon. He has been an auto-electrician since 2008 and has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy necessary equipment and car batteries. This is Maher’s second year of experience with microcredit, which he believes is the primary supporter of his work. Tourists, friends, neighbors and relatives are his clients. He hopes to expand his work and to start a small family soon.

loans.use: To buy equipment and car batteries.

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib is a 33-year-old married man living in Hasbayya, BInt Jbeil, Southern Lebanon with his wife and two children. He has been a car painter since 1998 and has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and to continue building his house. This is his first experience with microcredit. Najib hopes he can make his house comply with international health standards to keep his children and family members safe. He hopes to reach a time when he can rest and just take good care of his small family.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a widow. She lives in Kherson and owns a small clothing shop in the central city marketplace. Dina is a very disciplined entrepreneur and she has been running this venture for 18 years. Currently, she has 30,000 Grivnyas invested in her shop and her gross income is about 10,000 Grivnyas.

Dina is seeking a loan of 13,740 Grivnyas to purchase assorted clothing in order to offer a wider variety of inventory for retail sale in her kiosk. Her ultimate goal is to better meet the needs of customers of different age groups who come to shop from her.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 41-year-old married man living in Safad Al Batikh, Southern Lebanon with his wife. He is a peddler who has sold food and sweets since 2006. His clients can be anyone who he can reach during his journey. Mohammad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and to increase his capital which will help in adding new brands. He hopes to reach a level where he can have one storage place, so he can start wholesale trading.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Modinot

texts.en: Modinot D. is 34 years old, married with two children. She  is a tailor and also sells clothing material and sarongs that can be used to make various styles of one’s choice. Modinot goes to Lagos Island to buy goods( clothing materials) as soon as her stock goes down. The lady in picture is her apprentice as she was at the market purchasing tailoring materials when the photograph was taken. Modinot has finished repaying her previous loan which was used to rent her shop. The balance of that loan was used to purchase a weaving machine. Modinot has been in this business for the past ten years. She requests for a loan of N100,000 to purchase clothing materials in bulk at a reduced cost and also to reduce the need for being on the road often. Modinot says when the children are on holiday from school they assist her a lot in the business because they know the solution to their needs comes from the success of the business. She says thank-you to all.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials and sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 39 year old divorced woman living in Hasbaya with her husband and their child. Mariam has owned a grocery store since 1998. She sells canned food, candies, beverages and juices, rice, cigarettes and lots more. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy merchandise for the store. This is her second cycle and she paid her previous loan on time which helped her increase her stock. Her customers are her relatives, friends and tourists. Mariam is planning to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is thirty years old and a mother of one child who is currently in school. She has been selling grocery products for seven years in the market to support her family. She says business is doing well and she therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her child.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing A. sells sarongs in the market in Warri, Delta State. Nigeria. She is a focused, hard working woman who puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable.  Blessing is 32 years old and married with a child. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Blessing has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting  a loan of 80,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 49 year old married woman living in Hasbaya with her husband and their six children. Nadia has been working in agriculture since 1992. She owns livestock and produces dairy products and cheese. She also plants wheat, lentils, olives, chick peas, and peaches. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a cow to increase her livestock and her productivity. This is her second cycle and she paid her previous loan on time which helped her increase her stock. Nadia is special in her work because she is an active woman who has a clean workplace, and she suits her clients' needs. Her customers are traders in her region. Nadia is planning to expand her business by purchasing another plot of land so that she can plant more.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is single. He has a transportation business in his home town of Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Igor offers transportation services all over the territory of Ukraine. He’s known as a very careful and experienced driver which is why he always has many clients. Igor started this business 8 years ago. Presently, his monthly income amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas. 

Igor is requesting an 11,000 Grivnya loan to do some maintenance work on his car and purchase a turbine. This business is the main source of income for Igor. He works really hard to make some savings and hopefully buy an apartment of his own some day. Igor has repaid all previous loans without any problems.

loans.use: To buy a turbine and do some repair work on his car.

loans.name: Daher

texts.en: Daher is a fifty-two years old married man living in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Daher has sold sanitary and construction products since 2000. His clients can be anyone from his region. Daher requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his capital, by purchasing new products. This is the first time that Daher has requested a loan. He hopes to reach a level where he can have his own storage place, so he can start wholesale trading.

loans.use: To purchase new products.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a twenty-seven-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ali has been selling plowing machines since 1996; he requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. His friends, neighbors and relatives are his clients. Ali hopes to expand his work.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a married with 3 children who are still in school. She is a 42-year-old business woman. She started trading fifteen years ago and she enjoys selling goods. She trades in clothing materials. Susana believes in hard work and dedication. She has gained lots of marketing experience, making her one of the successful traders in the local market she sells. Her would provide her with more capital to purchase more stock of clothing materials to serve her customers this Christmas festivities.

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a businessman from Novaya Kahovka. He owns a small business selling office appliances, related components and expendable materials in one of the local malls called “Central”. He launched this business about 12 years ago. Currently, his business has grown up to 15,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His monthly net profit is little over 4,000 Grivnyas.

Andrei is seeking a loan of 7,400 Grivnyas to expand his business. His venture has seen considerable growth since he received his first loan. Andrei is hoping to witness further consistent growth of his trade after using this loan. A portion of profits generated will be invested in his business while some of it will be used to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is an entrepreneur who lives in Novaya Kahovka. She sells clothing in a small store and in some other local markets. She has been in this business for five years and is a serious and skilled business owner. Her perseverance, combined with the lending assistance she has received, have allowed her to gradually expand her business. Presently, Svetlana’s working capital has grown to 30,000 Grivnyas and her net profit amount to 6,000 Grivnyas a month. 

There are many vendors and competition in clothing sales is high. However, Svetlana’s pleasant manner and willingness to meet clients’ needs have helped her keep loyal clientele. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to buy an assortment of clothing in bulk to sell in her store. Her sense of responsibility, stable business growth and prompt payment record convince us that she is highly capable of repaying this loan.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 24 years old, single and supports herself by selling doughnuts to people who live in her community. She sells to school kids and also at bus terminals. She says selling doughnuts is very lucrative because many people enjoy them with drinks or porridge, especially in the morning, and she therefore wants to expand her production to make a better income and help support her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make donuts

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is married and has two children. He lives in the town of Vodyanoye, where he owns two well-equipped greenhouses in which he grows vegetables for sale. He’s been in this business for six years. He currently has 30,000 Grivnyas in working capital, and plans to spend about 15,000-20,000 of them to buy seeds and clear polyethylene film.  

Viktor is requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to build one more greenhouse and increase the amount of vegetables he is able to grow. Viktor’s son is actively helping him with this business, and the two work very hard to keep the business running. Viktor wants to make sure it’s a well-established and self-sustaining business before his sons inherit it from him.  

Note: In the photo, we see Viktor with his son.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Shogofa Zahra Group

texts.en:
This is the Shogofa Zahra Group. This group has four members: Shogofa, Zahra, Soraya and Laila all live in Kabul, Afghanistan. Shogofa is the group leader. She wants a loan for her brother; he has a retail shop and wants to buy more food for his shop.

The second member of the Shogofa Zahra Group is Zahra; she wants a loan to buy clothes for her tailoring business.

The third member of the Shogofa Zahra Group is Soraya; she wants a loan for her embroidery business.

The fourth member of Shogofa Zahra Group is Laila; she is teaching an English language course and she wants to buy some necessary materials for her class.

They have requested a group loan of 40000 AFN to expand their businesses. They would like to say lots of thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food for a shop.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 30 years old, married and has two children. She is very resourceful and works hard so that she and her husband can pay for their children’s education and provide them with good opportunities in the future. She is a food vendor who sells cooked rice with stew, and has applied for a loan to buy bags of rice and more of the raw materials she needs to increase her production. She believes that with your support, she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Las mencionadas mujeres son de la compañía Yaka roysa de la cuidad de Caacupé distante unos 7km de la oficina regional caacupé.

Debido a la distancia misma del casco urbano estas mujeres están lejos de obtener beneficios básicos, herramientas útiles, para el crecimiento social económico que una persona naturalmente requiere para sostenerse.

En este marco de ideas la Fundación decide apoyar los ideales de progreso, mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta gente que son desfavorecidas en lo que concierne a oportunidades de trabajo, la falta de preparación para auto emplearse, y la discriminación geográfica por ser personas que conviven en una compañía.

Hoy en día  estas 16 mujeres ya están operando  en el séptimo  ciclo del programa Comité de mujeres emprendedoras recibiendo todos los beneficios que implica el mismo, y cumpliendo estrictamente los requerimientos para que mantengan su credibilidad con la institución.
texts.en:
The women listed are members of the Yaka Roysa compañía (rural areas on the outskirts of Paraguayan cities) in the city of Caacupé, which is 7km away from the Caacupé regional office.
