Precisely because of this distance from the urban center, these women are far from receiving basic benefits, which are the useful tools a person needs to be able to support herself socially and economically. Given these realities, the Foundation in its efforts to support the ideals of progress, aims to improve the living conditions of these people, who are at such a disadvantage with respect to employment opportunities, who lack the skills to be self-employed, and who suffer geographic discrimination because they live in compañías. As of now, these 16 women are in their 7th cycle with the Mujeres Emprendedoras Committee, receiving all the benefits implicit in it and strictly meeting all the requirements needed to maintain their credibility with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale, to make and sell charcoal, to buy flour, eggs, cheese,salt, anise for chipa (a pastry), milk, sugar, sweet potatoes, guava, mate leaves (for tea), juices, rice, pasta, meat and cured meats.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 25 years old, single and makes a living selling cooked rice, yam and fufu. Fufu is prepared from cassava and plantain, which are pounded together, cooked, and then eaten with different kinds of soup. It is a very popular traditional food among the Ashanti tribe of Ghana, and can be breakfast, lunch or supper. Ruth has applied for a loan to buy more raw materials, such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise her income and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Efe

texts.en: Efe makes a living selling used handbags in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She is married, has four children and is 38 years old. She is a highly-focused, hard-working woman who puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is a LAPO client because of our commitment to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Efe has been in her line of work for a long time and is requesting for a loan to buy more used handbags to sell. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy used handbags to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fulgencio

texts.es:
Fulgencio R. Ibarra, es casado, domiciliado en la compañia Candia de Atyra, tiene casa propia.
El se inicio con la producción y venta de chipa, acrecentando sus ingresos, dio marcha a la apertura de una despensa en su domicilio, iniciándose primeramente con productos de su huerta como también la venta de leche de sus animales.
En vista a la buena producción de leche de sus animales, como también la venta de chipa,  fue de apoco incursionando en otros productos de almacén. Fue entonces que adquirió un crédito de Fundación Paraguaya para lograr su objetivo.
Es así que Fulgencio Rolón Ibarra cuenta hoy en día con una almacén bastante surtida en la zona y agradece profundamente a Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo constante que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Fulgencio R. Ibarra is married, lives in the company of Candia de Atyra, and has his own house. He began his business with the production and sale of chipa (bread made with manioc or corn flour, typical of Paraguay), increasing his income and leading to opening a store in his house. He started at first selling products from his garden and milk from his animals. In view of the good milk production from his animals as well as the sale of chipa bread, he continued little by little moving into other products for his store. It was then that he acquired a loan from Fundación Paraguay to achieve his goal. In this way Fulgencio Rolón Ibarra today has a well supplied local store. He deeply thanks Fundación Paraguay for the consistent assistance they have provided to him.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquisition of general merhandise for festivals at the end of the year like cider, soft drinks, fruits, vegetables, lights, meats, general ingredients, etc.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia makes a living selling traditional beads at retail prices to her customers. These beads are used at marriages and burial and naming ceremonies. Nigerians love traditional beads because they are an important part of their cultural heritage. Patricia is married, has three children and is 45 years old. She has been in her line of work for a long time and has applied for a loan for 100,000 NGN to buy more traditional beads to sell. She is a focused, hard-working woman who puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is a LAPO client because of our commitment to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Patricia extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more traditional beads to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en: Bernice is thirty years old. She is a widow with a child who is currently in school. Bernice is hard-working and this business is her main source of income. She sells ladies' shoes, slippers etc. through “hawking.’ Hawking is a means of selling where sellers carry the items on their head and move from house to house. She wants to use the loan to buy more ladies' shoes, slippers etc. to increase her stock to make more income and provide her child with a good education. She is expecting higher profit this season since most people buy new shoes for themselves and their families during Christmas.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and slippers in bulk

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is married, has five children and is 48 years old. She is a focused, hard-working woman who puts in long hours trying to keep her business profitable. She is a LAPO client because of our commitment to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Regina makes a living selling sarongs at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time, and has applied for a loan for 80,000 NGN to buy more sarongs to sell. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is thirty-four years old. She is married with three children. She is a responsible mother and has her children’s needs and welfare at heart. Currently all her three children are in school. She is a petty trader who sells used clothes. Used clothing sellers are patronized by many people for their daily wear and because of that, Regina has many customers. However, with small capital, she can barely sell enough to make profit. She wants the loan therefore to buy more bales of used clothes that come with a variety of styles to meet the desire of her customer and produce increased income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase assorted used clothes

loans.name: Hery

texts.es:
El Sr Hery es casado sin hijo, domiciliado en la ciudad de Piribebuy compañía San Antonio, a la altura del Km 61/2 de la ruta N: 2. 
Don Hery de joven trabajaba como empleado en una chipería, donde aprendió el oficio, cuando se casó emprendió su propia fábrica,  cada día elabora su rica chipa y lo lleva a ofertar en la capital, en el barrio Trinidad donde ya posee su clientela formada.
Solicita el apoyo crediticio de la fundación y kiva para invertir en la compra de materia prima como, almidón, grasa, queso, entre otros, y aumentar la producción lo que generara más ingresos para su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Hery is married and has no children. He lives in the city of Piribebuy, San Antonio compañía (rural areas surrounding Paraguayan cities) at the 6.5Km marker along Route #2. When he was young he was employed by a chipería, a place where they make chipas (warm bagel-like bread with a cheesy center) where he picked up the skills. When he got married he started his own factory. Every day he makes delicious chipa and takes it to the city to sell in the Trinidad neighborhood where he already has his regular clientele established. He needs funding from the Foundation and from Kiva in order to buy raw materials like flour, oil, cheese, among others, so that production, as well as profits for household expenses will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy starch and cheese to make chipa (pastry)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a focused, hard-working woman who puts in long hours trying to keep her business profitable. She is a LAPO client because of our commitment to improve lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is married, has five children and is 47 years old. Esther makes a living selling groceries, foodstuffs and drinks in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has applied for a loan for NGN 100,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El Señor Ignacio es soltero pero tiene un hijo que vive con la abuela materna a quien ayuda constantemente de acuerdo alos ingresos que el mismo alcanza, el tiene su domicilio en la ciudad de Piribebuy en la Compañía Capilla Cué.                                                                                              Ignacio es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en las ciudades del Departamento de Paraguari, posee aproximadamente  800 clientes a quienes les deja sus mercaderías recibiendo a cambio una entrega mínima, el saldo les cobra en forma semanal o a dependiendo de la venta que los mismos realicen al día.
 Empezó en la actividad hace un poco mas de 3 años con un pequeño capital que tenia ahorrado de los trabajos que realizaba como jornalero. Gracias a la buena administración de su negocio, el buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes y a la calidad de sus productos hoy día tiene un negocio firme en cual puede apoyarse económicamente, que con el cual cubre todos sus gastos personales y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ignacio is single, and has one son who lives with his maternal grandmother whom he helps constantly as part of this living agreement. He resides in Piribebuy in the Capilla Cué Company. Ignancio is a businessman, who sells articles of clothing in cities in the Paraguari State. He has approximately 800 clients he serves, and from whom he receives in return a minimum order. His salary is paid weekly, or depending on the sales he achieves on a given day. He began selling clothes slightly more than three years ago with his savings from working as a day laborer. Thanks to his smooth-running business, the good deals he offers his clients, and the quality of the products he sells, he currently has a solid business that enables him to support himself economically and cover all his personal expenses and those of his son.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase capri pants, mens' and womens' jeans

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 34-year-old petty trader. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She sells used clothing and has been doing this business for the past five years to support her family. With low capital, she is not able to buy larger bales of used clothes to sell. She would like to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes with variety to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bales

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Señor Julio es casado con 2 hijas estudiantes, domiciliado en la ciudad de Piribebuy en el barrio San Blas.
El Sr. Julio aprendió el oficio trabajando como ayudante en un taller de su barrio, luego con la ayuda de su padre se independizo y emprendió su propio taller en un terreno que le facilito su padre, empezó con las mínimas herramientas, gracias al esfuerzo y la ayuda de su padre fue incorporando mas herramientas.   

El Sr. Julio posee hoy una gomería con todas las herramientas necesarias para el rubro, gracias a los buenos servicios que ofrece, tiene una clientela totalmente formada con alta fidelidad.
El crédito que solicita es para compra de cubiertas para su posterior venta al público, con ello generaría más ingresos en la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Julio is married with two daughters and lives in the San Blas neighborhood in the city of Piribebuy. Julio learned his skills (as a mechanic) by working in a neighborhood garage and later, with the help of his father, he started his own garage on land that his father provided. He started out with a few tools, but with his father’s assistance, he has been able to add more tools to his business. Julio now owns a tire shop with all the necessary tools. He has an established set of customers, thanks to the good services he provides. He is asking for this loan in order to buy tires to resell, so that he can increase his family income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for resale

loans.name: Tamensu Development Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Tamensu Development' group from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty traders who have formed themselves into a group in order to apply for a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, their living conditions will improve so that they can better support themselves and their school-going children.

Ramatu C. on the right in the photo is the leader of this group. Ramatu was born in Kafe, near Magburaka about forty-five years ago. She is married to a motor-bike driver and they have three children who are attending secondary and primary schools respectively.

Ramatu sells firewood and has been in this business for nearly ten years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy a truck full of firewood and pay transportation costs to carry the wood to her house.

loans.use: Buy a truck full of firewood and pay transportation costs

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is thirty-eight years old and a mother of four children. The children are currently in school. Selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore selling of used clothing has created a market for many women like Augustina. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future and also to rent a store to sell out of.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bales

loans.name: Mayema Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Mayema' group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each for the very first time to enable them to improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and in quality. In this way, they can make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve – they will be able to better support their school-going children in terms of feeding and clothing them and meeting school expenses.

Alie K. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. Alie was born in a place called Makuri, in northern Sierra Leone. He is approximately fifty-two years of age, married to three wives and with twelve children. Alie is a carpenter; he has been in this profession for three years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy boards, polish, nails, locks, and other working material.

loans.use: Buy boards, polish, nails, locks, and other working materials

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es:
La Sra. Miguela es viuda con hijos mayores, domiciliado en la ciudad de Caacupé, compañía Cerro Real al altura del Km 59 de la ruta N: 2.
 Doña Miguela aprendió el oficio de su madre, con quién trabajaba desde muy chiquita en la fabricación y ventas de chipas, cuando se casó emprendió su pequeña fábrica donde elabora su deliciosa chipa y lo lleva a ofertar en la capital, en frente del hospital central de I P S, desde entonces fue ganando clientela hasta hoy día, solicita el apoyo de la fundación y kiva de un crédito, para invertir en la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de su producto como almidón, queso grasa entre otros, teniendo en cantidades importantes esto lo facilita la producción, y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientela y asi obtener más ingresos a su unidad familiar
texts.en:
Miguela is a widow with two adult children. She lives in the city of Caacupé, Cerro Real compañía (rural settlements around Paraguayan cities) at the 59Km marker along Route #2. Miguela learned her skills from her mother with whom she worked making chipas (warm bagel-like bread with a cheesy center) since she was a little girl. When she got married, she started her own factory where she makes her delicious chipas that she then takes into the capital to sell in front of the IPS hospital. Since then, she has been acquiring a regular clientele. She needs financing from the Fundación and from Kiva in order to buy the ingredients, like flour, grease, etc., she needs to make the chipas (having ingredients in large quantities makes production much easier) to meet her demand and obtain higher earning for her household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and cheese for chipa (warm bagel-like bread with a cheesy center) baking.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Akua is a petty trader. She sells second-hand clothes. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Akua has been in business for over ten years and desires to give her business a face-lift. She therefore wants the loan to procure bales of textile goods.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes in bales

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Comfort is a petty trader. She sells second-hand footwear. Comfort hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for six years and desires to give her business a face-lift. She therefore wants the loan to procure goods in bulk to be able to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy used footwear for resale

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana, thirty-six years of age, is married and the mother of three children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing.

Joana is a petty trader. She sells bags of cement. She sells in a store by the roadside in her community. She procures her goods from Accra. According to Joana, she has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy bags of cement

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit M. was born in 1951 in Ijevan. She and her husband have 3 children who are already married and live separately from their parents. Anahit worked at Ijevan high school as a teacher till she retired on a pension. In 2001 she and her husband organized their own business in a rented space. This business consists of food and mixed product sales. During these years they have built up their own shop and have bought furniture for their house.

Anahit’s shop has a reputation in Ijevan of having the cheapest products for retail and wholesale purchasing. Anahit asks for a 900.000 AMD loan to buy food wholesale and New Year's tree decorations for her shop. With future income she intends to do some construction on her house.

loans.use: To buy wholesale food and New Year's tree decorations for her shop

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is thirty-nine years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Vida is a petty trader. She sells second-hand footwear. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Vida has been in business for three years and desires to give her business a face-lift. She therefore wants the loan to procure goods in bulk to be able to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy used footwear for resale

loans.name: Good Member Group

texts.en:
This is a group of small-scale entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They formed themselves into a group they named 'Good Members' in order to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders through SMT. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, sales and level of income will improve so that they can better support themselves and their children.

On the left of the photo is Adama J., the leader of this group of four. Adama was born in Magburaka town about forty years ago. She is married to a businessman and they have five children. Their children are attending secondary and primary schools respectively.

Adama J. sells fresh fish and supplies fresh fish to market women in Magburaka town. She has been doing business for approximately thirty years now. With her share of this loan, she will travel to Freetown and buy something like four cartons of fish. In Freetown; a carton usually costs her SLL 100,000.

loans.use: Buy four cartons of fish

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are all schooling. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.

Diana works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a fishmonger. She buys directly from the fishermen in her community, smokes the fish, and supplies to other retailers and food vendors. Diana has been in business for over twenty years and yearns to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is fifty-five years old and married. She is the mother of four children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment, in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. Her community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana, so the most common occupation there is fishing. Millicent is a trader. She runs a provision store by the side of the road in the community. She procures her goods from Accra. Millicent has been in business for over twenty years, and she would like a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Saphaqui Group

texts.es:
Tejido de prendas de vestir (mantas), venta de comida (ceviche, salchicha), atención de cabinas telefónicas, taller de mecánica, costura de chamarras, son los diferentes negocios a las cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Saphaqui.  Este grupo desarrollan sus reuniones en el Centro Focal Los Andes con el apoyo y orientación de su asesora de créditos, desean invertir en sus negocios  comprando herramientas de trabajo, tela, papa al por mayor y otros.
Ellas esperan estar mucho tiempo con la familia de Pro Mjer hasta lograr ahorros considerables que les permita reinvertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The members of the Saphaqui group are involved in many different businesses including knitting articles of clothing (blankets), selling food (ceviche, salchicha), operating a telephone kiosk and a mechanic garage and sewing jackets. This group develops their meetings in the Los Andes Center with the help and guidance of their loan advisor. They hope to invest in their businesses by buying tools, fabric, potatoes and more. They hope to be with the Pro Mujer family for a long time, until they earn considerable savings that allows them to reinvest in their business

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools of the trade and groceries

loans.name: God Provides Group

texts.en:
These are a group of small-scale entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They formed themselves into a group they named 'God Provides' in order to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders through SMT. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, sales and level of income will improve so that they can better support themselves and their children.

On the left in the photo is Fatmata S., the leader of this group of four. Fatmata was born in Freetown thirty years ago. She is married to a gold miner and they have two children plus one foster child. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School I, another is in JSS II, and the other is in Primary School I.

Fatmata sells rice, groundnuts, fish, palm oil, and cigarettes. She has been doing business for seven years now. With her share of the loan, she will invest in a new business, selling slippers/flip-flops. Fatmata wants to invest in this business because of the high demand for shoes in this Christmas month of festivity.

loans.use: Buy dozens of slippers/flip-flops

loans.name: Promise #2 Group

texts.en:
Amelia B. is a leader of a group of two borrowers called Promise #2. She is married with five children aged 11 to 27 years old; their educational levels range from fifth grade to university. Amelia is a high school graduate and a nurse’s aide. She and her family live and work on Lawaza Road in Voinjama City, the capital of Lofa County and a bustling crossroads town before the Liberian civil war.

Besides working as a nurse’s aide, Amelia sells spare parts for motorcycles. She sells quality goods in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business. She has been in business for two years and hopes eventually to own her own store.

The bad road conditions and long distance from her wholesale source to her business site has been a problem for Amelia. She needs this loan to invest in and improve her business. She dreams of each and every one in her family going into business as she has done.

loans.use: To invest in her motorcycle parts business.

loans.name: He Lives Group

texts.en: Isaac is 46 years old. He is married and has four children, all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in the country. As a result, the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing. Isaac operates a sawmill in his community. He is the leader of a trust bank group called He Lives. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Isaac is seated in the middle in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Tamara A. was born in 1961 in Ijevan. She is married and has a 28-year-old son. Tamara works at the Armenian post office as a postman. She also has her own business trading fruits and vegetables in Ijevan market. Tamara’s son helps her in this business. Thanks to this business, they can provide their family’s needs. She needs a 350.000-AMD loan to buy citrus for her business. With the future income, she plans to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: To buy citrus to sell

loans.name: Malachi Group

texts.en: Theresa is 55 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in the country. As a result, the major occupation of the people is fishing. Theresa runs a provision store. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Malachi. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities. They are requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk for her store

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en: Fatmata K. (right) is approximately thirty-seven years old. She is the leader of this group called 'Hope To God'. She and her group members are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone, who want a loan of Le 800,000 each to boost their businesses. Their leader, Fatmata K. is married with five children – three of whom are attending school. She sells palm oil and has been in this business for about twenty-seven years now. Fatmata will use this loan to improve her business. She will buy fifty gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: Buy fifty gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet S. is 32 years old. He lives in Lusadzor village, Ijevan area with his wife and two children. Hamlet works as a machine-operator and he works on his farm. He has two cows and three pigs. Hamlet thinks that the most profitable farm work is pig feeding and selling. Hamlet’s works is very hard, and at the same time, it is very profitable. He needs a loan of 800.000 AMD to buy fodder for his farm animals and to buy four or five pigs to fatten and sell. With the future income, he intends to build a big cowshed and pigsty for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy fodder and four or five pigs

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el  inicio del presente comité fue la señora  Laura P. quien se informo del programa, organizaron e invito a sus amigas y vecinas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La sra. Lidia Melgarejo se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería, invirtió el dinero en la compra ropas, remeras, zapatillas, zapatos, lencerías, etc, logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de mercaderías  a sus clientes.

La Sra. Laura P. se dedica a venta de ropas en , invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías  en general logrando de modo a tener variedad de prendas de vestir par a sus clientes.

La Sra. Ramona Villalba Benítez se dedica a la venta de lencería, invirtió el dinero en la compra de Lencería en  general de manera que pueda ofrecer buena variedad y calidad a sus clientes.

La Sra. Maria Victoria Benítez  se dedica a la recolección de plásticos, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo  con el objetivo de facilitar la venta  de  mas plásticos y así aumentar sus ingresos.

La Sra. Leonarda R. se dedica a la venta de remedios refrescantes, invirtió su dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías en general, logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de remedios refrescantes a sus clientes.

La Sra. Vanessa Noemi O. se dedica a la venta de lencería, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías  en  general de manera que pueda ofrecer buena variedad y calidad a sus clientes.
 
La Sra. Magdalena Cáceres se dedica a la venta de comestibles bebidas, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestibles bebidas para ofrecer buen servicio a sus clientes. 

La Sra. Zulma L. se dedica a venta de ropas en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ropas en general logrando asi ofrecer buena variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes.
La sra. Petrona B.  se dedica a la venta de comestibles, invirtio el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboracion de los comestibles, logrando de ese modo ofrecer variedad de minutas a sus clientes.

La sra. Sindulfa L. se dedica a la costura invirtio el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( hilos, tijera, tela, accesorios, etc.) logrando de ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad de prenda a sus clientes.

La sra. Alberta M. se dedica a venta de ropas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de ropas en general logrando asi ofrecer buena variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

La sra. Gladis S. posee un kiosco, invirtio el dinero en la compra de panificados, bebidas, lacteos, embutidos, logrando asi ofrecer buena variedad  de minutas y mercaderias a sus clientes.

La sra. Dionisia B. se dedica a venta de ropas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de ropas en general logrando asi ofrecer buena variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

La sra. Maria Rossana E. se dedica a la frutas, invirtio el dinero en la compra de frutas en general, logrando de ese modo ofrece buena variedad de frutas a su clientela.

La sra. Francisca V. se dedica a venta de ropas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de ropas en general logrando asi ofrecer buena variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes.   
  
La sra. Myrian Vazquez se dedica a venta de ropas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de ropas en general logrando asi ofrecer buena variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

La sra. Lilian Melissa O. se dedica a la venta de sabanas, invirtio el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( accesorios, tela, cintas, etc.) logrando asi ofrecer gran variedad de sabanas a su clientela.

La sra. Veronica G. se dedica a venta de ropas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de ropas en general logrando asi ofrecer buena variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes.
La Sra. Maria Isabel O. se dedica a venta de ropas en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ropas en general logrando así ofrecer buena variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

La Sra. G. M.  se dedica a la venta de lencería,e invirtió el l crédito en compra de mercaderías para contar con mayor cantidad de mercaderías.

La Sra. Luisa M.  se dedica a venta de ropas en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ropas para renovar y contar con mas variadas prendas de la temporada.

La Sra. Ana Alicia E. se dedica a la venta de bijuoteri, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( accesorios, goma y cintas para cabello, etc. ) logrando de ese modo ofrecer variedad a su clientela.
texts.en:
Ms. Laura P. started this group when she learned of the program organization. She invited her friends and neighbors to become part of the “Committee of Enterprising Women.” Ms. Lidia Melgarejo sells general clothing items. She used her money to buy clothing, t-shirts, ladies’ pumps, shoes, linen goods, etc. This way she is able to offer a good variety of items to her customers. Ms. Laura P. sells clothing. She used her money to buy general clothing items and is able to offer her customers a variety of items. Ms. Ramona Villalba Benitez sells linen goods. She used her money to buy general linen goods and is able to offer a variety of good quality items to her customers. Ms. Maria Victoria Benítez sells plastic items. She used her money to buy tools of the trade so that she can increase her sales and income. Ms. Leonara R. sells refreshments. She used her money to buy more items so that she can offer her customers a good variety. Ms. Vanessa Noemi O. sells linen items. She used her money to buy general merchandise so that she could offer her customers a good variety of items. Ms. Magdalena C. sells food and drinks. She used her money to buy ingredients to make the food and drinks so that she could offer good service to her customers. Ms. Zulma L. sells general clothing items. She used her money to buy items so that she can offer a good variety to her customers. Ms. Petrona B. sells food. She used her money to buy ingredients and was able to offer greater variety to her customers. Ms. Sindulfa L. is a seamstress. She used her money to buy materials for her work (string, scissors, cloth, accessories, etc), allowing her to offer a greater variety of garments to her customers. Ms. Alberta M. sells general clothing items. She used her money to buy more items, allowing her to offer more variety to her customers. Ms. Gladis S. has a food kiosk. She used her money to buy baked goods, drinks, milk products, and cold cuts, allowing her to offer a good variety of food and merchandise to her customers. Ms. Dionisia B. sells general clothing items. She used her money to buy clothing items so she could offer a good variety of garments to her customers. Ms. Maria Rossana E. sells fruit. She used her money to buy fruit in order to offer greater variety to her customers. Ms. Francisca V. sells general clothing items. She used her money to buy clothing items so she could offer a good variety of garments to her customers. Ms. Myrian Vazquez sells general clothing items. She used her money to buy clothing items so she could offer a good variety of garments to her customers. Ms. Lilian Melissa O. sells bed sheets. She used her money to buy materials for her work (accessories, cloth, laces, etc) allowing her to offer a greater variety of sheets to her customers. Ms. Veronica G. sells general clothing items. She used her money to buy clothing items so she could offer a good variety of garments to her customers. Ms. Maria Isabel O. sells general clothing items. She used her money to buy clothing items so she could offer a good variety of garments to her customers. Ms. Gabriela M. sells linen goods. She used her loan money to buy items so that she could offer a greater variety of merchandise. Ms. Luisa M. sells general clothing items. She used her money to buy clothing to refresh her inventory and offer a greater variety of garments for the season. Ms. Ana Alicia Espinosa sells various arts and crafts. She used her money to buy materials for her work (accessories, glue, hair laces, etc) allowing her to offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of garments, drinks, meats, sausages, baked goods, herbs, cooking oil, candy, vegetables, fruits, treats, milk products, merchandise, sewing supplies, string, scissors, clothing items, cleaning products, leather, glue, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Famous Group

texts.en: Josephine is 38 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, both in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in the country. As a result, the major occupation of the people is fishing. Josephine trades in printed fabrics. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Famous. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities. They request a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford. Josephine is in the middle of the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en:
Liliane is 38 years old, married with two children and she takes care of four dependents. The children and dependents are aged between 11 and 22 years old. Her husband works full-time as a government agent. Liliane’s family lives in Rwamagana, a region in the Eastern Province of Rwanda, which is approximately a two hour drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Liliane has been in business for the past four years selling scholastic materials such as books, pens, pencils, mathematical tools, etc. She employs two people and the business’s working hours are from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Liliane is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a photocopier for her business. This new tool in her business will help her provide services on demand in her hometown.  Liliane is hoping to earn more profits from her business as a result of the new service provided which will help in getting more food for her family as well as enabling her to continue paying school fees for her children and dependents.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier for her business

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is 45 years old. She is married and has seven children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Aba is a trader. She trades in cosmetics. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Aba has been in business for six years and desires to expand her business. She wants the loan to procure many kinds of cosmetics – body spray, cream, pomade, etc., in bulk.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Kori Chuyma Group

texts.es:
Candida Clara de 47 años, trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 15 años aproximadamente, indica que empezó a vender masitas desde que se ha endeudado, ya que antes solo se dedicaba a las labores de casa, con el pasar del tiempo ha logrado poner una tienda donde vende masitas frente al hospital Holandés, ella tiene 3 hijos quienes le ayudan en el negocio. Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal Kory Chuyma también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de productos lácteos, atención de snack o kiosco, venta de cosméticos, ferretería y chapería.

Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios  comprando insumos, productos y  mercadería.
texts.en:
Candida Clara is 47 years old and has worked with Pro Mujer for approximately 15 years. She began selling cookies in order to get out of the debt she accrued when she was only doing housework. With the passing of time she has succeeding in creating a store where she sells cookies in front of the Holandés hospital. She has three children who help with the business. The other members of the Kory Chuyma Communal Association also have their own businesses involving things such as selling dairy products, managing a stall or kiosk, selling cosmetics, running a hardware store and auto bodywork repairs. They all need the loan in order to invest in their businesses by buying raw materials, products and merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials, products and merchandise

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is 29 years old, is married with two children, and takes care of two dependents. Both the children and dependents are aged between 4 and 8 years old. Benon and his family live in the Rwamagana district, which is approximately a one-and-a-half hour drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

For the past two years, Benon has been in the business of selling packed foodstuffs that include soft drinks, cheese, sardines, etc.. He employs one person as an assistant in his daily business activities and the working hours are 6 a.m. to 7 p.m.

Benon is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase a fridge to be used in keeping his products safe and for a longer period. With these new funds, he hopes to provide quality goods to his customers and thus satisfy their needs.

Benon also plans to save a portion of his profits earned, and reinvest the rest in his business expansion. In addition, he will be getting more food for his family.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for his store

loans.name: United Trading Center Group

texts.en:
Mr. Anthony A. is a leader of a group of 2 borrowers called United Trading center. He is married with 3 children aged 12 to 25 years old, and their educational level that they have reached is the 3rd through the 12th grades.

Mr. Anthony's educational level is a Bachelor degree in Basic Education. He and his children lives downtown Voinjama city, and he works in the Voinjama central market, in the capital of Lofa county, in northern Liberia. His business is the sales of palm oil. He buys oil by the gallons and sells in the Voinjama central market. Mr. Anthony has been running this business for 3 years, and he is hoping to improve to become an international businessman. He is regular with his customers and sells quality oil in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing his business. Anthony needs this loan to buy and sell more palm oil on an export basis.

He dreams of being a great help to the family!

loans.use: To buy and sell more palm oil on export basis.

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: A. Anna est née le 25 Juillet 1962 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Anna vit depuis 12 ans à Sègbèya, un quartier de Cotonou. Mariée à D'ALMEIDA Bernard, Anna est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Cependant, Anna vit seulement avec deux enfants, en plus de son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Anna n'a fait que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Anna vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs, accompagné de sauce, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Anna s'approvisionne. Anna exerce cette activité depuis environs 15 ans. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de l'institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Anna désire élever davantage le niveau de son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Anna sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Anna A. was born on 25 July 1962 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Anna has lived for 12 years in Sègbèya, an area in Cotonou. Married to Bernard D'Almeida, Anna is the mother of five children, all of whom are in school. However, Anna lives with only two children, as well as her husband. The couple provide for the family together. Anna only attended primary school. To meet her needs, Anna sells food (rice, maize paste accompanied with sauce, etc.) at her home. It is at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, that Anna gets her supplies. Anna has run this business for around 15 years. She is a longstanding client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), having already obtained two loans through the institution, both of which were repaid properly. Anna wants to further raise the level of her business and better satisfy her clientele. This is the reason why Anna is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and maize, cans of peanut oil, and sauce condiments (tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc.)

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba is a 48-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Abiba, like many other women in the community, works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and supplies kenkey (a local specialty). She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. Abiba has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk so she can supply to more customers to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es: Ana Delmy R. C. de 33 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad. Ella posee una venta de pollo en el mercado Municipal del Transito, en el cual hace más de cinco años trabaja vendiendo su producto. Ella desea poder comprar mayor cantidad de pollos sobre todo para esta temporada navideña en la cual las personas utilizan el pollo para las cenas navideñas. Es por esta razón que ana Delmy solicita un préstamo a  través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más pollo. Milagro es una mujer muy responsable la cual desea el bienestar de su familia y es por esto que se esfuerza día con día.
texts.en:
Ana Delmy R. C., age 33, resides in the department of San Miguel and lives with her husband and two children, ages 7 and 2. She owns a stall selling poultry in the market in the municipal bus terminal, where she has been working for more than 5 years. She wishes to buy a greater quantity of chicken, especially for the Christmas season when people buy more chicken for Christmas dinner. For this reason Ana Delmy is requesting a loan which will provide her sufficient capital to buy more poultry. She is a very responsible woman who wants to provide for the well being of her family and that's why she works hard day after day.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is 36 years old. She is divorced and has two children who are both in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Fati is a trader. She trades in secondhand footwear, dress bags, head gear and heats, etc. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Fati has been in business for seven years and desires to give her business a facelift. She therefore wants the loan to procure goods in bulk to be able to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy footwear, headwear, etc. for resale

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
“27 de mayo” es un grupo de 13 señoras que pertenecen al Centro Focal Alto Lima, así, Isabel F. es la Presidenta, como Tesorera está Anna E. y como Secretaria de Actas es  Dannia F., las tres organizan a sus compañeras para llevar adelante su reunión, guiados por un orden del día.
Todas tienen diferentes negocios de comercialización, es decir, compra y venta de productos, producción y servicio y necesitan una vez más el crédito para invertir en sus negocios y generar ingresos para sus familias ya que la mayoría tiene en promedio 3 a 4 hijos, además a ellas les gusta el consultorio porque tienen la oportunidad de cuidar su salud y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The "27 de Mayo" group is made up of 13 women who are in the Alto Lima Focal Center. Isabel F. is the group leader, Anna E. is treasurer, and Dannia F. is recording secretary. The three of them draw up the order of the day for their meetings. Each is involved in different lines of work: commerce, production, service. They, once again, need financing to invest in their businesses in order to generate earnings for their families since they have an average of 3-4 children, each. Besides, they like the health office because it provides them with an opportunity to care for their own and their family's health.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and merchandise.

loans.name: Karanday Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Karanday del barrio Isla Aveiro de la ciudad de Limpio, se formó con integrantes del comité Restaurador del Asentamiento El Bosque Restaurador, las mismas decidieron formar un nuevo grupo con vecinas mas cercanas, actualmente el comité se encuentra en el tercer ciclo, es un grupo muy unido y esta conformado por 16 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Lucia M. se dedica a la venta de carnes e invirtió el dinero en la compra de carnes al por mayor para el incremento de sus negocios.
 
La señora Teofila L. se dedica a la venta de lencería y es costurera e invirtió el dinero en la compra de ropas interiores para damas y telas para la elaboración de prendas para su venta posterior.

La señora Gilda C. se dedica a la panadería e invirtió el dinero en la compra insumos para la elaboración de panificados e incrementar con ventas de pan de navidad para aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.

La señora Clara R. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras e invirtió el dinero en la compra de los mismos al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio, provechando la temporada.

La señora Juana R. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de productos varios tales como remeras, busos, short, pantalón, blusas, entre otros.

La señora Zulma F. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de productos varios tales como remeras, busos, short, pantalón, blusas, entre otros.
 
La señora Antonia Duré se dedica a la venta de juegos artificiales e invirtió el dinero en la compra de estos productos para aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.

La señora Mariana Fernández tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías varias para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Jorgelina D. se dedica a la venta de perfumes e invirtió el dinero en la compra de perfumes para su venta posterior.

La señora Fidelina Fernández se dedica a la venta de verduras e invirtió el dinero en la compra de productos varios al por mayor para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Gladys Z. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías varias para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Nancy V. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías varias para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Carmen Baéz se dedica a la venta de comestibles e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora María V. se dedica a la venta de bebidas e invirtió el dinero en la compra gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor para su venta.

La señora Elizabeth O. se dedica a la venta de helados e invirtió el dinero en la compra helados de sabores varios al por mayor para su venta.

La señora Valeria L. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de productos varios tales como remeras, busos, short, pantalón, blusas, entre otros.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Karanday” committee, located in the Isla Aveiro neighborhood in the city of Limpio, was founded by members of the rebuilding committee in charge of the housing project “El Bosque Restaurador”. The members decided to create a new group with women who live closer to each other. This very close group is composed by 16 female members who invest in different activities. Lucia M. sells meat and she used the money to buy meat in bulk to expand her business. Teofila L. sells underwear and she’s also a seamstress. She used the money to buy lady’s underwear and fabric to make clothing for sell. Gilda C. is a baker. She used the money to buy supplies to make bread and related products, so she can increase her sales during the Christmas and New Year’s season. Clara R. sells fruit and vegetables. She used the money to buy products in bulk, to expand her business taking advantage of the season. Juana R. sells clothes. She used the money to purchase several products, such as tops, hoodies, shots, pants, T-shirts, and others. Zulma F. sells clothes. She used the money to purchase several products, such as tops, hoodies, shots, pants, T-shirts, and others. Duré sells fireworks. She used the money to purchase these items and take advantage of the holiday season. Mariana Fernández owns a grocery shop. She used the money to purchase items to expand her business. Jorgelina D. sells perfumes. She used the money to purchase there items for sale. Fidelina Fernández sells vegetables. She used the money to purchase products in bulk and improve her sales. Gladys Z. owns a grocery shop. She used the money to purchase items to expand her business. Nancy V. owns a grocery shop. She used the money to purchase items to expand her business. Carmen Baéz sells food. She used the money to buy raw material to make and sell these products. María V. sells drinks. She used the money to buy soft drinks and beer in bulk for sale. Elizabeth O. sells ice cream. She used the money to purchase different flavors in bulk for sale. Valeria L. sells clothes. She used the money to purchase several products, such as tops, hoodies, shots, pants, T-shirts, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, T-shirts, lady's underwear, flour, fruit, vegetables, hoodies, pants, fireworks, milk, pasta, bread, napkins, oil, soft drinks, beer, ice cream, and others.

loans.name: Celia Deisy

texts.es: Celia Deisy H. S. de 47 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, junto a su hijo. Ella elabora y vende comida en su casa, de esta manera las personas llegan a su casa a comprar los alimentos, ya sean por encargo o no. Celia es muy solicitada por su comida debido al delicioso saber y a la amabilidad con la que ella recibe a sus clientes. Celia solícita un préstamo ya que su mayor anhelo es poder compra mayor cantidad de granos básico de manera que al comprar al por mayor, pueda obtener las comprar de estas a menor precio.
texts.en:
Celia Deisy H. S. is 47 years old. She lives in the municipality of Soyapango, with her son. She makes and sells food at home. This way, people go to her house to purchase her products, some of them even pre-ordered. Celia is very popular due to her tasty food and her kindness at the time of receiving her customers. Celia is requesting for a loan to buy basic grains in bulk, to get a better price of the raw material she uses.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 68-year-old divorced mother of seven children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Sarah works hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (a local specialty). She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She has been in business for over 40 years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Laurence

texts.fr: K. Laurence est née le 11 Août 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. il y a environs 9 ans que Laurence réside au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou. Mariée à GOUTON Guillaume, Laurence est mère de trois enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Sègbèya. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Laurence  n'a fait que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et aider son mari, Laurence  vend de la bouillie (de mil, de "tapioka", fait à base de manioc, et de "akpan" fait à base d'amidon de maïs). Laurence mène cette activité depuis environs 6 ans et vend sa bouillie dans son quartier. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Laurence s'approvisionne. Laurence a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, et a bien remboursés ces crédits. Laurence a actuellement quelques difficultés financières et désire renforcer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Laurence sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Laurence K. was born on 11 August 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For about 9 years, Laurence has lived in the Sègbèya area of Cotonou. Married to Guillaume Gouton, Laurence is the mother of three children. All of the children are in school and live together with their parents in Sègbèya. The couple provide for the family together. Laurence only attended primary school. To meet her needs and help her husband, Laurence sells 'bouillie' (made of millet, tapioca - made from manioc, and 'akpan' - made from maize starch). Laurence has run this business for about 6 years and sells her bouillie in her area. It is at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, that Laurence gets her supplies. Laurence has already obtained three loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and repaid these loans properly. Laurence is currently having some financial difficulties and wants to strengthen her business in order to better satisfy her clientele. This is why Laurence is seeking a fourth loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy maize, millet, tapioca, cartons of milk, and sugar

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es: Gloria Patricia H. D. L. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango. Vive junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Debido a la difícil situación económica su esposo decidió irse a los Estados Unidos, lugar en el cual espera encontrar un buen trabajo. Gloria posee una venta D. ropa para dama, así también zapatos para adultos y niños. Gloria solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para poder comprar ropa y zapatos al por mayor D. manera que pueda obtener precios más bajos. Esto lo hace con el fin D. poder brindar mayor cantidad D. productos D. diferentes tallas y colores y así mismo poder brindar un poco más barato su producto, D. manera que sus ventas aumenten y ella pueda seguir adelante junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria Patricia H. D. L. is thirty-five years old, she lives in the municipality of Soyapango. She lives with her three young children who are in school. Due to the difficult economic situation her husband decided to go to the United States, where he hopes to find good work. Gloria has a women's clothing shop, where she also sells shoes for adults and children. Gloria sought a loan in order to obtain the money necessary to buy clothes and shoes at wholesale prices. She does this in order to be able to proviD. a variety of sizes and colors, and she is also able to lower the price of her products in order to increase her sales and continue to do well with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Ana Rubia

texts.es: Ana Rubia R. G. de 29 años de edad, reside en Ataco en el departamento de Ahuchapán. Vive junto a sus padres. Ella posee una venta de ropa desde hace diez años, negocio el cual le ha permitido brindarle ayuda a sus padres. Ana solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de ropa en diferentes tallas y colores, ella desea poder aumentar su inventario en estos días del mes para poder aprovechar la temporada navideña y de fin de años en las cuales la venta de ropa se aumenta, es con esta intención que ella solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Ana Rubia is 29 years old, she lives in Ataco in the department of Ahuchapán with her parents. Ana has had a clothing shop for ten years which her parents helped her to establish. Ana seeks a loan so that she can buy a large amount of clothes in different sizes and colors. She hopes to be able to increase her inventory at this time of the month so she can take advantage of the Christmas season and the end of the year when clothing sales rise, this was why she sought a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a clothing in a variety of colores and styles

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca A. esta casada con el Sr. Justo Pastor Montiel desde hace mas de cinco años, con quien tuvo dos hijos.
El Sr. Justo es empleado público mientras que la señora Francisca se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropas y joyas utilizando su vehículo como medio de transporte para realizar sus ventas. Con el crédito de la Fundación Paraguaya aumentó su inventario de mercaderías a fin de poder cubrir los pedidos de clientes que en su mayor parte son asalariados de entidades públicas como privadas.
texts.en:
Señora Francisca A. has been married to Justo Pastor Montiel for more than five months, they live with their two children. Señor Justo is a public employee and Francisca sells clothing and jewelry, using her vehicle to transport her goods and to make sales. With the loan that she receives from Fundación Paraguaya she increased her inventory of merchandise so that she can fulfill the requests of her clients, the majority of whom are employees of public and private organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry, and general merchandise (shirts, skirts, lingerie)

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a 28-year-old married mother of one child who is in school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Vida works hard to be able to provide for the son. She is a seamstress by profession and a baker as well. She bakes bread and supplies to retailers. She buys bags of flour from nearby towns. Vida has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano R. R. de 45 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Vive junto a su madre. El posee una carpintería en su propia casa, negocio en el cual trabaja por encargos y así mismo realiza trabajos por su propia cuenta para poder ponerlos en venta. Feliciano solícita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar más madera para la elaboración de su trabajo. El es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable el cual goza de muy buena reputación y es por esta razón por la cual el cuenta con mucho clientes.
texts.en:
Feliciano R. R. is 45 years old, he lives in the department of Ahuachapán with his mother. He has a wood shop in his house, he takes on commissions or builds his own pieces of furniture and sells them. Feliciano asked for a loan to be able to buy more wood so that he can continue working. He is a very hard working and responsible person and he has a very good reputation and because of this he has a lot of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for furniture making

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Elizabeth works hard to support her husband to provide for the children. She is a food vendor. She sells doughnuts. Elizabeth buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Edith Damienne

texts.fr: H. Edith Damienne est née le 26 Septembre 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Edith Damienne vit depuis 20 ans à Hlacomey à Cotonou. Mariée à ABDOUL Bissi, Edith Damienne est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Edith Damienne vit seul avec son enfant et supporte seule les charges de la maison. Edith Damienne a été à l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de son enfant, Edith Damienne mène comme activité, la vente de tissu. Edith Damienne mène cette activité par le système de distribution. Edith Damienne vend également des habits pour adultes. C'est à Lomé au Togo que Edith Damienne s'approvisionne. Edith Damienne a 10 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine. Edith Damienne a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et l'a bien remboursé. Afin de développer plus son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de ses clients, Edith Damienne sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Edith Damienne is born September 28, 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Edith Damienne has since been living in Hlacomey in Cotonou for 20 years. Married to ABDOUL Bissi, Edith Damienne is the mother of a child in school. Edith Damienne lives alone with her child and provide solely for the expenses of the house. Edith Damienne has up to secondary education. To meet her needs and those of her child, Edith is engaged in the sale of material as a business. She does this business through the distribution system. She also sells adults' clothes. She gets her supplies in Lome, Togo. Edith Damienne has 10 years of experience in this sector of business. Edith Damienne already had a loan once from ALIDe and repaid it correctly. In order to grow more her business and to better meet the requests of her clients, Edith Damienne is requesting a second loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es: Sonia Maribel S. V. reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 16 y 12 años de edad, del los cuales el mayor trabaja y estudia, mientras que los menores estudian y le ayudan a su madre a atender el negocio. Sonia posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, los cuales los comercializa desde hace 9 años. Sonia es una mujer la cual se esfuerza mucho por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijo, no solo en lo económico sino también se ha encargado de concientizar a sus hijos y guiarlos por el buen camino. Sonia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia Maribel S. V. lives in the department of Ahuachapán, she lives with her three children of 17, 16 and 12 years of age. Of the three children, the oldest works and goes to school and the younger two go to school and help their mom with the business. Sonia has a store of perishable and daily use items, she has had this market for nine years. Sonia is a strong woman who does her best to support her children, not only economically but also she advises her children and guides them along a good road. Sonia is seeking a loan so that she can resupply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishible items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 22-year-old single lady with no children. She lives with alone in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Mary works hard to be able to provide for herself. She is a trader. She trades in pastries. She prepares the pastries and supplies to retailers and snack bar operators in her community. She buys bags of flour from nearby towns. Mary has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Virginia Clara

texts.es:
Nuestra socia CLARA tiene 59 años es casada y tiene tres hijos que ya son independientes y ayudan a su mama. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la confección de chompas de forma artesanal. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio de venta de chompas y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las dificultades de la vida. La socia requiere el préstamo para adquirir más lana para confeccionar más chompas pues por estas fiestas navideñas es donde se vende más.             

La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “HUAYNA CCAPAC” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our associate, Clara, is 59 years old. She is married and has three grown children who help their mother. She alternates her time taking care of the household and making handcrafted sweaters. She has been selling sweaters for several years and she is doing well, thanks to the determination she gives to her work. Our associate is a hard working mother who moves her family forward despite life’s difficulties. She needs this loan to buy more wool yarn to make more sweaters. It’s during the Christmas season that her sales are highest. She is a part of the “HUAYNA CCAPAC comunal bank of the “Arariwa Cusco Provincial Association” of the Department of Cusco. She is thankful for this opportunity and pledges to repay this loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yarn to make sweaters

loans.name: Deisi Beatriz

texts.es: Deisi Beatriz L. D. J. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una venta D. ropa deportiva para hombres y mujeres, así mismo venD. ropa casual. Deisi solicita un préstamo a través del cual desea poder comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas y falda D. diferentes estilos y colores. Ella desea mucho poder aumentar sus ventas ya que desea poder brindarle mayor ayuda a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar y D. esta manera poder darles una mayor estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Deisi Beatriz is 32 years old and lives in Ahuachapán, along with her husband and two children. She sells men’s and women’s sports attire, as well as casual clothing. Deisi is requesting this loan so that she can invest in pants, blouses, shirts, and skirts of various styles and colors. She would really like to increase her sales and be able to help her husband more with the household expenses and be able to give her family more economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Marcial Enrique

texts.es: Marcial Enrique C. C. de 27 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su esposa, su hija y sus padres. Marcial posee un comedor, el cual cuenta con muy buena ubicación. En este negocio el trabaja junto a su madre elaborando la comida y sirviéndosela a sus clientes. Marcial es un hombre muy educado y atento el cual brinda un excelente servicio al cliente, razón por la cual muchas personas prefieren ir a comer a este negocio. El solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar carne, verduras, sodas y todos los productos de primera necesidad para la elaboración de la comida. Marcial con mucha esperanza espera iniciar este nuevo año con mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marcial Enrique is 27 years old and lives in Ahuachapán with his wife, daughter, and parents. Marcial has a small restaurant in a good location. He works this business with his mother, preparing the food and serving it to the customers. Marcial is a well educated, attentive man who gives excellent customer service. This is why many people like to eat at this restaurant. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy meats, vegetables, soft drinks, and other ingredients. Marcial hopes to bring in the new year with greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meats, vegetables, and food ingredients

loans.name: Asana

texts.en: Asana, thirty years of age, is married and mother of three children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist-attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing. Asana is a trader. She runs a provision store by the roadside in the community. She procures her goods from Accra. Asana has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions to resell

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is 28 years old, is single, and takes care of two relatives. He lives in Rwamagana, in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

Ignace runs a well-known cosmetics shop in Rwamagana which he has operated successfully for three years. He opted to do business in cosmetics because it is a very productive business. He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day of the week.

Ignace is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. He plans to use the loan to buy more cosmetics product in order to satisfy his customers’ growing demands and to attract more customers. He also plans to use a portion of the loan to buy a computer that will help him in the smooth running of his business.

If his plan works out, Ignace hopes to realize more profits than before, which he will reinvest in his business and better support his brothers by providing food and other basic requirements. He will also buy more computers for his growing business to facilitate quick and better services for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and a computer for his business

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a 47-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.
Ekua works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells rice with stew. She buys bags of rice from nearby towns. Ekua has been in business for nine years, and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Jeanina

texts.es: Jeanina F. N. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Ella como toda madre trabajadora la cual desea poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, posee una venta de frutas y verduras, productos los cuales vende mucho ya que ella es una persona muy amable la cual brinda precios justos para sus clientes. Jeanina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras y frutas de temporada y de esta manera aprovechar la temporada navideña para mejorar sus ganancias y de esta manera poder brindarles una mejor navidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jeanina F. N. is 30. She lives in the La Libertad department with her husband and three minor children. She, like all hard-working mothers, wants to give her children all of the necessities. She has a business selling fruit and vegetables. She sells a lot of these products because she is a very amiable person who offers her customers fair prices. Jeanina is asking for a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of vegetables and seasonal fruits. This way she will take advantage of the Christmas season to improve her earnings and be able to give her children a better Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia A. D. P. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, vive junto a su esposo y su hija D. 3 años D. edad. La señora Dora es una persona muy humilD. y trabajadora la cual desea seguir adelante y poder brindarle una vida mejor a su pequeña hija, es por esta razón que ella se esfuerza día con día elaborando comida típica salvadoreña, llamada platillos típicos, los cuales los venD. en las calles y así mismo venD. por encargo. Dora solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración D. la comida, así mismo desea poder comprar productos naviD.ños y poder venderlos.
texts.en:
Alicia A. D. P. is 34. She lives in the Usulután department with her husband and three year old daughter. Dora is a very hard-working and humble person. She wants to get ahead and be able to give her small daughter a better life. That is the reason she puts forth so much effort day to day making typical Salvadorian foods, which are called typical dishes. She sells them on the streets and by order. Dora is asking for a loan to be able to buy raw material to make the food. She also wants to be able to buy Christmas products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria O. tiene 34 años y es soltera. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de coco y maíz en forma ambulante en unos de los mercados mas grandes de la zona central(Mercado de Abasto de Asunción).
